loans.name: Jamila Riaz Hussain Group

texts.en:
"My name is Jamila and I operate an embroidery business in my native city of Borewala, Pakistan. I own a two-room brick house and have been living in it with my family for the past 10 years. I prepare embroidered dresses to save money for rainy days. My husband's name is R. H. and he deals with vegetables. He buys vegetables from the wholesale market and sells to the vegetable shops. He has been doing this work for the past five years. I am applying for a loan to buy vegetables to expand my husband’s vegetable-selling business."

Shamim A. baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring center. Rani baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local, three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn M. is from the city of Oroquieta City. She is 30 years old. Marlyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marlyn owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Marlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Kuanputun B1 Group

texts.en:
Adolof N. is the 46-year-old man who leads a group of 15 farmers - Kuanputun B1 - in Bone Village, Nekamese Sub District – Kupang District. Bone village has a beautiful view and there are many coconut, banana, and palm trees. This village has not been contaminated by air pollution, so the community can breathe fresh air. Most of community members of this village are originally from Timor and they usually speak Timorese in everyday conversation.

The villagers have backgrounds as breeders and farmers, raising cows, goats and pigs and cultivating rice fields, the latter fraught with the challenges posed by inconsistent water supplies and diseases. These challenges are also faced by Adolof and the other members of Kuanputun B1 Group.

Adolof is married and has four children. The children are: - Doni N., a 22-year-old high school graduate now attending the selection process to be in the army. - Jackson N., a 20-year-old high school still looking for a job and now spending his days helping his parents on the farm. - Melkior N., 16 years old in the third grade of Junior High School - Alwi N., 9 years old in the fourth grade of Elementary School.

Adolof and his wife are poor farmers but they are really responsible to their children. Even though they only generate a small income from their business, they always support and encourage their children to complete their schooling. For Adolof, education is important for their future.

Another difficulty that Adolof faces as a farmer is the availability of public transportation, which only operates three times a week, and the location of the market, which is situated about 37 km from Bone village, so their agricultural products cannot be sold faster. As a father of four children, Adolof wants to improve the living standard of his family, and the cattle-fattening program seems to offer the best prospect for achieving his goal. He is therefore requesting a loan of IDR 3,400,000 to buy young cattle to be fattened over a 12-month period. The other group members of Kuanputun B1 are also requesting the same loan, also hoping to improve their lives Note: Martinus was replaced by a family member when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
“A person without a goal doesn’t know his destination.” This is the guiding principle of Mercedes C. who is currently residing in Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Pablo and they are gifted with a son named Paul Jeremy who is 21 years old and is already in his junior year in college.
 
Farming is the main source of income for the couple. Mercedes’ husband manages their farm while she is maintaining her hog-raising business. Aside from being a businesswoman, she is also appointed as Barangay (district) secretary at their place. She is glad that they entrusted the task to her for she also loves serving other people. 

Mercedes wants to further improve her hog-raising business so that, with their rice and vegetable farming business, they will have a progressive living standard. To do this, Mercedes is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 from Kiva lenders for business maintenance, especially for her hog-raising business. She hopes that her son will soon finish his course in college in order to have a brighter future.

loans.use: To use as additional capital

location.town: Barangay Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with a daughter. She lives in Kherson and runs her small business selling outer clothing items in the central market of her home town. Tatyana is very disciplined and organized. She managed to start her business from scratch and see it grow and develop in the last 6 years. Presently, she has about 20,000 Grivnyas invested in her business. Her monthly income is about 9,000 Grivnyas. 

Tatyana is seeking a loan of 7,300 Grivnyas to increase assorted merchandise for further retail sale in her kiosk. She is hoping to keep her venture running to secure stable income and meet all the needs of her family of three.

loans.use: to increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Labour And Achieve Group

texts.en:
Labour and Achieve, led by Massia K., is a group of five borrowers living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Massia is 41 years old and is married with six children age 7 to 30. She also cares for two children who were orphaned in the war. Her younger children are in school. Massia herself was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. Massia lives in the remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia.

Massia’s business is retail dry goods, including oil, rice, salt, etc., which she buys wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall on the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has run her business for three years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers.

Massia is taking the loan to increase her inventory to meet increased demand. Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business she dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: To purchase oil, rice, and salt to increase her inventory

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth A. is a native of the island village in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She believes that the will and the way to get out from poverty must be anchored with industry and hard work.  She is married to Victor who is 45 years old and a fisherman. She is a mother to six; four sons and two daughters.
 She and her husband are partners in their fishing business. She has been doing it for twenty three years already and her major source of livelihood. This is her primary business. Aside from fishing, she is also doing the vegetable and dried fish vending as her secondary business. She wanted to invest more on her businesses.
She became of ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) member, an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2009. When she received her first loan, she was given hope to improve her business. And now on her second loan, she proposes a loan of 10,000 PHP as additional capital for her fishing business and part will go to her secondary business. The loan will be used to pay for 1 bundle fishnet, fingerlings, and part of the amount will go to her secondary business.
She is hopeful that with the help of ASHI and trust of KIVA lenders, she can improve her business and can slowly reach her aspiration to get out from poverty. She also dreams of sending all of her children to school until they finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: To pay for 1 bundle fishnet, fingerlings, and part of the amount will go to her secondary business.

loans.name: Pharoth

texts.en:
Mrs. Pharoth U., 32, and her husband, Mr. Sambath Chea, 38, have been married since 1990 but have no children yet. The couple live along National Road Number One approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Pharoth is shown in the photo with her mother.

Pharoth has been a garment factory worker for about ten years, while her husband has been a construction worker for about twenty years. Pharoth is able to earn about $80 a month and her husband is able to earn 20,000 riel (about $5) per day. 

The couple is in the process of building a new house to live in, but the house isn’t finished yet. So Pharoth is asking for a loan of $1,000 in order to finish it.

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Babyruth

texts.en: This is Babyruth Jabiñar, a businesswoman from Pasay City. Her husband, Epifanio, 38, works overseas. They have four children: one is in college, two are in high school, and the youngest is in grade school. Babyruth’s general store is very new – it started four months ago yet is already earning close to P20,000 a month. She sells different accessories. She hires one youngster to attend to her business. Babyruth became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005. She has applied for a new loan of P21,000 to beef-up her store by stocking more accessories to sell. It has always been her aim to send her child to college and that is why she has been working hard day and night. She also wishes to put up a computer shop soon. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
S. is a 27-year-old married mother who currently lives in Kompong Tom province in Cambodia. She is married with two school-aged kids.

S. is a Khmer cake seller from her home, selling the cake that she produces there. Another source of family income comes from her husband's sales of rattan (thin, pliable stems of palm, used to make furniture).

Because selling rattan is a profitable business for the family, S. requested a loan to provide additional capital for her husband’s rattan-selling business.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her husband's rattan-selling business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda D. is from the village of Purok, Pag-asa Salawagan. She is 29 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business selling a variety of products like rice and cigarettes in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $110 a month from these activities.

In 1998, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which again will be used as working capital to purchase additional inventory. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Eyeda

texts.en:
Eyeda J. is currently in the business of importing clothes from Uganda and selling them in South Sudan and is requesting a loan to import bedsheets and pillows to sell. Eyeda is 24 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase a sewing machine and open a shop. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: import bedsheets and pillows to sell

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline, age 38, runs a grocery store, selling groceries at retail prices to her customers. She is married with three children and lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is a client of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

Roseline loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers, and she dreams of eventually owning a supermarket. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Yader Antonio

texts.es: El señor Yader Antonio S. L., se dedica a las actividades de trabajo de campo al cultivo de granos básicos frijol y maíz, también al cuido de ganado, este crédito lo utilizara para la compra de media manzana de terreno con condiciones para el cultivo de granos como frijol y maíz, el tiene una parte de dienro con el financiamiento ajustara para la compra de este terreno, Yader S. L. comenzó a trabajar con el apoyo de sus padres quienes le dieron como herencia una pequeña propiedad de ½ manzana de terreno donde hiso su casa para vivir con su esposa desde entonces comenzó  con esfuerzo propio y financiamientos por parte de Ceprodel a cultivar granos básicos como frijol y maíz únicamente en épocas de invierno, todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a este tipo de trabajo teniendo experiencia ya que antes él le ayudaba a sus padres al trabajo de campo. El señor Yader S. L. es casado y tiene una hija menor de edad, únicamente su esposa es quien le ayuda a las labores de trabajo. El señor Yader tiene 4 años de trabajar con el apoyo de Ceprodel y el impacto que ha tenido es bastante bueno porque con los financiamientos que él ha recibido a comprado 3 manzanas de tierras lo que le ha permitido tener mas aéreas para cultivar este grano que es un rubro muy importante en nuestra economía y de esta forma ha venido mejorando su forma de vivir.
texts.en:
Yader Antonio S. L. farms beans and corn; he also raises cattle. He will use this funding to buy land suitable for planting beans and corn. He has part of the money already and the financing will make up the difference. Yader S. L. started farming with the support of his parents, who willed him a small, 1/2-manzana (about 0.8 acre), plot of land where he built his house and where he has lived with his wife ever since. He began with his own efforts and financial help from Ceprodel to grow beans and corn only during the Winter. He has always been in this line of work since he got experience in it helping his parents. He is married and has one minor daughter; his wife helps him with his work. He has cooperated with Ceprodel for about 4 years and the impact this has had has been very good because the loans have allowed him to buy 3 manzanas of land. This has allowed for larger cultivation area of this basic grain that is such an integral part of our economy. This has meant a better way of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farmland.

loans.name: The Women's Bank Of Entrepreneurs Of Chilamate Group

texts.en:
“The Women's Bank of Entrepreneurs of Chilamate” is a group of women from Poas, Chilamate, located close to the active Poas volcano in Costa Rica. The members of this group of 7 women are engaged in many varied productive activities including: food sales, a corner store, chicken rearing, bread making, and sewing. They have formed a strong bond with one another. It is apparent that these women regard community, solidarity, and hard work as values central to their beliefs.

Their special bond has developed because the members of the group have been neighbours all their lives, and thus know each other on a very deep and personal level. The positive experience that this group has had throughout the duration of their first loan has inspired new members to join the group. This will be the group's second loan with Fundacion Mujer; the first loan was paid back on time and in full. The loan officer who has been working with this group commends the members on their strong history of punctual repayments.

Socorro P. V. is experienced in sales. Every day, she makes “pan” a type of bread that she sells fresh to her neighbours and others in her community. Socorro also sews women's clothes (underwear and blouses) which she sells on the weekends in Guapiles. She travels by bus with her clothing products, taking a combination of 3 buses. Guapiles, in the Carribean region of Costa Rica, is roughly 2 hours away. Socorro has lived in Poas her entire life. At the age of 54 she is one of the eldest in the group, and she takes pride in the level of trust that has always existed in her community. “There is no trouble,” she says, “if anyone makes trouble it’s because they come from outside of our community.” Her enthusiasm for life is inspiring; she says that every day is a gift.

Angela R. L. is the elected president of the group. She is 57 years old and has 8 children. Angela has a business sewing and selling clothes such as pants for men and women, children’s clothing, shirts, and pyjamas. She also sews quilts and other types of bedding.

Yorleny M. P. raises chickens and then sells the eggs they lay. She is 34 years old and lives with her four children. With her first loan, she made the mistake of buying the wrong feed for her chicks, so they ended up too fat to lay eggs. As a result, she has sold these chickens and plans to use this second loan to purchase the correct feed so that she might have some chickens that lay eggs. Yorleny has thankfully maintained a good sense of humour regarding her mistake.

Vera Maria S. Z. is 43 years old and has 3 children. She has a business preparing and selling foods to people in her community. She works out of her home Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. Vera makes the majority of her sales in the afternoons and at night. She sells hamburgers, tacos, and 'ceviche' among other products. She says her tacos are the most popular item on the menu.

Laura Espinoza R. is 32 years old. She has one child and her highest level of formal education is the completion of primary school. Laura runs a beauty salon where she employs one other person. She will use this loan to buy hair and beauty products in order to better serve her clients.

loans.use: For general investments conducive to business growth

loans.name: Daim's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Daim N. is the village bank leader of a group that consists of four people located in Prey Phdau Cheung village, Takeo province. The group members will all use the loan to buy supplies and other items for different purposes.

Mrs. Daim N. is a silk weaver who is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to expand her business and increase her income, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to support her silk-weaving.

Mrs. Daim N.’s husband, Mr. Orn Men, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. This couple has four children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory while the last one is supporting them.

loans.use: To buy more silk for her silk-weaving business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira es una mujer muy radiante de alegría, tiene 37 años y está casada con el padre de sus 3 hijos. Por el momento viven y tienen su negocio en la casa de sus suegros, pero ya compraron su propio terreno, el cual irán construyendo más adelante.

Hace 19 años trabaja en la municipalidad de su localidad como secretaria, pero paralelamente y junto a su esposo, tienen una librería y cabinas de Internet, las que atiende Edwin (su esposo) y ella lo apoya los fines de semana. La librería tiene cerca de 10 años y las cabinas de internet 8, en lo cual les va muy bien. Su esposo es un hombre que le gusta las ventas y además es muy creativo, por ello realiza diseños gráficos para diversas tiendas comerciales, y con las ganancias viene ampliando el negocio. Es por ello que Elvira lo apoya en todo, con el fin de tener pronto su casa propia.

Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, donde ratifica su compromiso responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y manifiesta su satisfacción de trabajar con los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita va a comprar una vitrina y algunos repuestos para computadoras, para que de ese modo genere mayores ganancias en su negocio.
texts.en:
Elvira is a woman who radiates happiness. She is 37 and is married to the father of her 3 children. At the moment they live with her husband's parents and operate their business from that house as well. However, they have already bought land for themselves, on which they plan to build in the future. Elvira has worked as a secretary in her town's municipal government for 19 years. Along with her husband, however, she also runs a bookstore with internet access booths. Edwin (her husband) runs the business and she helps on the weekends. They've had the bookstore for almost 10 years and the internet access booths for 8 years, and both sides of the business do well. Elvira's husband enjoys working in sales and he is very creative. For this reason he also works as a graphic designer for various stores, using his earnings to expand his and Elvira's business. Elvira supports her husband in all these efforts, with the hope of having their own home soon. This is Elvira's fifth loan with MFP [the Kiva field partner], and she promises to be responsible with her repayments. She also mentions that she has found it satisfying to work with the other members of her Communal Bank. With the money from the current loan she will buy a glass shop window and replacement parts for computers, in order to increase the income from their business.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of replacement parts for computers

loans.name: Francisca Marina

texts.es:
La Señora Francisca Marina P. M. tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación desde hace  ocho años ella decidio poner su negocio con un capital de C$ 20,000.00  aporte de una hermana que esta fuera del país, anteriormente ella era ama de casa vivía en panamá es casada es madre de cinco hijos, dos de ellos dependen de ella y estan en edad escolar.
Se esfuerza en su negocio para poder sacar el bocado de cada día para ella y para sus hijos y su papá que esta bajo su cargo  habre su negocio desde las siete de la mañana hasta las diez y media de la noche, tiene una sobrina que le ayuda haber el negocio y su hija que en tiempos libre tambien le ayuda.
 Tiene  cinco años de trabajar con nuestra institución y ella manifestó en la encuesta que le hicimos que se siente muy agradecida con ceprodel ya que siempre le han financiado y así ella a podido surtir su negocio y poco a poco a sacado adelante a sus hijos y su hogar
texts.en:
Francisca Marina P. M. has had a mini-market in her house for eight years. She decided to start her business with C$ 20,000.00 that her sister, who is out of the country, contributed. Before that she was a housewife, and she lived in Panamá. She is married and has five children. Two of them are school-age and dependent upon her. She puts her effort into her business in order to be able to provide food daily to herself, her children, and her father, who is her responsibility. Her business is open from seven in the morning until ten thirty at night. She has a niece that helps her with the business. Her daughter also helps her during her free time. She has worked with our institution for five years. She told us in the survey that she is very grateful to Ceprodel because they have always financed her. That way she was able to slowly stock her business and get her children and her household ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like cookies, Diana products, soft drinks, candy, gum, and milk, etc.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: 50 years old, Avelina L. doesn’t know anymore how will she budget their small income. Her husband works as a farmer and she is helping her husband maintain the rice field. She is currently preparing her farm for planting and this is why she needs help to be able to improve the harvest. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 5,000 from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers, and pay the rental of the farm equipment.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and rent farm equipment.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is a married with four children.  She owns a roomed house where she stays with six people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Eva takes care of additional family members. She rents a shop where she sells charcoal from, selling to all categories of people both on retail and wholesale. She works seven days a week. Her business challenges includes transportation of charcoal  from villages to her place of work and rainy season.    She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. Eva‘s monthly expenses includes Food rents for her business premises and school fees . She is to boost her business of charcoal trade

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 46 years old, married with 5 children who are 8, 16, 19, 22, and 23 years old.  Seraphine has been working hard selling drinks made out of sorghum and this is her 14th successful year in this business.  The hours of her business are from 6 am to 6 pm every day.  

Seraphine is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to satisfy her customers.  With this loan, she will also buy some food supplies mainly cakes, breads and some other pastries.  In addition, she will start also selling some milk.  With this, she hopes that her customers will eat and drink well.  If successful, Seraphine will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to continue providing more food for her family and paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: The purchase of food supplies mainly cakes, breads and some other pastries for resale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is married with five children who all go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Rebecca owns a poultry farm and a charcoal store in Kyebando Nsooba, one of the Kampala city suburbs. She sells to all categories of people at retail and at wholesale.  She wants to use this loan of 700,000/= to buy more bags of charcoal and chicken feed.  She has been in this business for over five years and doesn’t have any other side business.  Rebecca works seven days week and her business challenges include thieves and transportation.  She aspires to improve her  standards of living and to educate her children up to university.  She joined MCDT to generate enough capital for her business. She resides in and owns a three-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bags of  chicken feed and charcoal

loans.name: Dany

texts.es: Dany tiene 18 años, es soltero, vive en su propia vivienda con sus padres,  Luis de 54 años y Rosa de 45 años; y sus 2 hermanos de los 8 que tiene. Esta familia se caracteriza por ser muy unida, pues a pesar de que los hijos mayores que tiene, viven independientemente, pero siempre ayudan en la economía familiar. Cuando sus padres le cedieron terrenos como parte de su herencia, no lo dudo y empezó a cultivar café y plátano, es así que lleva en esta actividad más de un año. En ocasiones la ayudan  sus padres y hermanos, pero cuando es temporada de limpieza y cosecha contrata los servicios de operarios.  Gracias a los cuidados y técnicas que le enseño su padre, pudo obtener una cosecha de primera, sin embargo le resulta pesado trasladar los sacos de frutos, desde la chacra hasta su localidad. Su trabajo es muy rentable, porque le permite continuar invirtiendo en sus tierras, cubrir sus necesidades, ayudar a su familia y ahorrar para emprender nuevos retos más adelante, como el tener más plantaciones de café por ser un fruto muy solicitado, asimismo quiere estudiar la carrera de contabilidad en la ciudad. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y una vez más se compromete a no defraudar a sus compañeros de grupo, porque está contento de trabajar en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 20 sacos de fertilizantes con las cuales protegerá sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Dany is 18 years old. He is single and lives in his own house with his parents, Luis, 54, and Rosa, 45, and 2 of his 8 siblings. This family is very close; despite the fact that the children are older and independent, they help with the family finances. When his parents gave over some land to him as part of his inheritance, he didn't hesitate and began to grow coffee and plantains. He has been doing this activity for more than a year. At times, his parents and his siblings help him, but when it's time to clear and harvest he hires laborers. Thanks to the care and techniques his father taught him, he was abe to have a harvest on the first try. Nonetheless, it has been difficult to transport the sacks of product from his filed to town. His work is very profitable, because it allows him to continue investing in his land, cover his necessities, help his family and save for new challenges in the future, like having more coffee plantings, because it is in demand. He also wants to study accounting in the city. This is his second loan with MFP, and once again he is committed to not letting the other members of the group down, because he is happy with his community bank. With the loan he is asking for, he will buy 20 sacks of fertilizer which will protect his plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran is a citizen of the city called Riwind, Pakistan which is about 30km far away from the city of Lahore. Her husband's name is A. M.. He is a vegetable seller by profession. She is a mother of two sons: her elder son runs a dairy business to financially support the family while the younger son is seven years old. The younger son cannot  go to school yet, due to financial constraints. 

Bashiran begum is also a very hardworking lady. She not only manages the household activities but also has a domestic sewing business. Her talent earns money for her family. Bashiran has applied for a loan from Asasah to invest in her son's business. He will buy a buffalo to improve his milk-selling business. Bashiran begum is hopeful that this investment will increase her sons’ income so that she will be able to send her youngest son to school soon.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo for dairy business.

loans.name: Khet's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Khet N. is 55 years old and he is the village bank president having been selected by its ten members. The bank is  located in Thnong Roleung village, Takeo province. The members of this village will use the loans for different purposes. 
Mr. Khet N. is a farmer who owns 1.20-hectares of land where he cultivates rice.  Aside from being a farmer he is also grocery seller at home, and is able to earn a small income to support his family. Since the grocery business is going well, he wants to expand it so he decided to ask for a loan to bU. more groceries. Mr.Khet N. is widower with four children, two are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is vehicle driver and the other stays at home and supports their father's business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha lives in a city called Borewala (famous for its shrines) with her family in Pakistan. She is a seamstress. She takes orders from nearby areas and finishes the orders on time to make an income for her family. She uses a room of her house which is filled with her sewing machine and the ordered clothes. 

Her husband runs a grocery shop in the main market. By working in the main market, he faces challenges from the other grocery shops every day. He is confident about his work and deals with his customers with confidence.  

Martha has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy more groceries for his grocery shop. By offering more variety to his customers, he will be able to make more money, which will enhance his family’s living standard. 

Martha wants to construct a room in her house and she is hopeful that with the loan profit, she will be able to fulfill her desire.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to stock her shop.

loans.name: La Esperanza Ii Group

texts.es:
Este comité lleva por nombre La Esperanza debido a que todas las integrantes coinciden de que ésta oportunidad les servirá de esperanza para progresar, actualmente se encuentran en el quinto ciclo, integrada por 21  luchadoras señoras, quienes se esmeran días tras días para aumentar sus ingresos y por ende brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias. 
Todas las integrantes son muy trabajadoras, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Así como la señora Gilda quien invirtio el credito en la compra de carne de pollo, cerdo, vacuno y otros.
Ella se dedica a la venta de carne en una carniceria que posee en su casa, en la actividad la ayuda su marido.
Se siente muy satisfecha con su actividad ya que le ayuda a su familia.
Agradece a todas a sus compañeras por el apoyo constante entre ellas y desea seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
This committee has the name "La Esperanza" or "Hope" because all the members agree that this opportunity will give them hope to progress. They are currently in their 5th loan cycle and they consist of 21 determined women who strive day to day to increase their income and so to provide the best for their families. All the group members are very hardworking and have invested their loans in their respective business activities. For instance, Gilda invested the loan in buying chicken meat, pork, beef, and others. She sells meat in a butchers shop located in her home and her husband helps her with this. She feels very satisfied with her business as it helps her family. She is very grateful to all her companions in the group for the constant support there is between them and she wants to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meet like beef, pork, and chicken

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has been practicing mixed farming for 18 years in Murang'a town, central Kenya. She has employed four casual laborers. Her farm produces coffee, milk and nuts which she sells to the local market. She is a full time farmer and depends on her farming income to cover the basic needs of her family.

Margaret is 48 years old. She has been blessed with three children who are all adults.

Margaret has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 53,000KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She believes that her income will increase and she will be able to improve the livelihood of her family. In five years' time, she hopes to own several dairy cows and increase milk production to over 50 litres daily.

She says that the future is bright with the funding from Juhudi small-scale farming loans.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Bisoboka Women's Group-Lugazi

texts.en: Jane N. is 45 years old and the single mother of 5 children. She belongs to the Bisoboka Women’s Group in Lugazi. For the last 15 years, she has been running a drug store/pharmacy business in the up-and-coming active trading center of Kizigo. Jane went through apprentice training as a nurse before deciding to start her business. In the beginning, she went door-to-door selling medications in her neighborhood. Jane describes herself as a hard worker with a purpose who makes monthly profits of up to 60,000 shillings. She is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs for her pharmacy.

loans.use: To purchase drugs for her pharmacy

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Rosa María R. D. C. D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, donD. vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Rosa posee una tienda D. abarrotes, en los cuales comercializa productos D. primera necesidad como pastas, pan, huevos y otros más los cuales son fundamentales dentro D. un hogar. Ella cuenta con 5 años D. poseer el negocio, el cual le ha permitido ir mejorando su economía familiar, la cual en muchas ocasiones es bastante mala, sobre todo porque muchas veces ella no cuenta con todos los productos que las personas buscan lo cual disminuye en gran manera sus ganancias. Es por esta razón que Rosa solicita un préstamo a integral, con el fin D. poder contar con el dinero necesario para poder surtir su negocio con esos productos tan necesarios que no posee, así mismo con el deseo D. poder aumentar la cantidad D. los que ya posee. Rosa desea mejorar su negocio, sobretodo para brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en: Rosa María R. D. C., 43, lives in the municipality of Soyapango, located in the San Salvador department, with her husband and 2 children.  Rosa has a grocery store where she sells basic consumer products such as pasta, bread, eggs and other items that are essential in the home.  She has had this business for 5 years, and it has allowed her to improve her family's economic situation, which for a time was pretty bad because she did not have the products that people were looking for and this greatly decreased her earnings.  For this reason, Rosa requests a loan from INTEGRAL, so that she can have the money to stock her store with the products that she needs but does not have, and to increase the quantity of the products that she already has.  Rosa wants to improve her business so that she can proviD. her children with everything that they need.

loans.use: to buy perishable food products

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 35-year-old man, married to a peasant farmer and together they have two children aged 2 and 4 years. He operates a retail shop in Fort Portal, Uganda and has been in the business for five years now. He says that at the moment, there are no major challenges his business is facing and is only planning to see it grow into a wholesale business in the near future. However, Stephen says that he would like to diversify the sources of income he has currently so that his household income can increase. Thus, he is going to construct a house for rental purposes. Stephen intends to use the loan proceeds to buy land so that he can construct a house for rentals.

loans.use: To buy land to construct a house for rentals.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta C. is from the village of Wadya, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 56 years old. Julieta is married and with six adult-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling locally-made pillows in the community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Julieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products (pillows).

loans.name: Mary Nanette

texts.en:
Mary Nanette E. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 34 years old and has a 1-year-old child. Mary Nanette and her husband separated due to conflicts. She decided to be the one to take care of their baby.

Mary Nanette earns a living through raising pigs and fish vending. She raises pigs for fattening and sells pork at the market. She also buys fish from fishermen and goes around their neighborhood selling them. Mary Nanette works hard to be able to feed her baby and herself.

Mary Nanette needs a loan to purchase additional piglets to raise and feed for them. She also needs a weighing scale and a styrofoam box for selling fish. She requested for a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI, a partner of KIVA. Mary Nanette really needs this loan to sustain her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and fish-vending materials

loans.name: Mercy Mayuri

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Los Laureles.

La señora Mercy  está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la presidenta del mismo  y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por la ayuda que ha recibido tanto ella como sus amigas y colegas del grupo. Tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y ha procreado 6 hijos, cuatro de ellos son mayores de edad, los menores tienen 17 y 8 años que son los que viven en su casa y estudian en escuela y colegio. Su esposo es taxista.

Se dedica al comercio, vende artículos para el hogar como planchas, licuadoras, tostadoras, sabanas entre otros, también vende prendas de vestir. Trabaja dos días de la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, la mercadería se la llevan hasta bahía, ella realiza los pedidos y los recibe en su ciudad. Además de esto también tienen un tanquero en el cual reparten agua a las personas que les piden este servicio.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más de sus productos como planchas, licuadoras, camisas, pantalones, etc. Sus sueños son que sus hijos menores terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'Los Laureles' community bank meet in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez which is known for its beaches, its good food and the warmth of its people.

Mercy has been a member of the community bank since it was founded.  She is the bank's president and she likes it for the additional benefits which our institution provides and also for the help which both she and her friends and fellow group members have received.  Mercy is 47 years old.  She is married and has six children, four of whom are grown up.  Her youngest two children are 17 and 8 years old.  They still live in her home and study in elementary school and high school.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

Mercy is a saleswoman.  She sells household goods such as irons, blenders, toasters, sheets, etc.  She also sells clothes.  She works two days a week and sells her goods door to door.  Her goods are brought from Bahía.  She makes the orders and receives them in her city.  As well as this, she also has a tanker from which she distributes water to people who request this service.

This loan will be used to buy more products such as irons, blenders, shirts, pants, etc.  Her dream is for her younger children to finish their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy irons, blenders, shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es: El Señor José de 53 años de edad, estado civil casado, su esposa trabaja como domestica para ayudar con los gastos de la casa. Ya sus hijos son independientes trabajan por su cuenta y le ayudan a sus padres. Como planes principales es seguir apoyando a sus hijos que se sigan preparando profesionalmente. Tiene su propio negocio es un parque mecánicas. El negocio tiene trayectoria en el mercado iniciándolo hace 26 años, manteniéndolo y con proyectos de crecer.  En el tiempo que ha tenido su negocio se ha encontrado con dificultades como es la salud de sus hijos que lo han detenido en poner en práctica sus planes. Inicio su negocio por medio la ayuda de su familia y el conocimiento en el funcionamiento del negocio mismo. Los planes para corto plazo es aumentar estos primeros meses del año sus ingresos y a un largo plazo el expandirse su elenco de maquinas mecánicas para mayor variedad. Agradece a  Afodenic por el apoyo en este ciclo de préstamo ya que gracias a la Institución ha logrado mejor poco a poco su nivel de vida. El préstamo será invertido en la compra de materiales como: zinc, clavos de acero, reglones de madera. Para  cambiar el techo de su casa obteniendo mayor seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old.  He is married and his wife works as a cleaner to help with their household expenses.  His children are already living independently, working and helping their parents.  José's main plans are to continue supporting his children so that they can continue preparing themselves professionally.

José has his own business which is an auto repair shop.  His business has been going for 26 years.  He has maintained it and has plans to grow it.  During the time that he has had his business, he has faced a number of problems, such as his children's health, which have prevented him from putting his plans into practice.  He started his business with the help of his family and his knowledge of running the business.  His short term plans are to increase his income over the first few months of the year and, in the long term, he plans to expand the number of machines he has so that he has more variety.

José is grateful to Afodenic for the support that they are giving him in this loan cycle since, thanks to the Institution, he has managed to gradually improve his standard of living.  He will invest this loan in buying materials such as corrugated metal, steel nails and wooden beams.  He will replace the roof of his house which will make his family safer.

loans.use: To replace his roof

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is from the village of Upper Inuman. She is 43 years old. Josephine is an individual member of PMPC. She is married with four schoolchildren and one infant. To make a living, Josephine work as a retailer of cosmetic products in the local community doing house to house selling.  

Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 17,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To have additional capital to buy products.

location.town: Sindangan-Upper Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita A. is from the village of San Rafael. She is 58 years old. Estelita is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-eight years and earns approximately $158 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Estelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Geofrey Muiruri

texts.en:
Geofrey, 27 years old, has practiced farming in Nduyu Njeru town for the last six years.  He does both farming and dairy.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid for his first loan of Kshs 27,000 well and in good time.  He plans to buy a dairy cow with the loan amount.

In the future, Geofrey hopes to become a leading farmer in Nduyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAPAC QOYA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Qoya, provincia D. Calca, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Filomena; La socia tiene 46 años D. edad, la socia  es casada; la socia tiene 4 hijos independientes todos ellos; La socia trabaja criando cuyes y aves D. corral, la socia también cultiva sus terrenos D. maíz, ella también produce verduras ta les como habas, lechugas, calabazas, zanahorias entre otros, ahora la socia quiere comprar cuyes para criarlos y venderlos en la ciudad; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. cuyes y D. este modo incrementar su negocio y venderlos en la ciudad a un buen precio. 

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Capac Qoya Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Qoya District within the Calca Province and the Department of Cusco.

Filomena is 46 years old, married, and has four children who are all independent. She works raising guinea pigs and poultry. She also farms corn and grows vegetables like beans, lettuce, squash, and carrots, among others. Now Filomena wants to buy guinea pigs to raise and sell in the city. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of guinea pigs so that she can expand her business and sell them in the city at a good price.

Filomena is pleased with the loan granted and promises to make her payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of guinea pigs

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 37 years old and a resident of Nyamira in western Kenya. He is married with two children aged eight and eleven, both of whom attend school. He has worked in mixed farming in Nyamira for nine years.  He produces tomatoes, cabbage, tea, maize, and wheat, all of which he sells locally. He has one farmhand. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to support the basic needs of his family.

James has requested a 45,000Kes loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes the income from this loan will improve the his family's living standards and pay for the education of his two children. He intends to buy a pick-up to help transport his produce to the market. Drastic weather conditions and pests remain his major challenges.  He will focus on repaying this loan and then request additional loans.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has one child. She also takes care of additional family members.

Hellen has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for two years, and she works seven days out of every week. Hellen lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food. She also raises chickens as an additional source of income. 

Helen has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of  charcoal. The main business challenge for Hellen is operational costs and the rainy season. Her goal is to expand her business and improve the quality of life for herself and her child.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara V. is from the village of San Sebastian, Ramon, Isabela. She is 54 years old. Barbara is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 Php a month for these activities.

In 2009, Barbara joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Barbara is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional groceries to sell. This will be her 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Jessica María

texts.es:
La Señorita. Jessica M. es socia del banco comunal Espoir Mi Bankito, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es hermosa por su centro histórico, sus iglesias, su naturaleza y varios lugares turísticos en donde cuentan con una variada gastronomía y sus 4 ríos la bañan hacen de esta ciudad un hermoso lugar para visitar.

Jessica tiene 23 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad quienes estudian en una escuelita de la comunidad. Vive en la casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.

Nuestra socia es comerciante y labora hace 5 años en la venta de mariscos, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.
 
Es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de mariscos como: pescado, camarón, langostinos, conchas, etc. para su negocio.
 
Su meta es culminar sus estudios de secundaria.
texts.en:
Srta. Jessica M. is a member of the Communal Bank “ESPOIR Mi Bankito”. She lives in the sector of Feria Libre in the city of Cuenca. This beautiful city is known for its historical center, its churches, its views of nature, various tourist spots, different cuisines, and the four rivers that surround this place.

Jessica is 23 years old and a single mother with two children (ages 7 and 5) who attend school in the community. She lives at home with her parents and shares in the household expenses. Jessica has worked as a merchant for five years and sells seafood. She works Sunday to Sunday from 6am to 6pm.

This is the first loan she has received from the Communal Bank. She will invest the money in the purchase of fish, shrimp, prawns, scallops, and other types of seafood for her business. Her goal is to finish her high school education.

loans.use: to purchase fish, shrimp, prawns, scallops, and other types of seafood.

loans.name: Ma Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Eugenia tiene 38 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Emilio, ellos tienen 2 hijos de nombres Erika la cual estudia el primaria y Alejandro el cual estudia el preescolar. Doña Eugenia se dedica a la venta de colchas y sabanas por catalogo ella tiene con ese negocio 4 años y dice que decidió emprender ese negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de sus pequeños hijos. 

Ella sale a vender sus colchas a sus vecinas y conocidas y mas que nada a gente que si  paga, ella surte sus colchas en la distribuidora de su población, ella agradece a la financiera por el préstamo ya que así podrá comprar los pedidos que le han encargado las clientas. La meta que tiene la señora Eugenia es vender cena afuera de su casa para tener un extra de ganancias.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 38 years old and married to Emilio who works in a restaurant in the United States.  They have two children.  Erika is in elementary school and Alejandro is in pre-school.  Eugenia sells bedspreads and sheets through a catalog.  She has been in this business for four years.  She says that she decided to start this business in order to help her husband with their young children's expenses.

Eugenia goes out to sell her bedspreads to her neighbors and acquaintances and, more than anything, to people who pay.  She stocks up on bedspreads at the distributor's in her town.  She is grateful to the financial institution for this loan since it will enable her to buy products to fill the orders that her customers have made.  Eugenia's goal is to sell dinners outside her home to make extra money.

loans.use: to sell bedspreads through a catalog

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a forty-one-year-old married woman with four children, and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has a been in the hotel business for seven years, which she started by selling produce and saving enough money to start a hotel. Her hardships are limited funds and market fluctuations and her vision is a bigger hotel plus a well educated family. Joyce needs the loan facility to buy rice, cassava flour, cooking oil and beans.

loans.use: to buy rice, cassava flour, cooking oil and beans.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.en: Manuel Antonio is a single father of four who has a small business selling firewood.  After learning the business from his brothers, he has operated on his own for the last twenty years. He has established a strong client base and has been able to support his family.  Manuel Antonio plans to use the loan to purchase more inventory and grow his business.  His dream is to purchase a new vehicle, which would be helpful not only personally, but also for business reasons.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell and grow his business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: El señor Rosa, de 64 años de edad, vive solo en su casa  y es una persona ejemplar ya que a pesar de su avanzada edad sigue luchando por mejorar su calidad de vida y tiene muchos sueños los cuales le gustaría alcanzar. Él se dedica a la agricultura y año con año trabaja con mucho amor las tierras que alquila. Él se centra en el cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles actividad que le ha proporcionado lo más básico para poder sobrevivir. El no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos,  esta actividad es la única forma en la que él puede tener un poquito de dinero ya que al final de la cosecha vende una parte de la producción para poder accesar a los demás productos de la canasta básica. Cada año el tiene que invertir en fertilizantes, semilla, abono para poder cultivar las tierras, y no cuenta con los fondos económicos necesarios para poder comprarlos ya que los precios de estos productos son bastante elevados. Es por esta razón que solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo y comprar estos materiales que son indispensables para el cultivo. Confía mucho en Dios que lograra obtener buenos resultados al final de la producción.
texts.en: Señor Rosa is 64 years old and lives alone in his home.  He is an exemplary person since in spite of his advanced age he continues to work hard to improve his quality of life and has many dreams he would like to achieve. He works in agriculture and year after year he works the land that he rents with much love.  He grows mainly basic grains such as corn and beans.  This activity has provided him with the basics in order to survive as he doesn't have another source of income.  It is the only way that he can have a little money since at the end of the harvest he sells part of his production so he is able to buy other basic necessities.  Each year he has to invest in fertilizers, seeds and manure in order to cultivate his land.  He doesn't have the financial means necessary to buy them since the prices of these products are quite high.  For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy these materials that are indispensable for cultivation.  He places a lot of trust in God that he will obtain good results at the end of production.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, seeds and manure to cultivate his land.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Catching fish is the main part of 31-year-old Mrs. Soun’s everyday work. She and her husband live along the river in Siem Reap province. They use different kinds of fishing tools in their fishing activity. This couple makes an income around $7 each day to use for daily expenses. Mrs. Soun and her husband also support their three children who are enrolled in school. To earn extra income, her husband also works as a construction worker. 

Mrs. Soun will use her loan to purchase nets, a new boat and other fishing implements so she can catch more fish.

loans.use: to purchase nets, a new boat and other fishing implements so she can catch more fish.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose has owned and managed his travel agency since 1992, becoming reputable in his community for serving the Cape Verde population. By charging a flat fee for tickets and paying a wholesaler, Jose is able to help immigrants, largely from Cape Verde, visit family members back home. He has watched his business flourish as a result of e-tickets. Although he has had much success as a business owner, Jose has personally felt the effects of the economic crisis. Traveling has decreased overall and many individuals have stopped purchasing airline tickets.

With this loan from ACCION USA, Jose will purchase a sign for the front of his business and make some small-scale aesthetic upgrades. It is important to Jose to continue running a productive business and serving the community that he is closest to.

loans.use: to purchase a business sign and make small-scale aesthetic upgrades

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials to finish the roof and the walls in the kitchen and to buy kitchen cabinets and tile.  She hopes to attain better living conditions such as better hygiene.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José 65 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicado en la zona urbana del distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

José desde hace varios años se dedica a la comercialización de animales como (cerdos y vacas), los cría en sus corrales que tiene en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento ideal, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades y gastos familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado, una vez que los engorde los comercializa a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará el nivel de vida de su familia. José con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo trata de salir adelante para seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia y brindarle a sus hijos mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
José, aged 65, lives with his wife and children in their own home, which has running water and electricity.  It is located in the urban area of Mórrope district, which is part of Lambayeque department.  This area is characterized by agriculture, livestock and handicrafts.

For the last several years, José has had an animal business (pigs and cows).  He raises them in his farmyard, which is right outside his home, and he feeds them on balanced animal feed and natural pastures.  Once they have achieved their ideal growth, he sells them to his customers or to the different markets in the area.  With the income he earns, he is able to cover his needs and family's costs.

He has requested a loan of 2,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternative to buy balanced animal feed.  Once he has fattened the animals up he will sell them to his customers, and with the earnings he will be able to pay back the loan being offered, and improve his family's standard of living.

With much hard work and effort, José tries to move forward in life, so as to be able to continue helping his family financially and provide his children with better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer  is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Jennifer has a retail shop business in which she buys & sells recycled materials, like bottles. She has had this business for 12 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy recycled, like bottles, for resale.

Jennifer is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jennifer hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials, like bottles, to resell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela was born in 1971.  She is married and is blessed with one child.  She runs a boutique to earn a living.  She also does tailoring to earn more income for her family. She has been in the business for four years.  Through Faulu Kenya, Pamela has expanded her business, which has generated good income for her family.  Her desire is to open other outlets for her business in five years. She needs a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shirts and trousers.

loans.use: To buy shirts and trousers

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Melba is 42 years old and has one child who is in school.

Melba has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines. Melba requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

Melba has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Melba would like to save enough money so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco, de 59 años es una persona humilde. Vive en compañía de su esposa, Constantina desde hace 30 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos en su casa propia; ubicada en el Barrio La Esperanza. Su rostro avejentado, es propio de su sabiduría y experiencia en la agricultura. Ya tiene 35 años de práctica en la siembra de arveja, maíz, papa y habas; los cuales lo realizan en sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Según cuenta hace años las ganancias eran mayores, por ello pudo mantener a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante. Aunque ahora le cuesta mayor esfuerzo, no se desanima; pues tiene los conocimientos necesarios para poder sacar una cosecha de calidad. Además tiene clientes fijos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde lleva a vender sus alimentos. Pero como es un hombre de campo, posee vacas, cerdos y ovejas que le proporcionan un dinero extra, ya que los enseba y vende a un buen precio. Ahora este trabajador hombre se concentra en su próxima cosecha de alverja, donde espera tener buenas ganancias. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Punray Avanzando” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo, pues desea continuar con su trabajo. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. 
Francisco de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de mil kilos de semilla de papa, de la variedad “única” y si el dinero le alcanza fertilizantes naturales.
texts.en:
59-year-old Francisco is a humble person.  He has lived with his wife Constantina for 30 years.  The couple have five children but only two still live with them.  They live in their own home which is located in La Esperanza neighborhood.

Francisco's aged face reflects his agricultural wisdom and experience.  He has been growing peas, corn, potatoes and beans for 35 years.  He grows these crops on his own farmland.  He tells us that the profits used to be greater years ago and so he was able to support his children and get them ahead in life.  Although it is now harder for him, he does not become discouraged as he has the knowledge he needs to produce a top-quality harvest.  In addition, he has regular customers in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma where he takes his crops to sell.

As Francisco is a country man, he owns cows, pigs and sheep which provide him with extra money as he fattens them and sells them at a good price.  Right now, this hard-working man is concentrating on his upcoming pea harvest which he hopes will make him good profits.  

Francisco is a member of the "Punray Avanzando" community bank.  This is his eighth loan from MFP and he hopes to receive your support as he would like to continue in his work.  He pledges to be punctual in making his loan repayments.  With your support, Francisco will invest the money he has requested in buying 1,000 kilos of 'única' potato seeds and, if the money reaches far enough, natural fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy 1,000 kilos of potato seeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Tagisia

texts.en:
Tagisia, a 34-year-old married mother of one, has been planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale for the last three years. Having joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services, Tagisia is requesting her first loan for WST $1000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand it.

Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score."" For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

About SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. "

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en: Ibrahem is a 52-year-old man. He is married with four sons and three daughters, and he works in fruit and vegetables sales. Some of his sons are workers with decent salaries. Ibrahem wants to expand his work by purchasing bulk vegetables and fruit to sell. Also, he uses a vehicle in his work and wants to pay part of its price, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take out a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Ibrahem gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase bulk fruit and vegetables so he will have a larger collection for sale; also he will pay part of the price for the vehicle he purchased for work purposes. This will enable Ibrahem to increase his income and live in better living conditions. Ibrahem is photographed next to his vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase bulk fruits and vegetables to sell and to pay part of the price for the vehicle he purchased for work.

loans.name: Mirthalia De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Doña Mirthalia tiene su negocio de venta de ropa en uno de los mercados de Managua, ella tiene veinticinco años de tener el negocio y esa actividad, ella trabaja de lunes a domingos de la seis de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde.
Doña Mirthalia visita las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo para invertir en su negocio. Ella es casada y madre de familia de dos hijos los cuales se encuentran en el colegio.
El préstamo lo va ha invertir en compra de ropa para niños, niñas, damas y caballeros ya que en estos meses las ventas son muy buenas en el mercado.
Da gracias a Ceprodel por brindarles la oportunidad ya que gracias a los financiamientos su negocio ha podido salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mirtha has her business selling clothing in one of the markets in Managua.  She has had the business and job for 25 years.  She works from Monday through Sunday from six in the morning until six in the afternoon.

Mirthalia is visiting the offices of CEPRODEL to request a loan to invest in her business.  She is married and the mother of a family of two children who are in school.

She is going to invest the loan in buying clothing for boys, girls, women, and men, since in these months sales are very good in the market.

She thanks CEPRODEL for giving them the opportunity, since thanks to the loans her business has been able to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric has been in the transport business in Machakos for the last year. He is 26 years old and married to Mercy. They have been blessed with one child.
Eric was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan to add stocks of maize, beans, and vegetables to the greengrocery shop that he runs alongside his transport business.
In the future, Eric hopes to expand his greengrocery business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to add stocks of maize, beans, and vegetables to his greengrocery shop.

loans.name: Nelson Vladimir

texts.es:
Nelson es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable con sus actividades y su familia. Nelson tiene 34 años vive con sus 4 hijos en  San Gabriel. Nelson trabaja en la compra venta de ganado para carnicos.

Empezó su trabajo desd muy jóven, sus padres le regalaron unos terneros y le gustó es por eso que sigue con el negocio. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de ganado ya que actualmente la demanda sube por la temporada de fin de año y quiere aprovechar esa oportunidad ya que le generaría muy buenos ingresos que le ayudan a mantener a su familia y poder dar el estudio a sus hijos.

Su sueño es poder entrar en el negocio de vacas lecheras, y seguir creciendo laboralmente.
texts.en:
Nelson is a very hardworking person.  He is responsible with his family and his activities. Nelson is 34 years old and lives with his 4 children in San Gabriel. Nelson works selling livestock for meat. 

He started doing this work when he was very young. His parents bought him calves and liked doing this so he stayed in the business. This is his first loan from Fodemi, which he will use to buy livestock since there is an increasing demand at the end of this season. He wants to take advantage of this opportunity since he would generate a very good income that will help him take care of his family and be able to provide an education for his children.   

His dream is to be able to include dairy cows in his business and continue growing and developing.

loans.use: to buy livestock since there is an increasing demand.

loans.name: Mbogoyif Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 17/04/ 2010.IL est composé de 14 femmes issues du même village. Elles ont pour responsable Yandé. Sur la photo elle est placée à l'extrême droite.
Elle est âgée de 44 ans,elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a en charge aussi 1 neveu et 4 nièces.

Elle fait du commerce de mil et de légumes. Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis plusieurs années.

Son prêt va lui permettre de s'approvisionner en marchandises (mil et légumes)
