Ses recettes lui permettent de satisfaire les besoins quotidiens de ses enfants tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne dans le Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
The Mbogoyif group was created on April 17th, 2010, and is made up of 14 women who all come from the same village. The group´s leader is Yandé, who is standing on the far of the picture.

Yandé is 44 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She is also taking care of one nephew and 4 nieces. She sells millet and vegetables and is a seasoned saleswoman with several years experience.

Yandé will use this loan to buy millet and vegetables for resale. She will use her earnings to take care of her children´s needs and build up her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy millet and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Katy  Belen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Katy Belen; ella tiene 23 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de juguetes, ella vende carros, muñecas y todo tipo de juguetes, ella tiene un puesto en el mercado, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender los juguetes zapatos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar juguetes al por mayor.   
                                                               
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Sayhua 3 communal bank, located in the district of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

The member is Katy Belén.  She is 23 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling toys.  She sells cars, dolls, and all types of toys.  She has a stall in the market.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  Her dream is to have a store where she can sell toys.

She is requesting the loan to buy toys wholesale.
                                                               
She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy toys wholesale.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 33 years old, married and has one child.  To earn a living, he owns a motorbike which he uses for a transport business.  He has improved his business through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management.  Currently, he has employed four people in his business. David hopes to expand his business in the future.  He needs a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy motorbike spare parts for repairing his motorbike.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Ry, 41, is married, and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over six years. Her husband has been involved in growing rice for over 10 years and is successful in his career. Because the factory is far away from home, Ry is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she plans to grow rice in the dry season, build a new house and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Silvia Maritza

texts.es:
Silvia, vive en casa propia junto con sus dos hijas de 12 y 17 años de edad, ella se dedica a vender ropa para niños, damas y caballeros y útiles escolares el negocio lo inicio hace 10 años no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar útiles escolares para esta época de inicio de año para las escuelas y comprar mercadería como: mochilas, lápiz, sacapuntas, cuadernos, lapiceros y otros útiles necesarios de esa forma lograra tener más clientes y mejorar en sus ganancias.
El sueño de Silvia es siempre mantener estable su negocio y vivir bien con sus hijas y darles el estudio para que sean profesionales y salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Silvia lives in her own home with her two daughters who are 12 and 17 years old.  She sells clothing for children, women, and men, along with school supplies.  She began the business 10 years ago.  She does not have a set schedule.
She will use the loan to buy school supplies for this beginning of the school year season and to buy merchandise like: book-bags, pencils, pencil sharpeners, notebooks, pens, and other necessary items of this kind.  She will obtain more customers and improve her earnings.
Silvia's dream is to always keep her business stable.  She wants to live well with her children, and to give them the opportunity to study so that they can become professional and move ahead.

loans.use: buy book-bags, pencils, pencil sharpeners, notebooks, and pens.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 64 years old, a business lady who owns a motorbike. She is married and has eight children. She has been in business for three years. She has employed someone to be in charge of her motorbike. She also sells milk that is produced by her cow. She was previously selling groceries. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has learnt how to save her money and has increased her profits. 

She hopes to have a fleet of vans and increase her milk production. She requires a loan of 15,643.13 KES to buy spare parts for her motorbike.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorbike.

loans.name: Phary's Group

texts.en: Phary, a young mother blessed with one kid, is a villager from Bovel district of Battambang province. She secures the daily cost of living via rice farming as single source of income which has returned her about 26,000 KHR. Now, she is in need of financial aid to support her cash-crop. Hence,she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, seed,and to pay for plowing fee for her crop.She hopes that she can gain a good yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed,and to pay for plowing fee for her crop

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious is 29 years old and lives with her parents and her three children in the Chikomba West District. She operates a poultry business and uses the profit to pay her children’s school fees. Precious is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase more chicks, vaccines, and feed to expand her business. Precious plans to use the profit she earns to expand her business into a large poultry farm. Precious volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching her students about active citizenship and personal confidence. Patience will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work at the school.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks, vaccines, and feed

loans.name: Nolvia

texts.en: For the past 5 years Iâ€™ve had my store. I have a lot of clients because of the great diversity of products that I offer.  Iâ€™m located at the exit of the city and because of this I get a lot of business from the people travelling to the surrounding villages.  They buy their weekly provisions in my store. One way in which Iâ€™ve increased my sales is by allowing customers to pay every 15 days rather than on a weekly basis.

loans.use: Buying sodas, common medicine, sugar, lard, soap, oil, bread, broth amongst others.

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Mr. Komi S. is a small farmer by profession. He is married and father to five (05) children, and works a large grove of oil palms. His wife, who works as a secondhand retailer, does not receive enough income to fully support the family. And so it was to meet all the family's expenses that Mr. S. invested his small savings in farming local land: leasing the farm, producing seeds, planting and caring for the palms until they produce their nuts. Palm nuts are very important for the population because they can be used to product palm oil, which is essential for cooking. Currently, Mr. S. is asking for $800 of financial support to expand his fields. The credit will allow him to pay for labor and to acquire the resources necessary to cultivate oil palms.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Komi est un paysan de profession. Marié et père de cinq (05) enfants, il exploite un grand domaine de palmiers à huile. Son épouse, une revendeuse de la place, ne dispose pas un revenu assez fort pour venir pleinement en aide à la famille. C’est pour être à la hauteur des dépenses que Monsieur S. Komi a investi sa petite économie dans l’exploitation des terres locales : bail de terrain, production de pépinière, plantation et entretien des palmiers jusqu’à la production des noix. Les noix de palmes sont très importantes pour la population car elles servent à la production de l’huile de palme indispensable pour la cuisine. Aujourd’hui, Monsieur S. sollicite un appui financier de $800 pour élargir ses champs. Le crédit lui permettra de payer la main d’œuvre et d’acquérir des intrants pour la culture des palmiers à huile.

loans.use: paying for labor and acquiring the resources needed for cultivating oil palms

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana D/O S. Mohammad Ali lives in District 13 of Kabul City. She is married to Khalil-u-Rahman and has four Family members. She and her husband operate a vegetable cart. Beginning this business was difficult, because they didn't have enough capital. But thanks to the AFSG loan process, Farzana was able to participate in her first loan cycle which enabled her to buy enough produce to develop the business. Now she has finished her 1st loan cycle and she wishes to begin her 2nd loan cycle. She plans to open her own shop in the future.

***Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur.  In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.***

loans.use: To buy potatoes, onions and other vegetables

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng C., 36 years old and  a mother of 2 children, lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She makes her living by selling a variety of vegetables and typically makes in average about $2.5/day. Her husband, meanwhile, is a motor-taxi driver and contributes a meager profit to his household. To operate a motor-taxi business, C. is requesting for a loan amount of $800 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband, which she hopes to will bring in additional income from this business activity. In the future, she would like to have enough money to keep expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to run a business.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia O. makes jewelry with choral beads and sells other jewelry in her business. She is 60 years old, and married with six children. She has been with LAPO for the past 3 years as a leader of a union. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Mrs. O. needs a loan of $800 to buy more coral beads and jewelry. She is optimistic that with this loan she will be able to improve her business by increasing her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more coral beads and jewelry to sell in her business

loans.name: Teófila

texts.es:
The worst plight of a mother is to see her kids sick. And this is what happened to Mrs. Teófila R.. She is the mother of 7 children, and has devoted her life to work her plot of land cultivating broad beans. She had worked every day, from dawn to dust, with her husband to make their land productive. But something happened that made things harder. Her 23 year old daughter needed a surgical intervention for appendicitis, after which she had to remain in the hospital for 6 months.

This emergency and its outcome was very painful and expensive for Teófila’s family. Her husband had to look for another job to try to make up for all the expenses, so he became a driver. Now Teófila has to work double to do the job her husband used to do with her.

The family can get back on track if they manage to get a loan of US$ 175 to buy the seed needed to cultivate broad beans and potatoes. That investment would return enough profits for them to get back on their feet. You could help Teófila and her family to move on.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Hay momentos en que una madre sufre por sus hijos y esto suele pasar con mayor frecuencia cuando sus hijos están muy enfermos.Esta es la historia de doña Teófila R. mujer y madre de 7 hijos dedicada a la chacra y siembra de habas, como todo agricultor ella ha sabido luchar madrugada a madrugada junto a su esposo para realizar una exitosa producción de sus tierras. Hasta un momento de sus vidas todo marchaba muy bien en su hogar hasta que la vida la puso en una situación muy dura. Su hija de 23 años tuvo que ser operada con suma urgencia de apendicitis y permaneció internada bajo tratamiento durante 6 meses en la ciudad capital de su país.Este hecho fue muy doloroso y también costoso para la familia de Teófila y para sobreponerse de los gastos, su esposo tuvo que hacer labores extras y es así que empezó a trabajar como chofer dentro de su comunidad y ella tuvo que laborar el doble en su chacra porque había que suplir la ausencia de su esposo. Ahora dicha familia puede volver a recuperarse de esos momentos con un préstamo de 175 dólares para invertirlos en la siembra de habas y papas con el fin de obtener en la próxima cosecha un gran porcentaje de ganancias. Sabemos que con tu ayuda la familia de Teófila podrá salir adelante .

loans.use: To buy broad beans seed and seed potatos

loans.name: Maumau

texts.en: Maumau is a middle-aged mother of three children and owns a vegetable garden. She works on her garden after all her daily chores are finished. In the evening she goes around the village to sell her produce, which nets her 150 Tala (US$ 60) per week if sales are good. This money is used to make her loan repayments and most of all for providing her family with food every day and also for other family and church obligations.

loans.use: To buy supplies and tools for her farm

loans.name: Larissa Aminosse

texts.pt:
Born in 1977, Larissa Aminosse C. lives with her partner and 3 childen in the neighborhood of Ndlavela, in Maputo, Mozambique where she is in the business of selling whole grains and nuts from home. She joined the credit program in 2006, and is now on her 3rd loan cycle. Thanks to her loans to date, the business has been doing very well.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Larissa Aminosse C., portadora do BI nº 110650286T, residente no bairro de Ndlavela, veve maritalmente com 3 filhos negociante vende na sua propria casa ,vende produtos alimentares tais como , Amendoim ,feijão, caldos tudo a retalho, nascida a 18/10/1977, emtoru no programa a 14/12/06 tomando o valor de 3000 mt esta no 3º ciclo vai continuar a tomar 3000 para pagar em 4 meses o seu negocio esta a desenvolver muito bem.

loans.use: To improve the business

loans.name: Nabweru Iii A 2030(B) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year and six months. Lydia makes and sells snacks. With the extra business profits, she wants to set up a stall so that she can begin supplying other small scale buyers. Jane offers tailoring services. Jane has a retail shop while Sarah sells raw foods in the market.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand her catering business.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is 36 years old, married, with five children, between the ages of 6 to 18. She and her husband also take care of four other people. In 2005, Zawadi started a grocery store and she works there everyday from 6am to 6pm. She can earn an estimated monthly profit of $290 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Gisela

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Gisela M.. She is 37 years old, married, and has two children (a 6-year-old and an 8-year-old). In 2006, Gisela established her stationery business. She works extremely hard to earn about $90 each month from this business. Gisela seeks a loan in order to purchase toners, USB sticks, and CD writers. She thanks you for your support.

Gisela is constantly amazed by the foresight and insight of people who have never received any training in business management. She feels fortunate to own and operate a stationary sales business where she is exposed to the wisdom of various business people because they have their shops, stalls, tables, or bodies strategically located near her business and near post offices, banks, schools, and universities.

loans.use: To purchase printing toners, USB sticks, and a CD writer.

loans.name: Perla Cecilia

texts.es:
Perla is married and has two children. She started her business to help her husband with the household expenses and to try to get ahead, since the financial situation they were going through was very difficult. Her husband was unemployed at that moment so there was no fixed income for the family. She got started three years ago buying second hand shoes in bulk. She now sells directly at the markets and now also sells shoes through catalogs.

She is asking for a loan in the amount of $300, which she will pay in 6 months, to purchase new shoes and shoes through catalogs in other to increase her earnings. With your help Perla can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Perla es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Inició el negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y salir adelante dada la situación que pasaban en ese momento era muy difícil. Su esposo en ese momento estaba desempleado y no había un ingreso fijo por lo que decidió apoyarlo. Comenzó hace 3 años comprando calzado de segunda por lote hasta vender ya directamente en mercados metiendo también la venta de calzado por catalogo.

Solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar calzado nuevo y por catalogo para incrementar sus ingresos. Con tu ayuda Perla saldría adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman Q. is a 50-year-old man who started his business in 1982 of selling dairy products and breeding calves in the small village of Saatli. Elman is married and he has four children, and their family lives together in a settlement with other displaced families.

The main source of the business' income is dairy sales, so Elman is hoping to expand his business with that key fact in mind. Indeed, times are tough for Elman and his family, so he is looking to generate additional income from his business. Therefore, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase one dairy cow for $700 and fodder with the remaining $100.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing one dairy cow as well as some fodder

loans.name: Rong

texts.en: Rong R., 65, is a widowed farmer who lives in Kampong Cham province with several of her ten children. She makes about $3 a day, but that is not enough to support her family, so three of her children send money from their work in garment factories. The weather in Cambodia has not been good for farming over the last year, and inflation has caused food prices to rise rapidly. These factors mean difficult times for many Cambodians, Rong R. included. In light of these economic problems, she is asking for a loan of $650 to buy more farmland to grow rice. She sees this new rice field as a great economic opportunity, because it can help to both increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy farmland

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Mrs. Pol S. (pictured with her daughter) sells groceries from her house, and in doing so she earns approximately $2 per day. Her husband has been working as a construction worker for the past 28 years, and he earns approximately $2.50 per day. They have four children, two of whom are married and two of whom live in the family home.

Because of increasing family expenses, Mrs. Soerun wants to purchase a motorcycle so that one of her sons can supplement the family's income by working as a motorcycle-taxi driver. Accordingly, she is hereby requesting a loan in the amount of $900 to purchase a motorcycle for her son to drive.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle so that her son can work as a motorcycle-taxi driver

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
Madame Djeneba C. a 39 ans et vit avec son époux et son enfant à Darsalam un des quartiers du village de Farako préfecture de Sikasso( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Dès son jeune age elle s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment la vente de céréales et d’atièkè (semoule alimentaire fait à base de manioc ou d’igname sauvage que les restaurateurs assaisonnent et vendent avec du poisson) depuis maintenant 10 ans.
Après 3 ans de partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso elle a obtenu 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) et est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 15 sacs de haricot et 40 sacs d’ atièkè. Madame Djeneba C. s’approvisionne en haricot dans les foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants de la ville de Ségou  auprès des paysans producteurs de cette spéculation. Quant à l’atièké il est acheté auprès des grossistes ivoiriens fournissant les commerçants du grand marché de la ville de Sikasso. Avec une clientèle essentiellement composée de restaurateurs de ménagères et de revendeurs, Madame Djeneba C. vend quelque fois à crédit payable mensuellement, au comptant, à domicile et au marché les jours de foire.
Madame Djeneba C.  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, contribuer aux dépenses de la famille et  investir le reste dans les activités. Dans l’avenir elle veut devenir grossiste d’atièkè pour ravitailler les commerçants détaillants de la commune rurale de Finkolo, Farako et les villages environnants.
texts.en:
Madame Djeneba C. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and son in Darsalam, a neighborhood of Farako village in Sikasso prefecture (the third largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). From a young age she has been interested in income-generating activities, particularly selling grains and "atièkè" (cassava- or wild yam-based semolina that restaurant owners season and sell with fish) which she has been doing for over ten years now. Following three years of partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, she received three solidarity loans (group loans) and is on her second individual loan. All of these previous loans have been properly repaid. With this loan, she intends to buy 15 bags of beans and 40 bags of atièkè. Madame Djeneba C. gets her supply of beans from small farmers involved in this trade at weekly markets in the villages near Ségou. The atièkè she gets from Ivoirian wholesalers who stock traders in the main city market of Sikasso. Her customer base is made up mostly of home restaurant owners and resalers; Madame Djeneba C. sometimes sells on weekly credit, for cash, at homes and in the market on market days. Madame Djeneba C. envisions making a weekly profit of 40,000 Francs CFA that will be used to pay the interest on her loan, to contribute to her family's expenses, and the rest to invest in her business. In the future she would like to become a wholesaler of atièkè supplying retailers in the rural commune of Finkolo, Farako, and the surrounding villages.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beans and atiéké.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es casada, progenitora D. cuatro hijos, estudió primaria completa y tiene 63 años D. edad, vive en la comunidad D. Machacmarca.

Es socia del Banco Comunal Ciudad Nueva D. la comunidad D. Machacmarca, Distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia del Collao – Puno; hace dos años empezó con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, incrementando su capital para comprar una vaca con 
 S/. 400.00 Nuevos Soles, ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. vacas en las ferias D. Pilcuyo, Acora  e Ilave.

Con este crédito D. S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará 02 vacas por el valor D.   S/. 900.00  a S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles.

Su visión es tener su establo D. vacas porque le trae suerte y le va mejor en el negocio y no así con los toros.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a 63-year-old married mother of 4 children. She completed elementary school and lives in the community of Machamarca. She is a member of the Ciudad Nueva (New City) microfinance institution in Machamarca, in the Pilcuyo District of the Collao Ð Puno Province. She received her first loan of 300.00 PEN two years ago, increasing her capital in order to purchase a cow for 400.00 PEN. She buys and sells cows at the markets in Pilcuyo, Acora and Ilave for a living.

With this loan of 2,000.00 PEN, which she will repay in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase 2 cows for 900.00 and 1,000.00 PEN each. Her vision is to have her own cow shed because it would bring her luck, and because selling cows is more lucrative for her than selling bulls.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle (cows)

loans.name: Samjana

texts.en: Mrs. Samjana L. opened her hotel in Sanepa near a bus stop. She sells several varieties of food in her hotel, including Nepalese and Newari. She serves coffee and tea as well. Samjana prefers to make Newari foods in her hotel because her Newari foods are very testy and delicious to eat. Samjana's older sister also helps her run her hotel. Miss Samjana L. is requesting a $150 loan to buy food supplies for her business.

loans.use: Food supplies

loans.name: Hannah M.

texts.en:
Hannah M. O. has received no formal education. She is married and has 2 children, and her husband is in the yam business. Hannah has been selling yams in small quantities since 1998 to retailers at Praso market in Elmina, Ghana.

She is responsible for paying utility bills and other family expenses. She will use her loan to pay for transportation costs to areas where she can purchase yams less expensively. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: Pay for transportation costs

loans.name: Keita Nelly

texts.en:
Keita is a member of the Confianza (“Trust”) Village Bank. She is 27 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. 

Keita buys grains, which her mother then takes to the city of Pisco to sell. Pisco is about seven hours from Ayacucho, where Keita and her family live. Her mother travels to Pisco by bus with seasonal grains, then buys whatever local products are in season in Pisco to bring back to Ayacucho to sell (since the two cities have different climates, different locally grown products are in season at different times). She leaves each Friday and returns on Wednesday of the next week. Since her mother does all of the traveling, Keita is able to stay home with her three children in Ayacucho. 

Keita is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy grains. Her goal for the future is to open up her own clothing store in Ayacucho so that her mother doesn’t have to travel any more.

loans.use: Buy grains to sell in Pisco

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es: Sofía tiene 27 años, es madre de 4 hijos y vive junto a su conviviente quien le da la mano en todos sus propósitos. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, el mismo que lo maneja su conviviente quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 2 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que las ganancias le permiten solventar los gastos diarios familiares. Además, no tiene que pagar un chofer para ello, entonces eso acrecienta las ganancias para su hogar. Pero con lo que tiene que luchar a diario es con la competencia, ya que en esta zona de la selva los mototaxis abundan. Este es su 4to crédito con MFP, y en los anteriores préstamos ha demostrado ser responsable en sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a reparar su herramienta de trabajo para que este en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Sofía is 27-years old, has 4 children, and lives with her partner who always gives her a hand with the ideas she has. She owns a motorcycle-rickshaw, which her partner has driven for two years. What Silvia likes about the work is that it allows her to cover daily household expenses. Also, she doesn’t have to hire a driver and this increases her income. At the same time, she has to compete against the many other motorcycle taxis that operate in the jungle region. This is Silvia’s 4th loan with MFP and she has shown herself to be responsible in repaying her prior loans. With the money she requests she will repair her taxi to keep it running in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of motorcycle-taxi

loans.name: Shaidullo

texts.en:
“Responsible fatherhood” is a term that has been converted into concrete fact in Shaidullo’s life. He has always responded satisfactorily to his role as provider for his five children, for whom he cares with much love, in the company of his wife, who is always supportive of him.

Shaidullo works in agricultural activities and has some cattle. He cultivates potatoes, onions, carrots, and other vegetables, subject to the season. At the moment, he is working intensively at his agricultural activities and taking care of his fields. His wife is helping take care of the cows and also sells their milk. They do all this hard work because they want to give an education to each of their two children. They would also like to open a small business some day; until then they will continue working in their fields.

To do this, Shaidullo is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni for the term of 8 months to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. Let’s support Shaidullo in his continuous efforts to provide for the well-being of his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en: Eldaniz A. is 33, single, and a young cattle breeder who lives in the small village of Imishli City with his parents who are on a pension now. He started animal breeding when he was a child because his father taught him. Eldaniz now is an experienced farmer whose dream is to build his own house and marry his fiancé. Eldaniz applied for $1200 to purchase two more calves and fodder.

loans.use: Purchase two more calves and fodder.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel M. is a snack vendor. Everyday, she goes out in the street to sell various food items like chippy, bananacue, ice candy and other delicacies to earn an income for her family. She is 30 years old and has 2 children. She previously worked in Mitzumi, an electronic company in the Philippines. She became pregnant while she was working and decided to go back to her province to get married. In 2000, she started her business. Her snack business is growing and becoming better. 

She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to construct a snack house. She will use part of the loan for additional capital in her business. This loan will truly help Rachel increase her profits and help her provide for her family.

CEVI provides her credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage and provides her a better chance to succeed and make her business grow.

loans.use: To construct a snack house and for additional capital for her business

loans.name: Mrs. Sam Ross Um  Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nineteen people who live in DaeU. Doung village in Takeo province make up the village bank loan. All the members plan to use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Sam Ross U. is the village bank president, who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She is also a rice middle woman, and a fruit-seller in the local market. Both of her businesses are doing well, so she wants to expand them buy purchasing more rice and fruit to resell to earn more profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Muth Chek, is a motor-taxi driver. Mrs. Sam Ross U. is 39 years old and the mother of 4 children, who attend the local school. (Mrs. PU. C.'s husband is in the picture.)

loans.use: Purchase more rice and fruit to resell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 8 hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos ya no viven en su casa. Desde muy niña se ha dedicado a la crianza de animales como vacunos y ovinos, asimismo aprendió a elaborar queso, actividad heredada de su madre. Cada viernes a las 6.00am sale a comprar leche, ya que sus vacas no abastecen para la cantidad de pedidos que tiene y los quesos que elabora son a base de leche de corderito, y son muy solicitados ya que tienen un sabor muy natural e inconfundible. Una vez con los ingredientes básicos procede a colocarlos en lo horma de ichu que nos muestra en la foto, para que siga su proceso de prensado, luego los guarda en cubetas para que escurra el suero, y cada domingo los comercializa en el mercado de su localidad. Gracias a este negocio pudo educar a sus hijos, sin contar con el apoyo del padre. Victoria es una cliente muy responsable, las veces que tiene que llevar los quesos no puede asistir a las reuniones, pero deja su cuota encargada con sus vecinas o familiares para que paguen la cantidad fijada. Este es su 4to crédito con MFP, y durante este tiempo no ha caído en  morosidad. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de avena en chacras sembradas y plantas de maíz, esto le sirve para el alimento de sus vacas.
texts.en:
Victoria is 48 years old and has 8 children, 3 of which no longer live at home. From the time she was a little girl, she has raised animals like cows and sheep, and her mother also taught her to make cheese. Every Friday at 6 a.m. she goes to buy milk, since her cows don't produce enough for the number of orders she receives. She makes her cheeses from cow's milk, and they have a very natural and unmistakable flavor. Once she has the basic ingredients, she places them in a mold made of ichu (a grass native to the Andean altiplano), which she's displaying in the photo, so the cheese can be pressed. Then she puts them on trays so the whey can drain off. She sells them every Sunday in her town's market. Thanks to this business, she's been able to educate her children without any support from their father. Victoria is a very responsible client. When she has to transport the cheeses she can't attend meetings, but she leaves her payments with her neighbors or family members so they can pay them for her. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she hasn't fallen into despair. The money requested will be used to buy oats and corn to feed her cows.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for her cows

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty O. is 32 years old and she is married with 4 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She sells provisions. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN100,000 ($700 US) to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Samina Khalid Javed Group

texts.en:
Riaz baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal selling business.

Gulshan baji and Zakia baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.

Ruqaiya baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to resell.

Samina baji is a group leader of the above mentioned ladies. They all are a citizens of a historical place of the city Lahore named Yadgar, Pakistan. These ladies belong to a poor family, but they have no regrets about that. They are spending their lives in a happy way. They take care of their families, and their family members respect them alot. Samina baji is married to a man who is a butcher by profession and runs a butcher shop in the community. He sells red meat (goat & buffalo) on customer demand. He is a good-natured person; thats why people are attracted to his shop to buy meat. Samina baji is applying for a loan to buy goats for her husband's butcher shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats) for butcher shop

loans.name: Bushra Naz Sajjad Hussain Group

texts.en:
Bushra naz baji is married to S. H. and they have lived in the city of Lahore, Pakistan, for the past nine years. Bushra baji is a very hardworking lady and the leader of this group. She operates a business sewing clothes to contribute towards her family's financial expenses. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine to sew more clothes and to earn more income.

Afroz jahan baji and Maqboolan baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling business.

Razia bano baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Nosheen baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food-selling business.

Shamim A. baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell.

About group loans
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Mrs. Salud M. is 82 years old, widowed, with one child, a pensioner. She presently lives at Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She joined Paglaum in June, 2009, to secure financial assistance for house completion, especially the wall finishing. She aspires to have a descent abode where she can spend the remaining days of her life.
The payment will be from her monthly pension. She is also glad to have access to the member’s mortuary assistance fund in the cooperative wherein she feels secure of her future resting.

loans.use: for house completion-wall finishing.

loans.name: Sun Nak

texts.en: Mrs. Sun Nak C. is 25 years old and she lives in Ta Koem village, in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Soem Reang, sells duck eggs. This couple also uses rice to make wine that they sell, to earn additional income. With this business, Mrs. Sun Nak C. needs a loan to buy six pigs for breeding, pig feed and to use towards improving her business. She and her husband are presented in the photo together.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, for breeding, and feed.

loans.name: Djantoyerela 4 De (Djantoyerela De Zoha) Group

texts.fr:
Les  trois femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA 4 sont toutes mariées et  résident à zoha, un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du Mali. Elles ont  une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans,  4 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne de Soro Yiriwaso, qui correspond avec leur activité étant paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne et tous les trois précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Elles veulent utiliser ce prêt actuel pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles veulent cultiver 3  hectares en  arachide, riz et mil.
Ces femmes estiment leur production  en moyenne à 2 tonnes par hectare soit 6 tonnes. Une partie de la récolte sera vendue dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires et le reste  sera destiné à la nourriture.
Le bénéfice de  la vente sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, prendre en charge les frais scolaire, la santé des enfants et acheter les trousseaux de mariage  des filles.
texts.en:
The three women of the Djantoyerela 4 Group are all married and live in Zoha, a village in the sub-prefecture of Fakola, in the prefecture of Kolondièba, in the third region (Sikasso) of Mali. Their average age is 35 and have, on average, four children. They live in polygamous families and met through family and neighbourhood ties.
When Soro Yiriwaso introduced farming loans, these women, who work as farmers, jumped at the opportunity. They are on their fourth farming loan and the previous three were all repaid without any difficulties.
They want to use this loan to cover the costs of labour, hoeing, and buying seeds, fertiliser and herbicide. They want to grow three hectares of peanuts, rice and millet.
These women hope to produce an average of three tonnes per hectare, therefore six tonnes in total. Part of the harvest will be sold in various weekly markets and the rest will be used as food.
The sale profits will be used to repay the loan, pay for the children’s schooling and healthcare, and pay for their daughters’ dowries.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labour, hoeing, seeds, fertiliser and herbicide.

loans.name: Alicia Aylid

texts.en:
Alicia is 26 years old and is married with one child.  She has a business selling cold drinks.  Alicia’s husband is a diesel mechanic.  

Alicia has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for one year and belongs to the communal bank “Madres Coraje” (Mothers with Courage).  She plans to use this loan of 1,200 soles to expand the small area where she sells her drinks.  She also wants to put up an overhang of dried palm leaves to provide shade.

Alicia feels that Manuela Ramos has provided her with a greater understanding of the importance of savings.  (Alicia must save at least 10 soles, or about $3.30, every month as part of Manuela Ramos’s mandatory savings program.)  Alicia also enjoys the business and life education sessions given by the organization’s loan officers at the monthly meetings of her communal bank.  Alicia’s goal is to someday have her own restaurant.

loans.use: To expand and improve her drink stand

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en: Abenawa A. is a widow and has three children. She sells kenkey: she buys maize, processes it into dough, moulds it into corn husks, and cooks it. She has been in business at Elmina, near Abreshia, since 2006. Abenawa has no formal education. She uses her income to pay fees and utility bills. Abenawa will use this loan to purchase maize in larger quantity for her kenkey. Abenawa plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase maize for kenkey

loans.name: Harriet Nakalema ‘S Group

texts.en: Harriet is a 32 year married with four children aged between 21/2 and 16 years. Three of her children go to school. Harriet resides and owns a four roomed house where she staying with eight people. There is electricity and piped water at home.  Harriet takes care of additional family members  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.  She receives 82 customers a day. Harriet sells second hand clothes in Bwaise Market.  She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. work.  The major challenges she faces in her business are monthly market dues, medication, thieves, feeding the family and increasing prices of clothes. Besides this clothing business she also sells fruits. Harriet has been in this business for 4 years and with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of clothes Harriet is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permant business structure.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, 31 years of age is married to Jose B., they have three children namely; Judy Ann- 15 years of age, 4th year high school student, followed by Jessie James- 13 years old, 1st year high school student, and their youngest is Joshua- 11 years of age, grade five student. They are presently residing at Barangay Pulo San Francisco, Isabela, 12 kilometers away from the national highway.

 She manages a food vending business for almost two years, particularly she sells rice cakes at public market of Cauayan City, aside from that she is also a direct seller of laundry products. Her weekly net income is minimum of PHP 750.00, and maximum of PHP 900.00, she applied a loan amount of PHP 15,000.00 for her additional capital to buy more selling products. She hopes that lenders will grant her loan as much as possible in order to attain her income in supporting her family needs. She believed that "no matter how hard you try to become successful, if you don't know how to build your self- esteem, you will lose what you have".

loans.use: Additional capital in her vending business

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana L. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 58 years old. Bibiana is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Bibiana owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products such as candies, chips, beverages, soaps, shampoos and others in the local community. Bibiana has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bibiana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bibiana is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Bibiana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sosefins

texts.en:
Sosefins S. (0) is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Taufusi. She is married and has three school-aged children.

Sosefins owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 400 WST a month.

In 2008, Sosefins joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Sosefins is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Celestino tiene 53 años y mantiene aún la vitalidad de un joven, él vive con su esposa (Juliana), de 49 años, y con sus dos hijos; Katia de 19  y Alexander de 8 años, que son el motor que lo impulsa para continuar progresando.

Al amanecer de cada día este hombre se despierta con ansias de trabajar la tierra que lo vio nacer, aquella que sostuvo a sus ancestros, y la que hoy sigue dando buenas cosechas para que los hombres trabajadores como él logren mantener a sus familias. La tierra nutrida y preparada que tiene, le brinda a Celestino una deliciosa papa que luego de la cosecha es vendida y así puede obtener ganancias y con ello logra sacar adelante a su familia. 
A él le gusta la agricultura porque la aprendió de sus padres, no le dieron una profesión pero le dieron las herramientas necesarias para trabajar y le enseñaron como producir la tierra; además también se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino que comercializa en los mercados de su localidad. 
En el futuro no solo le gustaría sembrar papa, sino también hortalizas, porque sabe que debe aprovechar la tierra al máximo y pensar siempre en el futuro, para darles a sus hijos una buena educación y enseñarles técnicas nuevas que les permitan sobrevivir en este mundo que crece cada día de una manera vertiginosa.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene Celestino con MFP y lo invertirá en la compra de abono, insecticidas y fertilizantes para su tierra, porque sabe que además de aprovecharla debe cuidarla para seguir produciendo. Celestino pertenece a un banco comunal establecido que es muy responsable con cada uno de los pagos porque saben que solo así todos tendrán la oportunidad de progresar.
texts.en:
Celestino is 53 years old, and still maintains the vitality of a youngster. He lives with his wife (Juliana) who is 49 years old, and his two children; Katia is 19 years old, and Alexander is 8. They are what give him the motivation to forge ahead. This man wakes each and every day anxious to work the land that witnessed his birth, which sustained his ancestors and today continues to yield prosperous crops so that hard-working men like him can care for their families. The nutrient-rich and prepared land provides Celestino with a delicious potato crop that he harvests and then sells to help support his family. He enjoys farming, a vocation he learned from his parents. They didn’t provide him with a career, but gave him the necessary skills and taught him how to work the land. In addition, he raises sheep to sell in nearby markets. In the future, he would like to plant not only potatoes but also vegetables. He knows he must take advantage of the land to its fullest and always think about the future, to provide his children with good educations and the skills necessary to survive in this world that grows at a dizzying pace. This is Celestino’s third loan with MFP, and he plans to invest the funds into fertilizers and insecticides for his lands. He knows that, in addition to enjoying the fruits of his labor, he must care for the land so it will continue to produce. Celestino belongs to an established cooperative bank that is very responsible for all its repayments, because they know this is the only way that they will have the opportunity to advance.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita S. is a hardworking grandmother, mother, and wife. She has no other wish for herself but to see her grandchildren happy and enjoying their lives out of the umbrella of poverty. Her three grandchildren, who range in age from eight to 12 years old, are her inspiration and reason to be productive. She feels responsible for them because her son has no stable source of income to support his family. Somehow she considers herself unlucky for the achievements of her only child whom she worked hard for.

However, having loving and sweet grandchildren, she has found the reason to live again and have a business. That is why she joined ASHI, KIVA's field partner in the Philippines--to be able to have access to credit that she will use as capital in starting a small business.

loans.use: To finance a rice production (rice planting) business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, age 56, lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is a client of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She runs a grocery store where she sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers, and she hopes someday to own a supermarket. She is married and has seven children.

Juliana is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha Elizabeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 ya son independientes.

Martha Elizabeth, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió implementar su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 100.00 y empezó comprando 07 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Martha Elizabeth, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando más lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Martha Elizabeth belongs to the Esmeralda Communal Bank, Tarapoto District, San Martín Province and Department. She is married, is 42 years old and is the mother of three children who are now grown. Martha Elizabeth is a hard-working and determined woman, so she decided to start her own business selling soft drinks in a well air-conditioned space, located in her own house. She runs the business herself, without a fixed schedule or a boss. She tells us that she began with 100.00 soles and began by buying 7 cases of soft drinks. She saw that it went very well for her, so little by little she began investing more. Today she continues with the same business and is now well-known to her customers, who are her neighbors, relatives and friends. With this loan of 3,000.00 soles, she will buy more drinks like: cases of soft drinks in different flavors, sizes and brands, as well as carbonated and non-carbonated mineral water. Martha Elizabeth is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva's field partner) for helping her when she needed it most. She is responsible with her payments and expects to keep being so.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Elcard

texts.en:
Karanzi Elcard is 38 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school. He also takes care of some of his siblings. 

Elcard is a farmer. Also, he has dealt in the sale of agricultural products like bananas from the Rutabago trading centre for ten years. He is able to make approximately $62 in profits each week. This helps to boost his business when he has no other source of income.

He has been able to take care of his family and educate his children. He has been getting loans through the Kiva field partner, Pearl Microfinance, for four years, and ever since he has not regretted the move he made. 

Elcard needs a loan to be able to buy more bananas for resale from his stall.

loans.use: Buying more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Sae

texts.en: Mrs. Sae S. is 54 years old, married and lives in Tralach village, Takeo province. She has two children, both of whom work in a garment factory. She and her husband, Mr. Chin Sai Sor, make a living as farmers. When not farming, Mrs. Sae S. supplements her income by selling groceries. She has applied for loan for 1,300,000 Riel from AMK to enlarge her business by buying more groceries to sell to her customers. This should allow her to satisfy their needs while also improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda S. is from the village of  Magsaysay, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nilda manages a video karaoke business.  Nilda has been in business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Nilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase materials needed to provide her services.  Nilda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to expand her business.
----------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Expanding the business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in 2008. She was seeking financial support for her business and that’s why she joined the MFI (micro-finance institute).

Jocelyn is 49 years old and is married with eight children. She is involved in rice farming and, like other farmers, she wants to grow her farm so she would also earn more.

Jocelyn is now requesting Php 14,000. This loan will be used to buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cholpon's Group

texts.en:
The lives of ordinary people cease to be ordinary once these seemingly ordinary people change the way they think and perceive reality. At this very moment it is very important that they are able to find the necessary support to implement their ideas into their lives. 

Cholpon S. is the leader of this group. She is forty-six years old. Cholpon and her husband have three wonderful children. Their only aim now is to give their children a proper education and help them get on their feet and bring their own dreams into reality. While their children are growing up, Cholpon and her husband are doing their best to provide them with all necessary things, whether it is food, clothes or school supplies, so that their children do not feel the need for anything. The elder daughters are college students and the younger daughter goes to school.

Cholpon’s husband is a school teacher, and he and Cholpon keep some cattle and trade them on weekends. Cholpon has applied for this loan because she hopes to buy a calf for feeding and resale. Their aim is to increase the total population of their livestock in a short time. 

Cholpon’s partners: 

Ermekgul A., 29, has three children. Her husband is in charge of water distribution at the fields. Ermekgul stays at home with the children. She hopes to obtain this loan to buy sheep. 

Sapina K., 57, has five children. She and her husband are retired and their children are grown and married. Sapina hopes to obtain this loan to buy sheep. 

Syinagul T., 54, is a mother of five children. She and her husband keep some cattle and their children help them. Syinagul has applied for this loan to buy two sheep for feeding and resale. 

Gulaida R., 39, is the wife of a tractor driver. She has four children. Two of her children go to school. To provide for the family her husband also keeps some cattle. Gulaida hopes to obtain this loan to buy a calf. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy a calf for feeding and resale

loans.name: Naajav

texts.en:
Naajav is 41 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband is an electrician for a private company. One of her daughters attends a university, and other two children attend a local secondary school. 

Naajav operates a food products trading business at a local food market, called Han-Ord. She has been operating her business since 2004, and has steadily expanded her business. Naajav purchases her products from a local central market to save money on transportation. In addition, when her friends or relatives go to Russia or Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, they bring back products for her, which also saves her money. She has previously received an 800,000 tugrug (~ 570 USD) loan, which she used to triple the size of her business. Naajav is a open person and focused on the future. She says, “The most important thing for me is to provide a good education for my children and to be able to pay their university fees until they graduate.” 

Naajav is requesting a 2,700,000 tugrug (~  1930 USD) loan to purchase a variety of food products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of food products.

loans.name: Ubumwe Group

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 33 years old, married with two children of 2 and 10 years old.  Jean Bosco is the president of a group called UBUMWE and this group is widely known for selling food in their small restaurant.  This restaurant is open from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Jean Bosco and his team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company with the purpose of renovating as well as increasing the size of their business site. In addition, they will buy some needed equipment such as plates, saucepans, chairs for customers, etc.  With the use of this loan, Jean Bosco and his team hope to earn more profits, which in turn will allow them individually to build a secure future for their families and buy some domestic animals for rearing.

loans.use: The purchase of equipment such as plates, saucepans, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Alfredo Jose

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 22 años de dar clases de música.  A partir de la revolución y en los últimos años, el a brindado el servicio apoyado por la alcaldía del municipio que le facilita el uso de la “Casa de Cultura” para dar clases.

Alfredo va a usar este préstamo  para el mantenimiento de sus equipos musicales.  El ha tenido préstamos en el pasado y los ha usado para comprar más instrumentos musicales.

Alfredo está casado y tiene 1 hijo de 15 años.  El Sueña de poder remodelar su casa en el futuro.
texts.en:
Alfredo has taught music for twenty-two years. In the past few years, since the revolution, he has offered his services with support from the mayor's office that allows him to use the Culture House to teach his classes in. Alfredo is going to use this loan to maintain his musical equipment. He had taken out loans in the past and used them to purchase musical instruments. Alfredo is married and has a fifteen-year-old son. He would like to remodel his home in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Teach music classes.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith tiene 22 años, es una mujer trabajadora, comparte su vida con su esposo Ángel de 25 años y con su hija Luz clarita de 2 años, juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace más de 2 años arriendan terrenos en donde plantan café y plátano, que junto a su esposo trabajan para generarse mayores ingresos económicos, que le ayudarán a cubrir los gastos domiciliarios. Paralelamente su pareja trabaja como operario en los terrenos de los hacendados, donde gana S/. 20.00 soles por día, pero en épocas de cosecha trabaja el doble además su esposa también es contratada para éste trabajo. Lo que más le gusta a Judith es vivir en el campo, pues los sonidos que producen los animales y las plantas le transmiten la tranquilidad y eso le hace feliz. Por otro lado le incomoda trasladar sus cosechas a la ciudad por la distancia que tiene que recorrer con los pesados sacos, pero dice que vale la pena. Además las utilidades que le deja, son bastante considerables y le permiten ahorrar, ya que desea comprarse su propias chacras e incrementar su producción. Siendo su mayor anhelo brindarle a su hija una adecuada calidad de vida. “Cada sacrificio es por mi pequeña, quien es mi motivación cada día” refiere. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y esta contenta de continuar trabajando con su grupo comunal porque conoce la metodología de trabajo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará decenas de plantas de café y varios sacos de fertilizantes para proteger sus tierras.
texts.en:
Judith is 22 years old. She is a hardworking woman who shares her life with her husband Ángel, who is 25, and their two year old daughter Luz Clarita. For more than two years, they have leased farmland on which they grow coffee and bananas. Judith and her husband have worked to generate more income to help cover the household expenses. At the same time, her husband works the fields of other farmers. He earns 20 PEN each day, but during the harvest season there is twice as much work, so Judith is also hired for this job. What she enjoys most is living in the country since the plants and the sounds of the animals convey a peace that makes her happy. On the flip side, she dislikes transporting her crops to the city over great distances since the sacks are heavy. However, she says the effort is worth it. Judith indicates the services she utilized have been quite substantial now that she has the chance to save toward the purchase of her own land in hopes of increasing production. Her greatest wish is to provide her daughter an adequate quality of life. “Each sacrifice is for my little girl, since she is my motivation each day,” says Judith.

This is her second loan with MFP. Judith is happy to continue working with her Communal Bank because she is familiar with their work methodology. The loan she requested will be used to buy dozens of coffee plants and sacks of fertilizers to help protect her land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coffee plants & fertilizers

loans.name: Maqsooda's Group

texts.en:
Maqsooda lives in a small city called Riwind which is about 30km from Lahore, Pakistan. She lives there with her family. Her husband's name is K. A.. He works in the field and also sells milk. 


Maqsooda is a very talented lady. She not only manages the household chores but also handles her business of making artificial flowers for sale. She does this work to generate income for her family.  


She has eight children: seven sons and a daughter. Four of them couldn’t get an education and they had to work to financially support the family, but Maqsooda has managed to provide education facilities for her younger children.  



Maqsooda has applied for a loan for the fifth time from Asasah. With this loan, she will buy another buffalo to expand her husband’s milk selling business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for the dairy business

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally E. is 41 years old and is a villager who lives in Si Sla village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Thol Sao, is a high school director who is able to receive a little salary to support his family. 
Mrs. Phally E. is requesting a loan partly to pay for her children's school fees and the rest to buy rice seed to cultivate rice. The couple has four children who all are students and also support their mother on the farm. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
Nodira, a sharp, energetic entrepreneur from Dushanbe, Tajikistan, started her own clothing business 16 years ago and has built a successful enterprise. She has a good location in the market for her sales, along with an attractive display of clothing for passing customers. Nodira is a married woman with three children, and her income helps her to support her children's pursuit of a good education. Nodira has requested a loan of 7500 Somoni so that she can purchase new clothing inventory. This loan will allow her to increase her income by having the right clothing available to meet seasonal demand. Over the last three years, Nodira has proven to be a great loan client with IMON International, and we are glad to have this new opportunity to continue assisting her with her business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame E. is married and has two children. She is into the sale of fruit like bananas at Takoradi. She has been educated up to the junior high level. Her husband is a driver. She helps her husband by feeding the children.

Maame will use the loan to purchase more fruit to sell. With the new revenues from her expanded business, she plans to save to complete a building she has already started.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TESORITO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel;  La socia tiene 39 años de edad, ella es separada  y tiene 2 hijos, la socia estudio ciencias de la comunicación en la universidad nacional, ella es periodista y trabaja en Tv Sur y en radio la hora; La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y ella es padre y madre para sus hijos, ella necesita ahora el préstamo para abrir una distribuidora de libros, para trabajar por horas, ella ya vio al detalle este proyecto y lo hará realidad en las siguientes semanas  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en una distribuidora de libros.        

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Little Treasure” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Isabel, she is 39 years old, is separated and has 2 children. The member studied communication in the national university; she is a journalist and works in TV Sur and in la Hora radio. Mrs. Isabel is a very hardworking woman and she is a mother and father to her children, she needs the loan to open a book distributor and plans on working per hour. She has worked in every detail of this project and will make it come true in the following weeks. Mrs. Isabel needs the loan invest in the book distributor.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to her through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payments of her quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan invest in the book distributor.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a dairy farmer who lives in Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. For the last 16 years, he has made a living managing a farm and now employs two people. He generates income by selling milk and maize in the local market.

Samwel is 49 years old,  married and has five children who are between the ages of 5 and 18. All of his children currently attending school.

Samwel recently repaid his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo. Now he is applying for a third loan, for 70,000 KES, to buy a cow. He says that the extra income made possible by this loan will help him pay his children's school fees. His main challenge at the moment is securing enough feed for his animals.

He is grateful to Juhudi for the help it has provided.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay his children's education expenses

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana vive en anticretico con su esposo e hija menor en la zona de San Sebastián de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos, tres casados; el esposo es auditor y trabaja independientemente, ella trabaja como enfermera en el hospital donde percibe un salario. Ambos ingresos  mantienen el hograr.

El crédito que solicita es para pagar un tratamiento medico para ella en una clínica ya que el servicio de salud en Bolivia no es el adecuado y es mejor un medico particular.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2009 y paga muy bien, lo cual hace que pueda acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en: Ana lives on leased land with her husband and young daughter, in the San Sebastian zone of the city of La Paz. She is married and has four children, three of whom are married; her husband is an auditor and works independently. She works as a nurse in a hospital, where she receives a salary. Their two incomes maintain the household. The loan that she is requesting is to pay for a medical treatment for herself in a clinic, since the health service in Bolivia is not adequate and private doctors are better. She has been an Impro client since 2009 and pays back very well, which has allowed her to access a new loan.

loans.use: The cost of a private medical treatment for her.

loans.name: El's Group

texts.en: The two people shown in the photograph are low-income people who are jointly requesting a loan. They are all living in Kompong Chhnang Province in Cambodia. One of them, Mrs. El L., age 42, has been selected to be leader by the other member. To earn a living, she cultivates a rice crop in her own farmland. Mrs. El L.’s husband, Mr. Mear Mao, is a 46-year-old construction worker who makes about $3 per day. This couple has eight children. Four of the children are single and four are married and live in their own house. In addition, Mrs. El L. also sells fish paste, sugar, and rice to customers in the market. In order to earn extra profit and to make the business more successful, Mrs. El L. will be using the loan she requested to accumulate a larger quantity of her inventory items. The other borrower is Mr. Y.. He is a grocery seller who is asking for a loan to sustain her business growth.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger quantity of her inventory items.

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Mrs. Huon M. is a 33-year-old married woman.  She is a villager living in Ampil village, Kandal province. 

Mrs. Huon M. and her husband, Mr. Met Kuok, are farmers who own a plot of rice field that they use to cultivate rice for a living. 

For this farm, they do not have enough money to buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice. So Mrs. Huon M. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed to cultivate rice.  Aside from being a farmer, her husband is also pig middleman.  

This couple has five children who are attending the local school and also help in their parents' businesses.  Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Batochir

texts.en:
Mr. Batochir D. is 47 years old, married and has two sons. His elder son, Gankhulug, 22, is married and works as a policeman at the railroad police department; he lives with his family in his own house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia.
