She lives at Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. With her five years of experience, she has been able to be very supportive of her husband in paying the bills and feeding the children. Fortunately, her business is in a strategic location within the town where she lives. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc., to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products.

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
EL Señor Oscar Danilo  López, Labora como conductor en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene tres  hijos, estos se encuentran en edad escolar, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro años, en ese lapso ha invertido  5 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales requerido para el cambio del sistema eléctrico de la vivienda, para Brindarle mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a su hija. 

Oscar dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho ya que ahora cuenta con una vivienda segura para su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar works as a driver in the eastern market in Managua. He has three children that go to school. He has had loans from CEPRODEL in the past four years. During this time he has had five loans which he has used to improve the home in which he lives. He gives thanks to CEPRODEL for providing him with these loans. He is an excellent customer. With the money from the loan he is requesting, he will buy the necessary materials so that he can change the electrical system in his home. This will provide better security and conditions for his daughter. Oscar said thanks for the loans given to him by CEPRODEL. They have helped him provide a secure home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve his home and make it better.

loans.name: Moyoo

texts.en: Moyoo V. is currently in the business of selling both dried and fresh fish in the market and is requesting a loan to buy more dried fish to sell. Moyoo is 48 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motor boat for fishing. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish  to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy corn and peanuts

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Lofty goals require big efforts. Sometimes in order to reach your goal you have to put up with temporary obstacles and get used to rough conditions. However, provided that there is determination to keep going and readiness to sacrifice personal comfort, the result does not let the person down. The question is whether he or she is ready to go beyond the usual conditions and take a risk. Once they make this decision, go through this path and achieve success, their stories become models for others to follow.

Elmira is the leader of this group. She is 43 years old. Elmira and her family live in the city of Tokmok. Her husband manufactures metal instruments and has a monthly salary of $50. Elmira’s daughter rents space in a big shop and sells bijouterie (jewelry). She manages to make $80. Elmira’s son is 14 and studies in the seventh grade. Some years ago Elmira started with selling children’s clothes and later on switched to trading in men’s and women’s clothes. This business provides her with a monthly income of $350. Elmira hopes to obtain this loan and invest the funds to increase the turnover by buying more kinds of clothes for the upcoming spring season. Her future plans are to buy a flat and provide her son with a college education. Elmira’s partners are: Saikal is 41, divorced and has two daughters. To provide for her daughters and her elderly mother, Saikal sells potatoes in the local market. She brings potatoes from another region. Saikal needs a loan to be able to bring more potatoes. Kuljan is 38, divorced and has a daughter. Kuljan trades in bed clothing. She also manufactures national articles and manages to earn $160. Kuljan needs a loan as she wants to buy more bed clothing. Rayimbek is 23, married and has a newborn daughter. Until now he has been trading in cattle with his brother and sharing the income. He decided to take out a loan and start his own business. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To increase turnover by buying seasonal clothes for the upcoming spring season

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: La  Sra. Ana Lucia García Q., es de estado civil soltera y con un hijo menor, actualmente  se desempeña como Kardista en un centro de salud del Municipio de San Rafael del Sur, este crédito lo solcito para realizar mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana Lucia García Q. is single and has a minor son. She works as a file clerk in a municipal health center in San Rafael del Sur. She will use the funds to make some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn M., 41 years old, is the farmer of a small parcel of rice farm. She is also the mother of eight children and desires to prosper her business to be able to save money for the future of her family.

Currently, they are planting rice seedlings. Marilyn would like to grow her harvest so that she will be able to get larger shares of rice grain. Deep inside her, she desires to have her own farm.

Marilyn would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en: Kou T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called In God We Trust. She is 41 years old, married and has four children who range from 12 to 18 years old. She could not continue her education through 9th grade. For 20 years, Kou has been selling peanuts, plantains and sugar at the Redlight market in Paynesville, Liberia. She sells goods that customers need in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. Kou started by selling at home but now sells in the market. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 40,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more peanuts and sugar. Her goal is to grow her business to a better size and improve the living conditions of her family. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kou is the one holding the sign and Oretha is in the inset photo in the lower right corner. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more peanuts and sugar

loans.name: Mujeres Bendecidas 3 Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Bendecidas (Blessed Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their three children.

Altagracia is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she believes that working with Esperanza will improve her sales. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of making and selling underwear, by purchasing panties, bras and materials such as sequins and beads for making lingerie. She will use the profits to invest in her dreams of owning a car, improving her home and seeing her children through to the university. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy bras, panties and material for making lingerie.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Cet homme est âgé de 38 ans et marié avec 02 enfants. Il est tenancier d’un débit de boisson. 
Il est propriétaire du « BAR HOREB » situé en bord du boulevard du 30 Aout à Adidogomé. Il y vend essentiellement des produits de la Brasserie nationale. Avec le crédit sollicité, il approvisionnera son bar pour la satisfaction de la clientèle.
Comptant sur l’accroissement de son activité, il espère mieux répondre aux besoins de scolarisation de ses 02 enfants.
texts.en:
Kossi T. is 38 years old and married with two children. He owns and runs a roadside bar called “Bar Horeb” on Boulevard du 30 Aout in Adidogomé. He mainly sells products from the National Breweries. With the loan requested he will stock up his bar to keep his customers happy. He is relying on his business to grow and hopes to be better able to meet the educational needs of his two children.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Rosmery;   ella tiene 23 años de edad, la socia es soltera., Nuestra socia trabaja en el restaurante el embrujo, ella es moza, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar víveres para su hogar y un televisor.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosemery belongs to the Perolniyoc Communal Bank. She lives in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco, Peru. Rosemery is 23 years old and is single. She works as a waitress in a restaurant called El Embrujo. She is asking for a loan to buy items for her house, including a television. Rosemery values and is grateful for the support offered by microlending, and she promises to repay the loan as agreed.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a television and other items.

loans.name: Rossetti

texts.en:
N. Rossetti is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka area of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  She is hardworking and wants to succeed in life.  Rossetti has a retail shop in Kalisizo where she sells various retail goods and food.  She has had her business for six months.

To help expand her business, Rossetti is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stock and to expand her inventory. Rossetti hopes to generate profit from her business to support herself in the future.


Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: to purchase stock

loans.name: Mwafua

texts.en: Mwafua is married with six children. Four of her children have finished school and two still attend school. She has been operating her vegetable stall and a retail shop for the past seven years and sells at retail to her neighboring community. With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to start a pharmacy shop, purchase medicine for her pharmacy shop, 50kgs of rice, sugar and a sack of beans. She faces the challenge of seasonality. Mwafua lives at her own house with no electricity but with piped water. She hopes that someday she will build houses to rent. Her main reason for working with Yehu is because of its good reputation and to get a loan to start a business. She cites school fees as her greatest monthly expense.

loans.use: To purchase medicine for her pharmacy, rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food items for his stall

loans.name: Luis German

texts.es:
Luis de 53 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales) el tiene un taller de cerrajería (lugar donde se reparan puertas, y cerraduras). 

El comenzó hace 12 años para poder mantener a su familia recorría las calles del Guasmo con sus herramientas, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su propio taller de cerrajería, Ahora trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano, con alguno de sus hijos. 

Para poder continuar con su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo herramientas y materiales de cerrajería, en el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Luis is 53 years old. He lives in the Guasmo of Guayaquil (an urban zone where most of the residents are informal merchants). He has a locksmith shop where he repairs doors and locks. He started 12 years ago to be able to support his family. He walked the streets of the Guasmo with his tools and little by little with his hard work was able to open his own workshop. Now he works there every day starting very early with some of his children. To be able to continue with the business, he wants to buy tools and locksmith materials with the loan. In the future he wants to re-build his house with his earnings from the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools, materials

loans.name: Bera Cruz

texts.es: Bera Cruz de 63 años, ella es una persona muy conocida y quien cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos no solo por ser una persona responsable, sino también por ser alguien muy amable y que atiende de la mejor forma a sus clientes. Ella posee una pulpería la cual está ubicada en su casa de habitación, Bera solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir su tienda y de esta forma ofrecer todos los productos que son necesario en el hogar, pues siempre está pensando en llevar el pan de cada día de su hogar. Lo que más desea, es el poder mejorar su estabilidad económica y aprovechar la oportunidad que la vida le ha brindando de poder ganarse la vida de una forma segura.
texts.en:
Bera Cruz is 63 years old and she is a very well known person and she benefits from many good references from her neighbors. She is not only a very responsible person but she is also very kind and she excels in customer service. She has a grocery store located in her house. Bera resquests a loan to have funds enough to restock her store and be in the position to offer her clients the products they need for the home. She always has on her mind having to provide for their family on a daily basis. Her greatest wish is to improve her financial situation and to take full advantage of the opportunity that is granted here, to earn herself some security in life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Salome Kagwira

texts.en:
Salome K. is 31 years old and married to Dominic K., a businessman. They have one child. Salome has been operating a beauty salon for about two years now, and she is able to make approximately 28,000 KES a month.

With her first loan from KADET, Salome intends to buy a new hair dryer. With the anticipated profit, she wants to stock the salon with more cosmetics and beauty products. She would like to open a cosmetics shop that can supply products to other small-scale shops in Thika.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer

loans.name: James Kariuki

texts.en: James has operated his retail shop selling basic household goods and clothes in Naivasha town for the last five years.  He is 39 years old, married to Eunice Musenya, and they have four children. James was introduced to KADET by his friend and, having repaid his previous loans, is now applying for his third one with which he will add clothes in his shop for resale. James is also hoping to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale in his shop.

loans.name: Sop Sokhna Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SOKHNA DIARRA a été créé le 27 septembre 2009 au jour du financement du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 18 femmes qui sont toutes issus du même village. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par proximité. Le groupe de Solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois KEUR SERIGNE LOUGA SUD. 

Madame NDEYE M. debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants.

Elle fait un petit commerce de divers produits. Elle vend sur table des condiments tels des oignons, du piment, de l'ail, du poivre etc. 

avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et accroitre ses bénéfices.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille. Par exemple la santé, la nourriture et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The community bank named Sop Sokhna Diarra was founded on September 27, 2009.  The group is made up of 18 women that are all originally from the same village. They came together as friends and neighbors. The group is a member of the community bank Keur Serigne Louga Sud (Kiva Field Partner). 

Mrs. Ndeye M., standing to the right in the photo, is the leader of the group. She is 37 years old. She is married and she is the mother of 6 children. 

She has a small business through which she sells various merchandise. She sells condiments such as onions, chili peppers, garlic, pepper etc. 

With this new loan she will stock her store to better meet client demand and increase her profits.

Her goal is to help her husband in the support of the family, especially to provide health care, nutrition, and schooling to their children.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a member of Faulu Kenya under Dagoretti Pamoja group.  He joined the group as a businessman who sells secondhand clothes.  He also is a farmer.  Thomas gets a good number of customers because his business is located in the market.  He hopes to someday open a boutique.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy clothes, especially T-shirts, sweaters, and track suits.

loans.use: To buy clothes, especially T-shirts, sweaters and track suits

loans.name: Babara's Group

texts.en:
Babara has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in his car seat cover making business. He will invest the loan in buying foam, leather, and thread in bulk quantity.  That will enable him to make seat covers in larger quantity to sell.  

Babara lives in a city named Borewala, famous for its shrines in Pakistan.  She doesn’t have any children yet. She is a caring lady and carries out her responsibilities of a housewife well at home.
 
This is the first time Babara has applied for a loan from Asasah. She is hopeful that with the help of this loan investment, her husband will be able to up-lift his business by increasing his sales, and her family will be able to enjoy better facilities of life and she will return the loan without any problem.

loans.use: To buy material for car seat cover making business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: sFor business expansion

loans.name: Procora

texts.en:
Procora E. is from the Maquilao Tangub City. She is 42 years old. Procora is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Procora owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. 

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood in the local community. Procora has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Procora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Procora is requesting a loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Procora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seafood products to sell

loans.name: La Gata Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Gata está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Agustina Ángela F. Obando  de 36 años  quien inicio vendiendo tortillas actualmente tiene una pequeña venta donde oferta maíz, queso, huevo, chicharron, cuajadas, leche agria etc. 
Su meta principal es la venta de verdura en lo cual invertira el crédito y llegar a tener una miscelánea. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Sandi Salomé S. Gómez de 20 años  quien tiene una pequeña tortillería y Hessel Raquel S. Alegría comercializa productos Avon.
texts.en:
The group “La Gata” consists of three hardworking, industrious, and enterprising women. One of them is Agustina Ángela F. Obando, age 36, who started selling tortillas. She currently has a small shop where she offers corn, cheese, eggs, pork, cheese curds, sour milk, and other products. Her main goal is selling vegetables for which she will use this loan. She wants to have a general store.

The other group members are Sandi Salomé S. Gómez (age 20) who has a small tortilla shop and Hessel Raquel S. Alegría who sells Avon products.

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: James Ngala

texts.en: James Ngala S. is 40 years old and married. His wife is a business woman. James is a café owner and has been in this business for one year. This is James' second loan from KADET LTD and he plans to purchase sacks of rice, cereals, potatoes, and tomatoes. The anticipated profits have been directed to the expansion of his business. His dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, cereals, potatoes, and tomatoes

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard N. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. Bernard has a retail shop business, which he has run for eight years.
To help expand his business, Bernard has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and soap for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Bernard hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Wilfredo Rene

texts.es: El Sr. Wilfredo, es cliente antiguo de la institución y muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, el tiene un taller de balatas y frenos, ya que esa es su especialidad, en el negocio le colabora su esposa quien tiene la venta de lubricantes, ellos tienen dos hijas que se encuentran en colegio, los créditos que sacaron de emprender fueron para aumento de capital,  ellos incrementaron su capital y bienes del hogar, lograron construir su vivienda propia, es una pareja muy trabajadora, mejoraron su negocio y su calidad de vida, todos los créditos fueron créditos kiva, con el dinero del crédito compraran repuestos de movilidad y compra de lubricantes en cantidad, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Wilfredo is a longtime client of Emprender who is very punctual with his payments. He has a repair shop where he installs brakes and pads, which is his specialty. At his business, he and his wife work together selling lubricants. They have two daughters who are in high school. Wilfredo has taken out loans with Emprender in order to increase his capital, which enabled him to buy household goods and build his house. His wife is a hard worker who strives to improve their business and their quality of life.

All of their loans have been through Kiva and the money was used to buy automobile parts and lubricants in quantity. Wilfredo is very grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: Purchase automobile lubricants

loans.name: Kenia

texts.en:
Kenia is one of our businesswomen. She has been selling underwear for approximately two years, after she received her first loan and she runs other business activities. Now on her 8th loan, she is investing in more underwear and other clothing. Her last three loans have been used to improve this business activity. She is a wholesale seller. 

Kenia’s family consists of her child and her long-term partner. They are a young family, with a lot of goals.  Her next challenge is to have her own house and to have an improved business. Her dreams include finishing her house and having a large business. At the moment, she will be reinvesting her business profits to expand her business in inventory and customers.

loans.use: to buy  underwear to sell wholesale

loans.name: David Njai

texts.en: David is 49 years old and married to Lucy Njeri. He has practised farming in Naivasha town for the last four years. He was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by his friend and this will be his third loan. He has paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm. In the future, David hopes to practise large-scale mixed farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en:
Odonchimeg, 27, is married and lives with her husband and a son in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia.  They live in a house on a small plot of land that they have owned for several years.  

Her husband helps her with the business and her son attends a local primary school. Odonchimeg began her business by operating a small cafe in 2003 and started selling dairy products in 2008.  She owns the place where she sells dairy products and plans to sell consumer goods in addition to her dairy product trading. 

She wants to expand her business and increase her profit in order to fulfill her goals.  She is a hardworking and initiative taking person who says, "I want to expand my business, increase my profit and fulfill my dreams in the future".  She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more dairy products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Phy S., age 26, is a good and caring father to his lovely young child. He lives in the province of Siem Reap and works as a local fisherman. He always goes to fish in and around Tunle Sap River. After fishing, Phy S. and his wife take their fresh fish to sell at the local market in order to earn their daily income. They have been running this business for many years and have done so with great success.
Phy S. is currently very busy with his business activities because there is an increasing number of customers wanting to buy the fish he sells. To please his customers, Phy S. is asking for a loan to buy additional fishing tools. With the remainder of the loan he will buy different types of fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing tools and different types of fish to sell

loans.name: Katty Carina

texts.es:
Katty de 28 años, es una mujer  trabajadora que empezó su actividad hace 6 años en la mercadería de ropa y zapatos que su mama le manda desde España, tiene un taller mecánico que por su padre enfermo ella lo está administrando.

Ella tiene personal encargado para los servicios que ofrece, ya que ella administra porque su conyugue labora en una empresa como electricista y lo abre todos los días. Con el préstamo va a comprar herramientas básicas para el taller. En un futuro desea tener su propia casa ya que vive en la casa de sus padres y que su esposo se encargue del taller.
texts.en:
Katty, 28 years old, is a hard-working woman who started working six years ago selling clothing and shoes that her mother sent her from Spain. She has  a mechanic shop that she's been running since her father became ill.

She has staff in charge of the services offered while she manages since her spouse works for a company as an electrician and he opens everyday. With the loan, she is going to buy basic tools for the shop. In the future, she wishes to have her own house since she lives in her parents' home and that her husband take over the shop.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “ PRO DESARROLLO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Ceferina, la socia tiene 38 años de edad; la socia es conviviente, ella tiene 4 hijos de 20, 17, 15, 12, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía ella trabaja de forma independiente y requiere el préstamo para poder implementar su negocio la socia elabora parte de la artesanía que vende como bisutería, trabajos en lana, como guantes, chalinas, mantillas y la otra mitad que es ceniceros, floreros, vasos y todo lo referente a arcilla y pinturas ella compra hecho. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de artesanía. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Ceferina belongs to the "Pro Desarrollo" community bank located in the town of Pisac, province of Calca, department of Cusco. She is 38 years old, married and has four children, ages 20, 17, 15 and 12. She alternates her household responsibilities with her crafts business, where she works independently. She is requesting the loan to set up her business. She makes handicrafts to sell, partially jewelry and wool items like gloves, scarves, and handkerchiefs, and the other part ashtrays, vases and glasses. She buys all the clay crafts and paintings she sells. Ceferina is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of handicrafts. She is grateful and wishes to express that she will make her payments with discipline.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts.

loans.name: Jorge Alfredo

texts.es:
Jorge, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, tiene un taller de electrónica desde hace dos años, el repara todo tipo de electrodomésticos, aprendió a través del estudio y hoy día realiza su trabajo para sostener su hogar.
Él quiere invertir en la compra de repuestos y prensas para el taller, porque tiene unos trabajos que aun no termina, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra y así tener lo necesario para finalizar lo pendiente y tener para próximos que puedan llegar.
Su objetivo es mantener el trabajo, ampliar el taller y generar cada día mejores ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge lives with his wife and children.  He has had an electronics repair shop for the last two years.  He repairs all kinds of electrical appliances.  He learned through studies and today does this work to support his family.

He wants to buy parts and clamps for the workshop because he has some unfinished jobs.  He is asking for the loan to do the purchase so that he can have available everything he needs to finish his pending jobs and be ready for the next ones that might arrive.  His objective is to stay in business, enlarge the shop and generate improved income every day for his family.

loans.use: to buy parts and clamps for the shop.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene comes from the village of Minadze, Akhaltsikhe District. She lives with her two sons (15 and 20 years old) and mother-in-law (74 years old). Irene works as a cook in the local military office. Her salary is 155 Laris per month. Her younger son goes to school and the elder one serves in the army as a contractor. Along with her regular job, Irene also leads the agricultural business of the family: She cultivates 0.5 ha of the family-owned land and grows potatoes and other vegetables. Harvested products are sold locally. In addition, the family owns three milk cows and two calves. Irene produces traditional Georgian cheese from the gathered milk and sells it in the village. 

With the requested loan, Irene will purchase calves to raise and sell in the fall for a higher price. The increase in profits will be used for equipping their house with new household goods, in order to make it comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakery.

Cherry has been in this business for 25 years. Cherry earns more income from frozen foods.

Cherry has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Enhamgalan

texts.en: Enhamgalan is 25 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province of Mongolia. His daughter who is three years old goes to a kindergarten. He manages a taxi service business with the help of his older brother. He feeds his family with his business earnings therefore he must work very hard. He is a polite man who says, "My wife got a new job recently. So our family living conditions are getting better day by day." He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix tiene 37 años, es un hombre alegre y trabajador, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa Margarita de 35 años y sus 05 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Juan empezó desde muy joven a trabajar como ayudante en distintas tiendas comerciales, sus proyecciones era tener su propia tienda comercial, su deseo se hizo realidad desde que empezó a ahorrar sus salarios y desde hace 11 años viene trabajando de forma independiente. Hoy con una sonrisa despejada siente que ha cumplido uno de sus primeros objetivos, lo cual le está arrojando buenos resultados económicos, debido a la calidad y la variedad de productos que ofrece a su clientela. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, su  puesto de ventas esta situado en la zona céntrica  de la ciudad de Quimbiri. Gracias al préstamo solicitado llevará acabo uno de sus planes, ampliar su espacio de ventas e así ofrecer mayor variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Espera contar con el apoyo de toso ustedes para poder reordenar y ofrecer sus productos de manera organizada ya que con ello piensa mejorar y prestar un servicio adecuado a sus consumidores. Este es será su cuarto crédito y esta muy contento de poder trabajar con ustedes ya que gracias al apoyo financiero va progresando, esta vez espera beneficiarse con el crédito ya que es la única manera  de progresar con el apoyo de ustedes. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles ampliará el espacio de su kiosco ya que cuenta con espacio suficiente.
texts.en:
Félix is 37 years old.  He is a cheerful and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 35 year-old Margarita, and their five beloved children who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Juan started working as an assistant in different stores when he was very young.  His plans were to own his own store.  He achieved his wish as he started saving his salary and, for the past 11 years now, he has been working independently.  Today, with a clear smile, he feels that he has accomplished one of his first goals.  He is making good money owing to the quality and variety of products that he offers his customers.  He normally works on his own but he sometimes receives help from his children.

Félix's store is located in the central area of the city of Quimbiri.  Thanks to the loan he has requested, he will go ahead with one of his plans which is to expand his sales space so that he can offer a larger variety of basic household products.  He hopes to receive your support so that he can reorganize his store and sell his products in a more organized manner as he plans to improve his business and provide a suitable service to his customers.

This will be Félix's fourth loan and he is very happy to be able to work with you since, thanks to this financial support, he is making progress.  He hopes to profit from a loan as his only way of making progress is with your support.  He will use the 2,500 Peruvian soles to expand his store space as he does not have enough space right now.

loans.use: to expand his store

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther‘s group is comprised of two hard-working young women. Esther is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Esther has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which she has had for two years.  She has a poultry farm as her secondary business.  

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential goods like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Esther hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Esther hopes to own a boutique that sells clothes.  

Esther is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential goods like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Merdeces

texts.es: Mercedes, tiene 59 años esta casada y vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y dos nietas D. 12 y 17 años,  a quienes les da educación e intenta darles una mejor calidad D. vida.Mercedes tiene como trabajo el D. la venta D. carbón, plátano y bebidas gaseosas, además esta empezando con una actividad diferente y en sociedad con su hijos, ella envía combustible a una zona minera para que su hijo lo venda a los buscadores D. oro artesanal, lleva ya un año en este trabajo.Le gusta este trabajo por que en su casa pueD. vender algunas cosas mientras que por otro lado su hijo también le hace producir su dinero. Mercedes  se ha dado cuenta que es muy rentable pues es la tercera vez que envía y las dos veces anteriores le salio muy bien todo. Ella espera poder comprar muchos mas productos para seguir abasteciendo a su hijo y así puedan seguir creciendo.Este es el cuarto préstamo entre Mercedes y MFP, hasta ahora todo le va bien y espera poder seguir trabajando así ya que le gusta su grupo por que con todos se lleva bien.Con el dinero solicitado 2000 soles comprará carbón, plátano y más combustible para poder enviar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mercedes, age 59, is married.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her two granddaughters, ages 12 and 17.  She gives them an education, and she tries to give them a better quality of life.

Mercedes works selling charcoal, bananas, and carbonated drinks.  In addition to this she has started a different business activity with her children.  She is sending fuel to a mining zone, and her son sells it to people looking for artisanal gold.  She has been doing this work for one year.

She likes this work because she is able to sell some things at home while her son is also producing money.  Mercedes has realized that it is very profitable.  This is the third time she has sent fuel, and the two previous times everything turned out very well.  She hopes to be able to buy many more products to continue stocking her son.  This way they can continue growing.

This is the fourth loan between Mercedes and MFP.  So far everything is going well for her, and she hopes to be able to continue working this way.  She likes her group because everyone gets along well.

She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy charcoal, bananas, and more fuel to be able to send to her son.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, bananas, and more fuel for her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  lives in  Uganda. She is single and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her brother’s children).   

Sarah has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Sarah sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale.  

Sarah has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through rental houses. The main business challenge(s) for Sarah include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van.

Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Malik

texts.fr:
Monsieur Malik âgé de 37 ans marié et père de quatre  enfants, il habite avec sa famille à Sanoubougou I- Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) .
Il excelle dans l’activité de Prêt à Porter depuis 14 ans, et cela après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès. Vu l’augmentation de sa clientèle et que ses ressources propres ne pouvant satisfaire les attentes de cette clientèle, il  jugea utile de venir auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour lui solliciter un premier prêt individuel, qui fut correctement remboursé. Ainsi il demande ce deuxième prêt pour acheter, 15 chemises différentes, 17 pantalons de qualité différentes, 15 paires de chaussure différentes (Soulier, Ferardine, etc.), 5 complets de veste, 10 Tee-Shirt, 5 complets de sous-vêtement, etc.
   Il s’approvisionne à Bamako pour venir  revendre dans sa boutique sise en plein cœur de la gare routière de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des voyageurs et transporteurs.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce crédit un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 140 000 FCFA qui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce mais également d’honorer ses engagements à l’égard de Soro Yiriwaso et couvrir d’autres dépenses familles.
texts.en:
Mr Malik is 37 years old, married and a father of four. He lives with his family in Sanoubougou I - Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
He has been excelling in the ready-to-wear business for 14 years, this after unsuccessfully trying out several businesses. Given the increase in his clientele and the insufficiency of his personal resources to satisfy his customers' expectations, he assessed that joining micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso would be useful, and requested a first individual loan, which was repaid timely. Similarly, he is requesting this second loan to purchase 15 different shirts, 17 pairs of trousers of various qualities, 15 different pairs of shoes (brands such as Soulier, Ferardine, etc.), five suits, ten tee-shirts, five sets of underwear, etc.
He gets his supplies from Bamako to retail in his shop located at the heart of the bus station in Sikasso, with a clientele mostly comprising travelers and carriers.
With this loan, he is planning on an average monthly profit of 140,000 FCFA, which will allow him to increase his working capital, and also to honor his commitment to Soro Yiriwaso and pay for other family expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, she has operated a weaving business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale business in the future. 

With her KES 15,000 loan, Tabu wants to purchase weaving materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Tor

texts.en:
Mrs. Tor is a diligent and patient persO. in working. She has been engaged in a hog fattening business for six years and a rice cultivating business for ages. With the strenuous work, she successfully earns a livelihood. 

She would like to grow her business by expanding her farmland at the size of three hectare. By doing that, she will be able to plant more crops and get a high rate of productiO. from this land. With the loan amount of KHR 4,000,000 she wants to buy extra farmland. She hopes that with the help of this fund she will earn more net income and save it for the further expansiO. of her existing business. 

She wishes to lift her family from poverty. Nowadays she lives with her husband and four single children.

loans.use: to buy extra farmland.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is a married man with six children, four of whom are currently enrolled in school. Pascal has run his own utensils and kitchen supplies business for the past two years. His primary customers are neighbors, local residents and travelers. Pascal's other source of income includes a side job as a teacher. He describes his greatest business challenge to be poor turnover and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Pascal will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase additional utensils, containers and kitchenware. He joined Yehu because their loans are easily accessible.

loans.use: to purchase additional utensils, containers and kitchenware.

loans.name: Leonor Del Carmen

texts.es:
Leonor, se dedica a la venta de tortas mexicanas, tiene tres años en el negocio, vende todos los días en el centro de la ciudad, posee bastante clientela. Leonor vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de su esposo y dos hijos unos de 4 años y el otro de 2 años de edad.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales como pan especial, cebollas, tomates, aderezos, carnes, condimentos, gaseosas, estos materiales le sirven para mantenerse en el negocio, ofreciendo a los clientes los productos frescos.
Ella aspira tener un negocio amplio, con mayor capacidad, con una mejor calidad en la preparación, y con el apoyo de los préstamos para poder crecer.
texts.en:
Leonor sells Mexican tortas; she’s been in business three years.  She sells every day in the center of the city and has quite a large clientele.  Leonor lives in her parents’ house with her husband and two children who are 4 and 2 years of age.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies like special bread, onions, tomatoes, dressing, meats, condiments and soft drinks.  These supplies will help her stay in business offering fresh ingredients to her customers.

She aims at having a large business with more capacity with better production quality and support from the loans to be able to grow.

loans.use: to buy special bread, onions, tomatoes, dressing, meats, condiments and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 27 years old and married. She has one child and works very hard to provide for the family.

Ann runs a boutique shop in Kenya and requested a KES 40,000 loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust to buy more stock to improve her boutique business.

Ann has been in this business for the past two years and sells clothes in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

In the future, Ann would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to improve her boutique business.

loans.name: Ayidote Houegbo-Aliho Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AYIDOTE HOUEGBO-ALIHO est composé de seize membres. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Yvette est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. Yvette est âgée de 27 ans et vit au Bénin. Yvette est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Egoudjobi. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Yvette et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Yvette mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d'année la vente d'oignons et des épices dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Yvette vend des sésames. Yvette  s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et mieux satisfaire à la demande de leur clientèle, Yvette et les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE HOUEGBO-ALIHO sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Group Ayidote Houegbo-Aliho is composed of sixteen members. The group's representative, named Yvette, is raising her hand on the picture. In order to increase their activity level and better meet customer demand, this group is requesting ALIDé's financial support.
Yvette is 27 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a driver named Egoudjobi. The couple has three children in their care, a couple of which go to school. Yvette and her husband live together with their children.
To support herself and her children, Yvette has been in business for about ten years, selling onions and spices in her neighborhood. As a side activity, Yvette sells sesame seeds. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin.
In order to strengthen their activity and to better meet customer demand, Yvette and the other members of group Ayidote Houegbo-Aliho are requesting their first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy bags of onions.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un médecin. Elle a 1 enfant.
Afi travaille comme vendeuse depuis 2010. Elle vend du pure water en gros et des produits congelés pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Akodessewa et Hedzranawoe. Elle travaille seule. Au moment,elle n’a pas de difficultés.
Afi a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du pure water et des produits congelés. Elle veut agrandir son commerce.
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait augmenter la taille de l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Afi is a 29-year-old woman.  She is married to a physician and has one child.  Afi has been working as a salesperson since 2010.  She sells Pure Water wholesale.  She also sells and delivers frozen foods to all types of customers.  She buys her products in Akodessewa and Hedzranawoe. She works alone and does not currently encounter any difficulty.   Afi is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy Pure Water and frozen foods.  She would like to expand her business.  In the coming years, Afi would like to increase the size of her business.  She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy frozen foods and Pure Water.

loans.name: Marcia Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora. Marcia es socia del banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes, vive por el sector de la Mutualista Azuay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus cuatro ríos que la bañan, es desde diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
  
Doña Marcia tiene 40 años, es casada, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 17 y 13 años de edad quienes están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión Ingeniero Comercial, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

La Señora. Marcia es estilista hace 23 años, trabaja en su salón de belleza de lunes a sábados desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.
 
Se encuentra reingresando al banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tintes de cabello, cremas, gel, shampú y otros productos de belleza.

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Marcia is a member of the “Nuevos Horizontes” (New Horizons) communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca’s Mutualista Azuay sector.  This city is known for the four rivers that bathe it and it has been a Cultural Patrimony of Humanity since 1999.  Its residents maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Marcia is 40 years old and has two children who are 17 and 13 years of age and are attending a local school in the city.  Her husband is a Commercial Engineer by profession.  She does not own a house; she rents.

Marcia has been a hair stylist for 23 years.  She works in her beauty salon Monday through Saturday from 9 in the morning until 8 at night.

She is rejoining the communal bank and will use her new loan to buy hair coloring, creams, gel, shampoo and other beauty supplies.  Her dream is that her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Shakiia

texts.en:
Shakiia is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kalisiso in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past year, Shakiia has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Shakiia has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale, and will help Shakiia generate greater profits and pay fees for her sisters. Shakiia hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a retail shop. 

Shakiia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Shakiia's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save her money.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale

loans.name: Englay's Group

texts.en: A citizen located in the Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district, Englay is 34 years old. She is married and blessed with three kids; one in school while another twoare too young for schooling. For her household, rice farming and fish-catching business are her main ways to earn income in order to cover her daily expense. It is the business that she earned for 16 years and she earns 38,400 KHR per day. She never been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). Now, she leads a group of two for a loan. As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to plow the field and to buy rice seeds for her farmland. She highly hopes to upgrade her family situation in better pace.

loans.use: to plow the field and to buy rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Khomiya

texts.ru: Хомия серьезная женщина из района Рудаки. Хомия  замужем и имеет не очень большую и прекрасную семью. У нее 27, 24 и 15 летные сыновья, 35 и 24 летные дочери.  Ее муж строитель. Сыновья уже самостоятельные, умные  и они находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации.  Хомия дома занимается шитьем женской национальной одежды уже более 10 лет. Она старается помочь мужу обеспечить семью. Хомия планирует отремонтировать дом, и создать хорошие жилищные условия. Сейчас ей нужно определенная сумма денег, чтобы отремонтировать  свой дом. За счет кредита Хомия хочет приобрети стройматериалы для ремонта. Она верит, что Вы ей не откажите в кредит и Хомия заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Khomiya is a serious woman from the Rudaki region. Khomiya is married and has a modest and wonderful family. She has sons who are 27, 24 and 15 years old, and daughers who are 35 and 24. Her husband is a builder. Her sons are clever and already independent, and they live and work in Russia. 

Khomiya has been making national womens' clothes from home for more than ten years. She tries to help her husband with providing for the family. Khomiya is planning to renovate her house, and to establish good living conditions. 

Now she needs a sum of money in order to renovate her house. She intends to obtain building materials for the renovations with a portion of the borrowed money. She has faith that you would be so kind as to give her a loan, and Khomia expresses her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to renovate her house.

loans.name: Ikirezi Sub Group B

texts.en: Helena is a group leader; aged 45.She is married with 9 children aged between 14 and 22 years. The group is called IKIREZI means “Good people” in English. They sell different products,they wish to expand their businesses,make more profits and hence have a better for future. She has a shop and has been running this business for the past 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more chocolate,Pens,Glucose and Colgate for sale.With the profits from the business,she would like to pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: To buy more chocolate,Pens,Glucose and Colgate for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is a mother of four children and has been an active member of Life in Africa for the last four years. Five years ago she was faced with the problem of earning enough money to support herself and her children. As with many women in her situation, she turned to something she knew to try and earn money. She happened to know how to make good peanut butter and so she started her small business. Her main goal was to be self reliant and to serve her customers well while earning an income to support her children.

In the beginning she used the age old method of grinding the nuts using a mortar and pestle. This method worked but it was a very slow process and she found she was not able to make the peanut butter fast enough to earn adequate money. To remedy this, she carefully planned and saved to purchase a processing machine. This enabled her to process enough to meet the de-mands of her customers and her business grew.

But her good business sense tells her that she can do more. She now has the capability of pro-ducing large quantities but still must produce smaller batches because she has no way of storing it until it is sold. This will require the purchase of a refrigerator which will allow her to always have a supply on hand and will also enable her to increase her number of customers. To accomplish this she is seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000us. This amount will purchase a refrigerator, additional packing materials needed and the necessary capital to expand her production. Below is her budget:

800,000/= LOAN BUDGET
FRIDGE 400,000=
PACKING MATERIALS 200,000=
ADDITIONAL CAPITAL 200,000=
TOTAL 800,000=

Based on her current income, Grace will be able to repay the loan in 6 months. She has desig-nated 1/4 of the interest she pays on this loan to support educational opportunities for Life in Af-rica member children.

loans.use: Purchase of fridge, additional packing & raw materials

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita started her business selling seasonings, spices, and groceries one year ago, and the business has gone well. She needs a greater supply of products, for which she is requesting a loan of $800, which she will repay in 12 months.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Español Rita inicio su negocio de venta de sazonadores, especies para comida y abarrotes hace un año, el negocio a marchado bien, pero necesita mayor presencia de producto por lo cual solicita un préstamo de $800.00 el cual pagaría en 12 meses

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience E. is 47 years old and lives in the urban area of Benin City in Edo State, Nigeria. She opened her own business in 1999. She is happily married with five children. She needs a loan of USD400 for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Business Description: Mr. V. has a store in which he sells appliances. He began this business eight years ago with the help of his wife and a loan he took. Today he has a team of salesmen who travel to rural areas of the city.

Use of Loan: He needs credit to extend his business and reach places where his merchandise have not yet arrived. He wants to buy more merchandise and offer new products that his clients have asked for.

Personal Information: Mr. V. is 38 years old and has five children that study. He has a concrete home and family stability. He wants to expand his business to better his children’s education.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio: E Sr. V. tiene un local donde vende articulos electrodomesticos. Dichlo negocio lo empezao hace ocho años con la ayuda de su esposa y un prestamo que hizo. Actualmente tiene una red con venededores que viajan a las zonas rurales de la cuidad

Uso del Préstamo: E l necesita el credito para ampliar su negocio y tener mas cobertura en otros sitios donde aun no han llegado sus mercaderias quiere comprar mas mercaderias y ofrecer nuevos productos que han solicitado sus clientes

Información Personal: El tiene 38 años y cinco hijos que estudian tiene una casa de cemento y estabilidad familiar. El tiene el afan de hacer crecer el negocio para darle un mejor educacion a sus hijos

loans.use: Purchase more products and have more coverage

loans.name: Ángel Mario

texts.es:
Angel is originally from Cadereyta, Nuevo Leon. He has been raising and selling pigs since he was very young. This business was started by his grandfather and he inherited it. He receives help from his brother and father. Due to the quality of his service and products he now has several contracts with various nearby restaurants and his business has grown a lot.

To cover his clients demand he now needs a $1200 dollar loan which he will use to deliver meat and transport pig food. He offers to repay this loan within 6 months. Be an important part of this business development and help Angel. He sincerely thanks any kind of support that you can offer.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

Ángel es originario de la localidad de Cadereyta en el estado de Nuevo León, él se dedica desde muy pequeño a la cría y venta de cerdos, este negocio lo inició su abuelo y por herencia ahora Ángel es el encargado, donde recibe la ayuda de su hermano y de su padre. Gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que comercializa y a su buen servicio ahora tiene contratos con varios restaurantes de la localidad y su negocio ha crecido mucho.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes ahora necesita un préstamo de $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de un vehículo para transportar la carne y los alimentos de sus animales, él ofrece regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y decídete a ayudar a Ángel, él agradece sinceramente cualquier tipo de apoyo que puedas brindarle.

loans.use: purchase vehicle for produce transportation

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Doña Margarita is 47 years old, separated, with three children. She sells clothes, cosmetics and perfumes to the women in her community. She belongs to the group Niño de Atocha 2 and the other member of the group is doña Leydi Domínguez Gra, who sells shoes from catalogue. Both ladies will use the loan to buy more products to increase the sales for each of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

MARGARITA, se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos y perfumes a las mujeres de su comunidad, tiene 47 años, separada y tres hijos. Pertenece al grupo Niño de Atocha 2 y las otras integrantes del grupo son: Leydi Domínguez Gra. (Venta de zapatos por catálogos) Ambas esperan con sus préstamos invertir comprando mayor cantidad de productos del rubro de cada una para de esta forma aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Increase sale of clothing, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Matiliana

texts.en: Matiliana is a single lady of thirty years of age who is very talented in sewing different kinds of clothes. She has been in the loan program for three years and has always made her repayments very quickly and obeyed the rules of the program. She applied for this loan to buy an industrial sewing machine and other supplies such as threads, needles and fabrics. Matiliana sells her garments at the market every week but most of her clients come over to her place to get their clothes sewn. She said she plans to stay a long time in the loan program because it helps her business and to support her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en: Nizami H. is 49 years old, married, and has 4 children. He lives with his family in Khachmaz town. Nizami has his own cafe where he cooks kabobs. He buys the sheep from the villages and cooks kabobs in his cafe. He has 5 years of experience in this business. Now he needs a loan of  $900 to buy sheep for cooking kabobs and improving his business.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Kung

texts.en:
Mrs. Kung P. is 28 years old and is the mother of three children. She works as a market vendor selling fish and typically earns on average around $8 each day in revenue. Her husband works driving a Tuk-Tuk (motorcycle taxi) transporting tourists to visit the fascinating temples of the Angkor complex, making about $4 each day. Two of their children are currently enrolled in school and the third is too young to go to school.

Mrs. Kung P. has lately applied for a loan to enable her to purchase more dry fish to expand her inventory as well as meeting her growing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more dry fish to expand her inventory

loans.name: Mwanaheri's Mishemishe Group

texts.en:
Mwanaheri is a single 30 year old who owns a small market that she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 6am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

In the past, Mwanaheri has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses selling groceries and food.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Anna L.. She is 22 years old, single, and has one six-month-old child. In 2003, Anna established her poultry business. She works seven days a week, and more than 16 hours a day. Anna has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase additional chickens. In the future, Anna plans to diversify her business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara belongs to the Banco Comunal La Familia group, located in Jr Alfonso Ugarte 449, in the district of Calleria, in the county of Ucayali. She is 38 years olds and has 5 kids. Her husband works with wood. With the first loan of $300 that she received from Manuela Ramos, Sara decided to invest in the buying and selling of wood.

Now she has a small woodshop where she sells and chops wood, and with her husbands help and her effort and dedication, the business is going well.

With this loan of $1300, that she will pay back over a period of 4 months, she will buy different types of wood, like Peruvian cherry, 'bolaina' and mahogany.

Sara is very enthusiastic and dedicated to her business, which she looks after very carefully as her clients are the only way that she can make progress and give her family the best.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en el Jr Alfonso Ugarte 449, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo trabaja en madera. Sara con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de madera. En la actualidad cuenta con un mini aserradero donde se dedica a la venta y aserrado de madera, con la ayuda de su esposo esta sacando adelante el negocio con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,300 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará diferentes especies de madera, como quinilla, bolaina, caoba, etc. Sara tiene una energía y dedicación para su negocio, el cual atiende con mucho esmero por que sus clientes son la razón de ser para que ella pueda seguir progresando y darle lo mejor a su familia.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more wood to sell/Con el prestamo comprara mas madera para su venta

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Đào, 26 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006. Chị có một con trai 2 tuổi. Mức vốn ban đầu 200USD được chị đầu tư buôn bán thịt lợn. Hiệu quả đồng vốn mang lại đã khuyến khích chị Đào vay các vòng tiếp theo. Vòng vốn thứ 3 chị đã kinh doanh thêm thịt gà và vịt. Bên cạnh đó chị cũng xây dựng hệ thống bếp bioga để tận dụng phân thải từ chuồng lợn. Cho đến nay chị Đào đã có cơ sở kinh doanh với số vốn là 2000USD. Với mức thu nhập là 200USD/tháng dự định trong thời gian tới chị sẽ vay số tiền 875USD để mua thêm lợn, gà.
Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.
Ms. Dao Thi N., twenty-six years old, joined the fund in 2006.  She has only one son who is 2 years old.  She invested the first loan of 200 USD in a pork business.  The success that the loan brought encouraged Ms. N. to take more loans in subsequent funding rounds.  In the third round of funding she expanded her business into chicken and duck meat.  In addition, she also had a biogas stove system built to utilize the waste from the pig’s pen.  Until now Ms. N. has developed a business with a principal value of 2000 USD.  With a projected revenue of 200 USD/month in the near future, she will use the loan of $875 to buy more pigs and chicken.

loans.use: Buy pigs and chickens

loans.name: Theopista

texts.en:
Theodosia Bwire, age 40, is married with two children ages 22 and 15. She owns a shop of various items which she started six years ago. She works from 8am to midnight daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $423.

In the past, Theodosia has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand her shop. She hopes for a new loan to buy extra stock for her shop.

loans.use: To increase her general shop stock.

loans.name: Arfino

texts.pt:
Arfino C. is 35 years old and a native of Nampula, a province in the north of Mozambique. He is a single father of three children: the first is 6 years old, the second is 3 years old, and the youngest is 3 months old. In addition to his children he supports his sister, sending her money in Nampula, where she lives.

Arfino studied through 6th grade and then did not continue because of his family’s financial situation. In 1984 he enrolled in the military, which was disarmed in 2002. With his retirement money he decided to open up a small business selling diverse products, a business which he continues to grow today with the help of his girlfriend. Open 7am to 5pm, the store primarily carries vaseline that sells for 15, 20, 30, 40, 50, and 60 meticals. The main challenge that he cites is the 30-km trip on public transit to transport his goods from the city of Maputo, where he acquires them. He earns 2100 meticals per month and is not able to save anything.

In January of this year, he was contracted as a security guard at a company called CMC. He works from 7am to 7am the following day, in 48-hour shifts. He has a monthly salary of 2400 meticals.

For Arfino this is his seventh loan in life, his second with Hluvuku [Kiva’s Field Partner] and his first with Kiva. He used his first loan of 7,000 meticals to buy merchandise. He obtained his five previous loans at Banco Tchuma.

In the near future, Arfino intends to expand his business by selling new products such as sacks of corn and peanuts.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer.

Arfino C. tem 35 anos de idade, natural de Nampula, uma província que fica ao norte de Moçambique, solteiro e pai de 3 filhos com idade entre; primeiro 6 anos, segundo 3 anos e o mais novo com 3 meses de idade. Para alem dos filhos sustenta uma irmá enviando dinheiro para Nampula onde se encontra.

Arfino estudou até 6ªclasse e não continuou por condições financeira da família, em 1984 ingressou nos serviços militar qual veio a ser desmobilizado em 2002, e com o valor da reforma decide abrir um pequeno negocio de vende de produtos diversos, actividade que desenvolve até a data hoje com apoio da esposa com um horário das 7H as 17Horas . tem como produto em destaque a Vaselina que vende por (15mt; 20mt;30mt;40mt;50mt;60mt. Aponta como principal dificuldade o transporte uma vez que os produtos adquire na cidade de Maputo e desloca de transporte Publico a uma distancia de 30km. Tem um rendimento mensal de 2100,00mt e não consegue poupar nenhum.

Em Janeiro do presente ano foi contratado como segurança numa empresa denominada CMC. Com horário de 7... as 7horas do dia seguinte e um intervalo de 48horas. Tem um salário mensal de 2400,00mt Para Arfino este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no kiva, onde o primeiro foi de 7000,00mt qual usou para compra de produtos e Sétimo na vida onde os 5 obteve do Banco Tchuma.

No futuro tão breve Arfino pretende ampliar o seu negocio vendendo novos produtos tais como Milho e Amendoim em sacos.

loans.use: To increase stock for his shop

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
Minerva started her business for the desire to raise her family’s quality of life and to help to her husband with the house expenses; since her husband salary wasn’t stable, because sometimes he would have work and sometimes not. Also they needed to be prepared for an illness, and she wanted to support her children with their studies so that they can have better opportunities in life. She began her business in May 2000 when she started buying a small quantity of plastic products to see how they would sell. She did well and every time she was buying more products and reinvesting a part of her profits, this way, after several years she has been able to grow and increase her sales. She needs a loan of $800 that she will repay over a period of 6 months. She will buy more products and supply the orders of her clients who are placing bigger orders every time and she wants to have a larger variety to satisfy her clients’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

Minerva inició el negocio por el deseo de elevar la calidad de vida su familia y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, ya que el sueldo de su esposo no era una entrada segura, porque a veces le daban trabajo y a veces no, y también debían estar preparados para una enfermedad, además de que querian apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios para que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida. Comenzó su negocio en el mes de Mayo de 2000 invirtiendo poca cantidad de productos de plastico para ver como funcionaba y le empezó a ir bien y cada vez fue comprando mas productos y de sus ganancias reinvertía una parte, así, después de varios años ha podido crecer e incrementar sus ventas. Ella necesita un prestamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar más productos y surtir los pedidos de sus clientes que cada vez solicitan mas productos y quiere tener una extensa variedad para satisfacer sus necesidades.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ing

texts.en:
Mrs. Ing S., 36 years old, is a widow and lives with children and her younger sister and brother. She sells rice and various kinds of Khmer food at a stand near her town. Each day she makes around 10 dollars a day of gross income.

Mrs. Ing S. is currently facing financial difficulties and has recently requested a loan from KIVA to pay for her rent expenses and purchase more materials to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more utensils and other equipments to expand her business

loans.name: Prisca
