texts.en: Prisca A. sells groceries like sugar, rice, biscuits, soap and others at Kotokoraba, which is the heart of Cape Coast. Prisca has received Primary education. She is married and has 3 children. Prisca has been selling groceries since 1997. She is responsible for paying utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of groceries to meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business to increase sales, which will eventually increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a variety of groceries to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Justice

texts.en:
Justice I. O. is 34 years old. He is single, and he has one child who is currently in school. Justice is a dealer of bicycle parts in the community where he lives, which is a Ashiaman community. More specifically, he sells used bicycles, but he also provides bike-related repairs and service for his customers. He buys his supplies at wholesale prices from importers at the Tema harbor of Ghana, and he sells the goods to his customers at retail prices. He explains that selling bicycle-related items is a very lucrative business because most of the workers and school children in his area ride their bicycles to their place of work and/or school.

Now, he is seeking a loan to increase his inventory of bicycle parts in order to better provide for his customers. Further, he is hopeful that the loan proceeds will enable him to increase his savings so that he can expand his shop and support his child in school.

He is a member of the community group known as "Bamali Sha Allah" (without God, you can do nothing) Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. His picture was taken when he was at one of their group meetings.

loans.use: The meet his customers' demands by increasing his inventory of used bicycles and bicycle parts.

loans.name: Nazia M.usman Group

texts.en:
Nazia baji resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 22 years. Her husband, M., is a tailor by profession. She has two children: one son and one daughter. Both of her children are not of school age. Nazia baji sews clothes for a living and teaches the girls of her community how to sew clothes. She earns Pak Rupees 3,000 on a monthly basis. She shares her income with her husband because they both want to give their children a good education. Nazia baji is applying for a loan to buy a sewing machine for her husband so that he will be able to hire an employee and complete the large number of orders from his customers.

Nazia baji is a group leader of a few more members in her locality. Fozia daud baji is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics for her parlor. Suraiya baji is requesting a loan to buy washing powder for her laundry. Rubina baji is requesting a loan to buy material (cloth, colored thread and sketches) to make embroidered dresses for her boutique. Shahida parveen baji is requesting a loan to buy woods for her furniture making business. Shagufta baji is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Rukhsana baji is requesting a loan to buy shoes for her shoe selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for the entire repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and hire an employee to sew clothes

loans.name: Elieser Jose

texts.es:
El microempresario Elieser José J. F. tiene 34 años de edad, es casado con 2 hijos menores de edad, tiene un tramo en el mercado municipal de esta ciudad de Bluefields desde hace mas de 10 años, el cual trabaja en conjunto con su papa Byron F. y quien aparece en la foto del negocio.

En este negocio se ofertan principalmente maíz, maní, cebada, trigo, arroz y otros productos que no es común encontrar en otros negocios del mercado municipal, además que sus principales clientes son pobladores de las comunidades que viajan a esta ciudad a comprar estos productos. Sin embargo para poder cumplir con sus clientes necesita comprar estos productos en grandes cantidades las cuales las hace viajando a la capital y para lo cual requiere obtener un financiamiento para la obtención de los siguientes productos:


5 Quintales de arroz nacional el cual compra a US$ 42 cada quintal, 5 quintales de frijoles el cual compra a US$ 45 cada quintal, 5 quintales de maíz blanco el cual compra a US$ 14 cada quintal, 5 quintales de maíz amarillo el cual compra a US$ 18 cada quintal, 3 quintales de maní el cual compra a US$ 75 cada quintal, 3 quintales de cebada en grano el cual compra a US$ 45 cada quintal y 3 quintales de trigo el cual compra a US$ 15 cada quintal.
texts.en:
The micro-businessman Elieser José J. F. is 34 years old, married and has two small children. He has operated a stall in the municipal market of the city of Bluefields for more than 10 years. He works in the stall together with his father Byron F., who is pictured in the photo above. They sell mainly corn, peanuts, barley, wheat, rice and other products not commonly sold by the other market stalls. Additionally their main clients are people from other communities who travel to this city specifically to buy these products. Nevertheless in order to satisfy their clients they need to buy these products in large quantities, and they need to travel to the capital to do this. For this reason Elieser is seeking a loan to buy the following products: 5 quintales (a weight measure equivalent to 46kg) of domestic rice at US$42 per quintal; 5 quintales of beans at US$45 per quintal; 5 quintales of white corn at US$14 per quintal; 5 quintales of yellow corn at US$18 per quintal; 3 quintales of peanuts at US$75 per quintal; 3 quintales of barley grain at US$45 per quintal; and 3 quintales of wheat at US$15 per quintal.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food staples

loans.name: Temitope

texts.en: Temitope S. is 33-years-old and is married with three children. She is a hair dresser and she also sells beverages. She creates lovely hair styles for her many customers. Temitope is requesting a loan of $675 (N100,000) to purchase one deep freezer, additional beverages and hair extensions. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase one deep freezer, beverages and hair extensions

loans.name: Nguyen's Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị L. sinh năm 1979, ( mã số: 010117140035)  chị bán hàng quần áo, bán vải ở chợ có thu nhập theo ngày. Chồng chị làm thợ xây, hai con còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 300.000 vn đ/ tuần. Ngoài ra, vợ chồng chị vẫn chăn nuôi để tăng thu nhập. Chị tham gia vay vốn với mức vay: 4.142.000 vn đ để đi chợ và chăn nuôi lợn. Chị là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có:
 Đỗ D. Phấn sinh năm 1983 , ( mã số: 010117140036) Anh là công nhân có thu nhập ổn định theo tháng, vợ anh đi chợ có thu nhập theo ngày. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng: 300.000 vn đ/ tuần. Gia đình vay vốn để đầu tư đi chợ với mức vay: 3.270.000 vn đ.
  Nguyễn Thị Vân sinh năm 1961.  ( mã số: 010117140037) Gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi. Chị cũng đi chợ buôn bán nhỏ để tăng thu nhập, con trai chị cũng đi làm có thu nhập phụ giúp kinh tế cho gia đình. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 350.000 vn đ/tuần. Chị vay mức vốn: 3.270.000 vn đ để chăn nuôi.
 Đỗ Thị Liên sinh năm 1956, ( mã số: 010117140038). chồng chị đã mất, chị ở với vợ chồng người con trai. Chị vay mức vốn vay: 3.270.000 vn đ để đầu tư mở cửa hàng buôn bán nhỏ tại nhà.
  Hoàng Thị Hà sinh năm 1979, ( mã số: 01011714003), Vợ chồng chị có xưởng làm cửa nhom kính tại nhà. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 300.000  vn đ /tuần. Chị vay: 5.014.000 VND để đầu tư cửa hàng của gia đình.
texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị L. sinh năm 1979, ( mã số: 010117140035) chị bán hàng quần áo, bán vải ở chợ có thu nhập theo ngày. Chồng chị làm thợ xây, hai con còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 300.000 vn đ/ tuần. Ngoài ra, vợ chồng chị vẫn chăn nuôi để tăng thu nhập. Chị tham gia vay vốn với mức vay: 4.142.000 vn đ để đi chợ và chăn nuôi lợn. Chị là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có: Đỗ D. Phấn sinh năm 1983 , ( mã số: 010117140036) Anh là công nhân có thu nhập ổn định theo tháng, vợ anh đi chợ có thu nhập theo ngày. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng: 300.000 vn đ/ tuần. Gia đình vay vốn để đầu tư đi chợ với mức vay: 3.270.000 vn đ. Nguyễn Thị Vân sinh năm 1961. ( mã số: 010117140037) Gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi. Chị cũng đi chợ buôn bán nhỏ để tăng thu nhập, con trai chị cũng đi làm có thu nhập phụ giúp kinh tế cho gia đình. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 350.000 vn đ/tuần. Chị vay mức vốn: 3.270.000 vn đ để chăn nuôi. Đỗ Thị Liên sinh năm 1956, ( mã số: 010117140038). chồng chị đã mất, chị ở với vợ chồng người con trai. Chị vay mức vốn vay: 3.270.000 vn đ để đầu tư mở cửa hàng buôn bán nhỏ tại nhà. Hoàng Thị Hà sinh năm 1979, ( mã số: 01011714003), Vợ chồng chị có xưởng làm cửa nhom kính tại nhà. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 300.000 vn đ /tuần. Chị vay vốn để đầu tư cửa hàng của gia đình.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: đi chợ

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Greetings from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Emmanuel is currently requesting his first loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company, S.A. worth 500,000 Rwandan Francs.  He owns a business in which he rents out wiring and sound materials such as microphones, mixers, and speakers. His business is located in Muhima sector, Nyarugenge District, Kigali city.

He has owned this business for eight years and employs one person. He works every day from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. and earns a profit of approximately 180,000 Rwandan Francs each month (about $350). He will use the loan to buy more sound equipment to use in his business in order to satisfy his customers' needs. 

Emmanuel is 27 years old and married.

loans.use: To buy more sound equipment for his rental business

loans.name: Ifeayichukwu

texts.en: Ifeayichukwu is 26 years old and married. She sells provisions and drinks. She lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She is a LAPO client. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Gái Nguyễn, 51, lives in the town of Hiải Dương. She is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Gái owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing cargo transport services to local community members. Gái has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, Gái joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gái has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund, used to purchase breeding livestock. Gái is requesting a loan of 10000000 VND to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. The loan will be her sixth from TYM Fund. Gái plans to use the additional revenue from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Purchase transport vehicle.

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es:
Estefana es viuda, tiene 52 años de edad y 4 hijos, ya todos mayores de edad y casados.  Ella tiene una tienda llamada “Buenos aires” en la cual vende artículos de primera necesidad, también vende gas y agua por garrafones. Su negocio se encuentra en Villa Nueva, Guatemala.
Ella necesita un nuevo crédito para surtir su tienda,  y de esta forma obtener más ganancias.  Su sueño en manejar un capital propio u obtener mejores ganancias, ya que es única proveedora de ingresos en su familia.
texts.en:
Estefan is a widow, 52 years old, and has 4 children who are all married adults. She has a shop named "Buenos Aires" where she sells basic need items, such as gas and water by the jug. Her business is located in Villa Nueva, Guatemala. She needs a loan in order to grow her business and earn more profits. Her dream is to manage her own money and earn higher profits, especially since she is the main provider for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her store that sells basic need items

loans.name: Magda Yanett

texts.es:
La señora Magda Yanett N. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “C. de Motupe II”, vive en el Malecón Sur S/N Lote 2 – Asentamiento Humano Señor de los Milagros. Es conviviente, tiene 28 años y es madre de 02 niños, que dependen todavía de ella.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró golosinas y gaseosas porque se dedicaba a la venta de ceviches (plato típico) en el Jr. San Cristóbal y los repartía a sus clientes de la parada informal (mercado).  Luego decidió cambiar de rubro y dedicarse a la venta de bolsas plásticas que también los reparte a sus clientes.
Hoy se siente muy apoyada por el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y su Banco Comunal por haberle apoyado en los momentos más difíciles que atravesaba a raíz del accidente de su esposo en una construcción, por lo que no pudo aportar económicamente a su hogar, al contrario le implicaban gastos, sin embargo pese a su esfuerzo, coraje y empeño logró salir adelante cancelando el total de su crédito.
Con el crédito de S/ 800.00 soles comprará mas bolsas plásticas, en diferentes tamaños.
Hoy se siente feliz, segura e independiente porque ya su esposo se ha recuperado y ambos nuevamente se encuentran trabajando para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Magda Yanett N. C. belongs to the “C. de Motupe II” community bank. She lives on a street called Malecón Sur (Plot 2) in the "Asentamiento Humano Señor de los Milagros" zone. She is 28-years old, has a live-in partner, and is the mother of two dependent children. She used to sell ceviche (a regional specialty) in Jr. San Cristóbal. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought candy and soda to hand out to her customers at the "Parada Informal" (informal stop), a market. Later, she decided to change her line of work and sell plastic bags. Magda feels supported by Movimiento Manuela Ramos and her community bank, who supported her during very difficult moments that she went through when her husband had a construction accident and not only could no longer support his family financially but also created more expenses, Despite everything, her strength, courage, determination helped her make it and she repaid her entire loan. With this loan of 800 PEN she will buy more plastic bags in different sizes. Today, she feels happy, confident and independent because her husband has recovered and both are again working for the well being of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plastic bags.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: N. Rukia is a nurse by profession; she has a clinic with a pharmacy. She is 34 years old with two young kids. She is requesting a loan to put more medicine and health equipment in the pharmacy as well in her clinic in order to meet her patients’ needs. She is a hard-working lady whose future plan is to build a residential house on her plot of land.

loans.use: To put more medicine and health equipment in her pharmacy

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas.
Edith es soltera, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Edith tiene una tienda en la ciudad de Pichari, en un local alquilado en donde vende repuestos para carros, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana, además Edith vende sus repuestos a pedido.
Edith necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos.
Los sueños de Edith son tener una casa con todos las comodidades, ampliar su negocio y proveer a instituciones.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of the communal bank “Las Entusiastas.” She is single, 30 years old, and has a son. Edith rents a store space in Pichari, where she sells spare parts for cars with her sister’s help. Edith sells her wares by order. She needs a loan of 1,250 soles to buy spare parts. Edith would like to have a house with all the accompanying comforts, to grow her business, and to supply institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de repuestos.

loans.name: Roun

texts.en:
Roun K. currently cultivates a rice crop as well as raises poultry from her home, while her husband works in construction. Roun K. requested a loan to support her farming work during the coming growing season after the heavy rains fall. She will buy fertilizer and rice seed and hire labor to plow the farmland. 
The two persons shown in the photo are Mrs. Roun K. and her husband. They have two school-age children and live in Pursat Province.

loans.use: To support her farming work

loans.name: Tauva's Group

texts.en:
Tauva A. (0) is a 57-year-old woman living in the town of Samalaeulu, Leauvaa. She is widowed and has one adult child.

Tauva owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 500 WST a month.

In 2007, Tauva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Tauva is now requesting a new loan of 3,000 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her 5th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Verónica Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Verónica Isabel Z. tiene ya más de doce años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes, este negocio es la fuente de ingreso ya que es viuda y vive sola.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía que sus clientes le están solicitando que venda, pero ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder invertir en surtir. 
Es por eso solicita un préstamo y así poder comprar la mercancía que le están pidiendo, y tener más ingresos, con el cual pagara el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sra. Verónica Isabel Z. has more than twelve years experience selling groceries. She is a widow who lives by herself, so this business is her only means of support.

At the moment, she is lacking the variety of merchandise that her customers are requesting. She does not have the necessary capital to invest in additional inventory. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can purchase the requested goods and earn more income. The repayments for this loan will come from the revenue she expects to generate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de charbon de bois

loans.name: Judylin

texts.en:
Judylin B. is from the village of Puli, Carmen, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 31 years old. Judylin is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Judylin owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of candies and other foods in the local community. Judylin has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Judylin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judylin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Judylin is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Judylin from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: 02-Ái Sơn 2 Group

texts.pt:
"Phương N. Thị (28) is a 46 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Phương is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02-Ái Sơn 2 (16-03-02).


Phương is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, Phương operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for sale.  Phương has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Phương has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  The loan will be the 20th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Phương plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Lê Thị Hương (38) is a 26 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


2.  N. Thị Gai (37) is a 60 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.


3.  Ngô Thị Xuân (23) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Phương N. Thị (28) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Phương là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02-Ái Sơn 2 (16-03-02).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ trồng & thu hoạch gạo để bán.  Phương thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Phương kiếm được khoảng 2000000 VND.  Vào 2004, Phương đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Phương đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua hạt giống bổ sung, cây giống & cây con để trồng.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 20th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê Thị Hương (38) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2.  N. Thị Gai (37) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.


3.  Ngô Thị Xuân (23) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Sakhorn's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sakhorn C. is a group leader of five members who all live in Phlov Trei village in Kandal province. She is a housewife and her husband, Mr. Sok Moeun, is a fisherman. This couple has a child who is a fish seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sakhorn C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish to support her daughter’s business and she would use the rest of loan to buy more fishnets for fishing.

loans.use: To buy fish and fishnets.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana A. is 36 years old. She and her husband Ariel, 37, reside in the village of Santiago, Reina Mercedes, Isabela, along with their two children, Kenny Jay and Karen. Kenny Jay is a junior high school student while Karen is a Grade 1 pupil. As a mother, Susana really wants to give her children a better future by financing their education; thus she and her husband are working hand in hand.

Wanting to make her hog-raising business more progressive, Susana is asking KIVA lenders for a  PHP 5,000 loan, which will help her to buy feed for her animals. Her business serves as her main source of income, and she very much wants to make it more productive so that she can meet her family’s basic needs, as well as the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia S. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban Camiguin Province. She is 55 years old. Julia is widowed and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Julia owns & operates a business in the food sector making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Julia has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Julia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Julia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Maemoun

texts.en: Maemoun is a young Palestinian man living in a village near Tulkarem City in the northern West Bank. Maemoun works in a sewing workshop and has a monthly income of $500. Maemoun is 33 years old. He is currently engaged to a young woman, and he plans to get married as soon as his house is furnished. Maemoun requested $2,000 from FATEN to furnish his house. Maemoun appears in the picture at the FATEN office.

loans.use: To purchase home appliances

location.town: Biet Leed, Tulkarem City, West Bank

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian D. is married and has four children. She has received a junior-high education. Vivian sells onions at the sea shore; she has been doing this since 1980. Her husband is a fisherman. Vivian uses her income to help pay school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase bags of onions for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vivian plans to save to build up her business.

loans.use: Vivian will use the loan to purchase bags of onions for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more merchandise and diversify number of products

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en: Nerisa M., 45 years-old, owns a sari-sari (general) store and is also raising chickens. She sells various goods in order to have a regular income for her family. She has five children. She said that she desires for a good life for her children and this is why she is doing the very best she can to be able to achieve her objectives. She is seeking a loan of Php 6,000 from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures Inc. in order to buy chicks and additional merchandise for her sari-sari store.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise and chicks.

loans.name: Islom

texts.en:
Islom U. is a married man with two children. His children have been the reason that he tries so hard to provide them with a stable family life and an education for their future. For the past 10 years, Islom has sold foodstuff at the market. This is a profitable business in his neighborhood, and his sales have increased considerably year after year. His start-up capital was from the severance pay he received from where he used to work. To expand his business, Islom is requesting a loan of 6000 Somoni, which he intends to use to increase the range of his goods for sale. The loan will greatly improve Islom’s income and his family's living standards.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
When she started her business in 2000, Pamela L.’s goal was to make her business grow to support her family. Pamela, 33 years old, tills a small rice field which is 1-hectare (2.5-acres) in size. She has one child who is seven years old.

Pamela wants to have an abundant harvest but lacks capital to buy all the farm supplies. She would like to request a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. The loan will really help her to go on in her farming business and to have a sustainable income for her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Staila's Group

texts.en:
Staila is 40 years old and married with five children: four sons and one daughter. Her elder son is an electrician and also sells electrical supplies in the community. The others are free and don’t do anything.
 
Staila has a very friendly nature. She makes photo frames on order and generates a good income. She utilizes her income to pay for the utilities. Her husband is a janitor in a Government school. Their earnings help them to manage the financial needs of their family.

Staila has successfully repaid two loans to Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a third loan to purchase electrical supplies (wires, tube lights and bulbs) to expand her son's business. 

They all live in a city named Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods.

loans.use: Purchase electrical supplies for her son to sell

loans.name: Dorothe

texts.en:
Dorothe is 29 years old, married with 3 children aged between 2 and 6. Dorothe sells only Irish potatoes because that is profitable in her region. This is her 2nd year of success in her business operation. The hours of her business are from 8 in the morning to 3 in the evening every day except on Sunday.

Dorothe is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business through purchasing more Irish potatoes and other foodstuffs which can help her to attract more customers and satisfy them.  With this loan Dorothe hopes to earn more profits which will allow her to save money and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: The purchase of Irish potatoes and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Sandra de edad de 48 años, es madre de familia de un hijo, estudiante, desde hace varios años trabaja como docente de primaria y secundaria para generar mejores ingresos. 

Su esposo trabaja como ebanista y junto han logrado hacer la casa.aunque falta repellarla y algunos cambio estan contento por tener un techo propio. Desde joven estudio magisterio y luego aplico, lo único es que su salario  es bajo, es por eso cubre el turno de secundaria para poder ganar un poco mas y cubrir los gastos que tiene. Las mejoras que desea hacer en su casa es la compra de puertas principales ya que están muy viejas e inseguras, no ha logrado hacer el cambio por que son de alto costo, también desea poner cerámica al cuarto que logro hacer con el crédito anterior, para una mejor higiene.
Gracias a los financiamientos de la institución ha logrado el objetivo de mejorar su casa para un mejor bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Doña Sandra is 48 years old, she is the mother of one boy who is a student. For many years she has worked as an elementary and middle school teacher to generate higher income. Her husband is a cabinetmaker and together they have built a home, though it needs repairs and a few changes they are content to have their own roof. Since she was young Sandra studied teaching and later applied her studies, the only issue is that her salary is low. This is why she made the change to teach middle school, to be able to earn a little more and to cover the costs that she had. The improvement that she would like to make in her house is to purchase front doors. The doors that she has are already old and insecure. She hasn't made the change because the costs are high. Also, she wants to put ceramic floor tiles in a room for better hygiene, that she had managed to do with a previous loan. Thanks to the financing that has supported the objective to improve her house for the well being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy doors for her house and ceramic floor tiles to put in a room that has dirt floors and she wants to support better hygiene.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina E. is from the village of Mandih, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 41 years old, married and has 3 Adult and 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cristina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the other source of income for the business comes primarily from the income of her husband as a farmer. Cristina has been engaged in her business for 18 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.In 2009, Cristina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Cristina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.  

       About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

       *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy products to sell.

loans.name: Amegnon Kossi

texts.en:
Amegnon S. is 29 years old and has a business selling second-hand clothing. He has been working at this business since 2008. He is 29 years old and married to a woman who sells cloth and fabric. They have two children. 

Amegnon’s income helps him provide for his young family. He has requested a loan of 400,000 Communauté Financière Africaine Francs (CFA) to allow him to purchase more clothing to sell in his business, which is located in Lomé’s Grand Marché.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing for resale

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 1 est composé de femmes mariées du village de DANGASSO dans la préfecture de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 39  ans et au moins 7enfants.
Elles cultivent  du  fonio, de l’oseille et du gombo.  
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt de campagne.
FATOUMATA C. compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de fonio, des petits matériels agricoles et des intrants, au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN, DAH et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
FATOUMATA C., compte réaliser, après l’écoulement des produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les  dépenses  courantes  de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women from the village of Dangasso in the San district, a region of Segou (the fourth administrative area of Mali). They live in traditional families. They are of an average age of 39 and have a minimum of 7 children each.They grow fonio, sorrel, and gombo. In the interest of improving the performance of their farms, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan group 2 years ago. Having repaid the previous loans correctly they are requesting their second rural loan. Fatoumata C. intends to use her credit to buy a sufficient quantity of fonio seeds, small farming machinery, and farming supplies, such as seeds, fertiliser, and other products, at the market in San. After the winter period the harvest will be stored for a certain period of time to appreciate in value before being sold at the markets of San, Dah and the surrounding area, retail (often wholesale) for cash to customers who usually come from the large towns. Fatoumata C. hopes to make a profit of 35 000 FCFA after the sale of the products, which will be used for the repayment of the interests of the loan and for daily family expenses.

Translated from French by Barbara Belli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds,fertiliser and other products and small tools.

loans.name: Jackline Kemuma

texts.en:
Jackline Kemuma K. is 32 years old and a single mother of two children. After losing her job she started selling and supplying eggs in Kisumu, where she also stays, to support her family. She travels to Nairobi on a weekly basis to purchase her stock. 

Jackline wants to expand her business since it’s the family’s only source of income and to do this, she would like to get a loan worth Ksh.10,000 which will be used to increase her stock. Her dream is to expand her business and gain more income to help her educate her children.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fast food sales:  hotdogs, tacos, sandwiches, hamgurgers

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea A. is a married woman who lives in Ruiz Street, Brgy. Libacao, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a furniture-making business. Her husband Peter, who is 54 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have nine children who are aged between eight and 30. 

Andrea joined NWTF - Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF - Project Dungganon, Andrea has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 15th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she intends to use to pay for more stock of raw materials for making furniture so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Andrea is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To increase her stock of raw materials for making furniture

loans.name: Norm

texts.en:
Norm N., 38, is married and resides with his wife and six children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. (Note: N.'s wife appears in the photograph because N. is not available.)

N. is a security guard for a private company with an income of $5.00 U.S. dollars per day. His wife grows vegetables at home, earning an income of $1.50 U.S. dollars per day.  

N. is requesting a loan of $1,100 U.S. dollars to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson Kisingu is a 40 year old gentleman. He is married to a lady called Margaret. Together they have three children who are 16, 11 and five years old, respectively. Jackson operates a motorcycle repairs shop in an area that has very many boda bodas (motorbike transport services). This ensures that his business is very busy and he is able to make good profits for every month. He also gets additional income from his wife’s salary as she is employed as a high school teacher.

Jackson just joined KADET LTD and he has applied for his first loan, which he plans to use to buy more spare parts for the motorcycle repairs business. He expects that his income will be boosted and he plans to use this to improve the living standards for his family.

Jackson hopes to buy three more motorcycles and a public service van to offer transport services to many people in the future.

loans.use: Towards buying motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Cleotilde Del Socorro

texts.es: Cleotilde tiene su actividad que es ofrecer el servicio de costura. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio. Esta no es la primera experiencia que ha obtenido con créditos por lo que han sido muy satisfactorios. Ella es una persona muy tranquila y dinámica pues siempre está buscando la forma de mantener a su familia ella ofrece muy buena calidad de sus productos y a sus clientes eso les gusta. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como tijeras, telas, agujas entre otras. Por lo que sueña con establecer su negocio aun más.
texts.en:
Cleotilde earns her living as a seamstress. She's had her business for more than 12 years.

This is not her first experience with loans and she has been very satisfied with them. She is a very calm yet active person who is always seeking ways to better the life of her family.

Cleotilde makes very good quality products which her customers really like. This loan will be used to buy basic supplies like scissors, fabric, needles etc. Her dream is to make her business even better.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Emelita's Group

texts.en:
Emelita B. is from the village of San Luis, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Emelita is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Emelita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Emelita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Emelita has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Emelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Emelita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Emelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean has been dedicating herself to expanding her business in order to support her dreams to improve her family's quality of life. She would like to increase her weekly income and therefore has applied for a new loan of 9,500 PHP to purchase more stocks of charcoal and increase her working capital. She will be very responsible with her obligations and she is thankful to the people who will support the loan she is requesting, which will be very helpful to make her business grow further so that her four children fulfill their dreams of completing college degrees and finding stable jobs.

Jean has already had previous loans from ASHI and repaid them successfully; therefore, she is being trusted with a much larger loan. As an active entrepreneur, Jean would also like to explore more businesses to provide her family with a good living and to invest in land to build a comfortable home to live in. She is very pleased to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for helping fund her business dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of charcoal and increase her working capital

loans.name: Kimeu

texts.en:
Kimeu M. is a 44-year-old farmer. He is married and has one child. He practices mixed farming in Machakos, Kenya. He employs six people in his busy farm and sells his produce locally. 

Kimeu is a member of Twone Mbee SHG (a self-help group) and they have guaranteed him a loan of 80000 KES. With this loan, Kimeu wants to buy a dairy cow to increase his herd. He hopes to own a dairy plant in the future. He describes himself as focused and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: So

texts.en: So O. is a 55 year old widowed villager who lives in Phnom Penh. Her husband died of senility years ago and she have no children. So O. currently works as public officer in the Ministry of Public Works. Besides this work, she opened laundry business in her house with several staff to provide her services. So O. typically makes around $6 of profit each day to use for daily expenses. So O. is running her business smoothly because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. She now faces a problem. Her house requires repairs. Because she does not have sufficient savings, So O. would like a loan to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso, es conviviente, tiene 47 años y 6 hijos de 15, 14, 13, 9, 8 y 1 año de edad. Antonia se dedica a la siembra de papa, trigo, maíz y también a la venta de cereales.
Antonia vive en Chiara, se dedica a la siembra, desde muy niña aprendió de este oficio de sus padres, ahora realiza éste trabajo con su pareja e hijos.
Antonia viaja a las ferias para ayudarse, compra variedad de cereales y los vende el Mercado Mayorista Nery Gracia Zarate. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cereales.
Le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque puede acceder a los créditos y puede ahorrar.
Su sueño es poder ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Antonio is a member of the community bank named "Glorioso". She lives with her partner, she is 47 years old and she has 6 children aged, 15, 14, 13, 9, 8, and a 1 year-old. Antonia harvests potatoes, wheat, corn, and she also resells cereal grains. 

Antonio lives in Chiara and she is an agriculturist. Since she was a young girl she learned the trade from her parents and today this is the business she carries out alongside her partner and children. 

Antonia travels to the fairs to stock up on cereal grains for resale in the wholesale market of Nery Garcia Zarate. The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of cereal grains. 

She enjoys the meetings at her community bank because she has access to loans and she is able to save money. 

Her dream is to save enough money for her kids' education.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: Samira

texts.ru: Алимхонова Самира проживает в районе Рудаки. Ей 36 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж работает таксистом. Сама Самира тоже работает таксистом. В этой области имеет богатый опыт. Он перевозит людей с одного места на другое. До этого она работала по профессии. У нее высшее образование, экономист. Проработала по профессии 5 лет. Сейчас она нуждается в кредите. Целью кредита является покупка автозапчасти. На полученную прибыль Самира хочет купить бытовую технику и отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: A. Samira lives in the Rudaki region. She's thirty-six years old, married and has four children. Both she and her husband work as experienced      taxi drivers. Samira has a degree in economics and worked as an economist for five years prior to becoming a cab driver. She's asking for a loan in order to purchase some spare parts. She plans to acquire some household appliances and fix up her house with the profit.

loans.use: To buy spare automobile parts

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Jalia has a business selling charcoal, which she has run for four years.
To help expand her business, Jalia has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Jalia hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop. Jalia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Paula Argentina

texts.es: Paula Argentina tiene 24 años. La actividad económica es la venta de carnes. Hace más de 8 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante ya que es la única manera de vender al por mayor lo que ofrece. Por lo que sus inicios surgen con muy poco capital,  y con fondos propios pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba, hasta que se le presento la oportunidad de trabajar con Fundación León 2000. El financiamiento que solicita es para comprar carne de res, cerdo, pollo, pelibuey entre otras. Su mayor sueño es seguir con vida para mantener esta actividad.
texts.en:
Paula Argentina, 24, sells meat.  She’s been in this business for over 8 years now.  She sells in an ambulatory manner since this is the only way to sell what she offers at wholesale.

She started out at the beginning with very little capital using her own funds but with a strong desire to get ahead.  Gradually she increased her inventory with the few profits the business generated until she got the opportunity to work with Fundación León 2000.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy beef, pork, chicken and lamb.  Her greatest wish is to continue living to stay in business.

loans.use: To buy meats.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz, de 28 años, vive en la casa de su madre al lado de ella y de su hermana; y juntas buscan progresar cada día. 

Desde hace tres años, esta emprendedora joven instaló en un local alquilado un centro de alquiler de teléfonos para realizar llamadas a cualquier destino, y le va muy bien pues por su zona no tiene mucha competencia. Ella trabaja en su local, además también en el mismo lugar vende útiles escolares, lo que le permite obtener mejores ganancias, esta muy satisfecha aunque deba pasar varias horas en el negocio  pues sabe que solo así obtendrá generosas ganancias que le están permitiendo crecer en el negocio. Además esta muy tranquila, pues solo debe atender a sus clientes que la visitan por ratos en busca de una llamada, y para el futuro ya tiene planeado ampliar el negocio, además de instalar un pequeño salón de belleza para continuar con los dos negocios.  

Luz tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de útiles escolares para surtir mejor su negocio pues esta cerca la campaña escolar y quiere continuar adelante. 

Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Luz, 28, lives in her mother’s house with her mother and sister; together they seek to progress every day.

Three years ago this enterprising young woman set up a telephone call center in a rented locale to make phone calls anywhere.  She does quite well because there isn’t much competition in her zone.  She works in the locale but she also stocks school supplies in the same place to sell; this allows for better profits.  She is very satisfied even though she must spend several hours in the business because she knows that this is the only way she’ll earn generous profits that permit growth in the business.  Besides, she is quite tranquil because she only has to tend to customers for short periods of time when they come in to make a call.  For the future she plans to expand the business as well as setting up a small beauty salon and continue with both businesses.

Luz plans to use the loan to buy school supplies to better stock the business because the new school term is near and she wants to continue forging ahead.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to pay her installments punctually because she does not want to disappoint the people who made the money possible that will allow her to say in business seeking progress.

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. is from the village of San Antonio, Cabisera 18, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2011, Jocelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jocelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La Sra. Yolanda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 41 años y con estudios secundarios completos. Es madre de 03 hijos, de los cuales, sólo uno depende de ella.

Su espíritu luchador que siempre le  ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de productos de belleza de la línea Unique, Avon y Oriflame, negocio en el que  poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y moradores de la comunidad, hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien. 

Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 Nuevos Soles implementó su negocio comprando productos para su stock cómo: Perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños, cremas de manos y cuerpo, lápices labiales y mucho más. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles comprará: Productos para su stock, cómo, colonias para bebes, talco de cuerpo y pies.

Yolanda se siente una mujer feliz, por el trabajo que a diario realiza  y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla y asesorarla en su camino como empresaria.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the "Santa Bárbara” community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martín province.  She is 41 years old, married, and completed her high school studies.  She has three children, only one of whom is still dependent on her.

Yolanda has always been characterized by her fighting spirit.  She also has a desire to get ahead in life using her own resources.  This led her to set up her own business selling beauty products from Unique, Avon and Oriflame.  She has gradually become very well known amongst her customers and other people living in her community.  She tells us that her business is now doing very well.

Yolanda used her first loan for 300 Peruvian soles to set up her business, buying products to have in stock such as ladies', men's and children's perfumes, hand cream, body cream, lipsticks and many others.  She will use this loan for 1,000 soles to buy products to have in stock such as baby perfume and body and foot talc.

Yolanda is very happy with the work that she does every day and she is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her and advising her as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy baby perfumes and body and foot talc

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael, a 39-year-old married father of two children in school, has been selling clothes for the past 10 years to earn a living.  He has two employees. Michael also sells music discs and tapes to earn extra income and hopes to expand his business to become financially stable in the future.  With the loan of 50,000 kes, he will buy a loudspeaker, amplifier and generator.

loans.use: to buy a loudspeaker, amplifier and a generator.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Haydee; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de empanadas, ella prepara las empanadas de carne y pollo y luego lo vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de empanadas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, pollo, carne y manteca para preparar las empanadas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Haydee, age 25, lives with her partner and has one son. She is a member of the communal bank QORILAZO; the bank is located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province which is located in the department of Cusco.

Haydee divides her time between her daily activities and her empanada business (empanada is a South American stuffed bread/pastry). She prepares meat and chicken empanadas and then sells them around the neigborhood from 8am to 1pm. This business provides the income Maria needs to raise her children. 

Maria would like to expand her empanada business and she is seeking a loan to purchase ingredients such as flour, chicken, meat, and butter that are necessary for the preparation of empanadas. She is very happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients (such as flour, chicken, meat, and butter) necessary for the preparation of empanadas

loans.name: Alvidio

texts.es:
Aldivio tiene 43 años de edad.  El es casado y tiene  tres  hijos. Vive en casa propia y que está ubicada en en el distrito de Tambogrande en Piura. Alvidio  vive a  solo 30 Kms del centro del distrito en la zona rural y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Alvidio se desenvuelve en la actividad agrícola.  Él desarrolla esta labor hace más de 10 años, entre sus principales productos tenemos el mango y el limón; el terreno es de su madre pero él la ayuda con su administración y cuidados del mismo.

 Alvidio solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  por la suma de S/. 3000.00,  para la compra de insumos y demás fertilizantes para su cultivo, logrando de esta manera una mejor producción, también lo necesita para poda del cultivo de mango.  Gracias a este crédito el podrá distribuirlos y venderlos en su localidad como en diferentes distritos  de al ciudad de Piura.

Alvidio tiene el deseo de darle  tanto a su a su madre como a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, objetivo por el que lucha día a día y al que pretende llegar gracias al crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Alvidio is 43 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in his own home located in the District of Tambogrande in Piura, which is only 30 kilometers from the central part of this rural district. Alvidio does not receive basic services.

He earns his living as a farmer and has been in this line of work for more than ten years. Among the main crops he produces are mangos and lemons. Even though the land is owned by his mother, Alvidio helps to manage and take care of it.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3000 PEN in order to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops. This will enable him to achieve better production. He also needs to prune his mango trees. Thanks to this loan, Alvidio will be able to distribute and sell in his community as well as in different districts within the city of Piura.

Alvidio wants very much to provide his mother and his family a better quality of life. For this reason, he strives day after day to achieve growth in his business.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Daté Godwin

texts.fr: Marié à une tontinière, Daté est père d’un enfant. Il  a 26 ans s’approvisionne depuis 03 ans, de friperie  dans un marché de la place et revend de manière ambulante. Ce crédit va lui permettre d acheter en quantité  la friperie  et de louer dans la mesure du possible un local pour faciliter la revente sur son lieu d’approvisionnent.
texts.en: Married to a local tontine fund member, Daté is the father of one child. He is 26 years old and, for the past 3 years, has been buying clothing at a local market and re-selling these items door-to-door. This loan will allow him to buy second-hand clothing in bulk and, as far as possible, to rent a place to facilitate the resale of clothing near where he gets his supplies.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Kankeletigui 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KANKELETIGUI 2  est une Association  de femmes mariées du village de Dembela dans le cercle de NIENA région de SIKASSO troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Le groupe est composé de 10 femmes.  Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-soeurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et au moins 4 enfants.
Elles exercent la culture d’arachide de riz et de mil.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, de riz, payer les frais de labours,  acheter  des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Dembela et de Nina ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de NIENA et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
FANTA compte acheter ; 1 sac d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30.000 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Kankeletigui 2 group is an association of married women from the village of Dembela in the Niena area, Sikasso Region (the third administrative region of Mali). The group is composed of 10 women. They live in traditional extended families, together with their children, husbands, in-laws etc. They average 33 years of age, with at least four children.

They grow peanuts (ground nuts), rice and millet. In the desire to make their agricultural work profitable, the group members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. The present loan will be use to purchase a sufficient quantities of peanut and rice seeds, pay the cost of manual labor, buy small tools and agricultural inputs at the ig market of Dembela and of the city of Niena. After the winter harvest, the produce is stocked away for a while until its value increases, and it is then sold at the big market of Niena and at the nearby markets , retail (often wholesale) for cash to customers usually coming from big cities.

Fanta plans to buy one bag of urea and two bags of complex fertilizers as well as to pay the cost of manual labor and weeding. [S]he   envisages achieving a monthly income between 30,000 and 40,000 West African Francs, which will be used to repay the loan interest and cover  everyday family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural inputs and manual labor

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 39 years old and resides with her husband and four children at Siem Reap province, known as a tourist town. She is a housewife and her husband is a driver who has been taking people from Phnom Penh to Siem Reap since 2005. He earns US $15 per day. Three of their children are students. 

Each month, she has to spend US $75 on food, US $10 utilities and US $30 for other expenses. 

Srey has asked for a loan of US $700 to purchase vegetables to sell. She has a truck that can transport the vegetables to the customer as she won't sell retail but by stock. 

In the future, she hopes she will have ability to buy a shop for selling vegetables to make more profit.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 50 years old and married to Henry. They are blessed with four children, 16, 13, 10 and 8 years old.

She has been operating her food business for the last two years. She earns a monthly income of about KES 6,000 which she uses to purchase stock and take care of her family.

She has been loaned KES 20,000 by KADET Ltd. This is her first loan from KADET. She intends to use the loan to purchase milk, bread and other items for sale.

She plans to use the anticipated profit to establish a food kiosk. In the future, she hopes to establish herself in the business.

loans.use: to purchase milk, bread and other items for sale.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica tiene 30 años, es una mujer carismática y laboriosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Edwin de 28 años y su primogénita Ariana de 02 años de edad, a quien desea brindarle toda su atención y velar por su salud. Desde muy joven a Jessica le nació el gusto por las prendas de vestir, es por ello, que con el tiempo decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropas, actualmente realizando una ardua labor semanal ofreciendo ropa a domicilio, ya que según manifiesta que así obtiene un poco más de ganancia por sus prendas, las cuales ella misma se encarga de comprar y trasladar desde la ciudad de Lima. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dialogar con sus clientes sobre las prendas que están de moda en las mejores ciudades, ella menciona que al hacer eso se esta apoderando de la confianza de sus compradores. Lleva 04 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar los pesados fardos de ropa a distintos caseríos, pero aún así no se da por vencida, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende el bienestar de su familia. Con el  apoyo de ustedes podrá viajar a la ciudad de lima para poder comprar cantidad y variedad de prendas de vestir. Para el bien de su estabilidad económica espera situar posteriormente su negocio en las galerías de la ciudad de San Francisco, en la cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de ustedes para seguir creciendo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy jovial y pone la chispa para salir del aburrimiento. Los 3,000 nuevos soles le serán de gran utilidad, ya que desea comprar prendas de vestir para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jessica, 30 years old, is a charismatic and hard-working woman, who lives in her own house alongside her husband Edwin, who is 28 years old, and her first-born, Ariana, who is 2 years old. Jessica would like to offer Ariana her total attention and to guard her health.

From an early age, Jessica developed an interest in articles of women's clothing.  That's why, over time, she decided to dedicate herself to selling clothes. At present, Jessica works hard every week, offering clothing in homes, since in this manner, she earns a little extra from her items of clothing. She buys and transports inventory from far-away Lima.

What she likes best about her work is conversing with her customers about what is in style in the larger cities. She mentioned that in this way she is enhancing her buyer's confidence. Jessica has been doing this for 4 years. The most difficult part, she says, is transporting the heavy boxes of clothing to distinct residential areas. But she doesn't give up, knowing that the well-being of her family depends on her doing this.

With your help, she will be able to travel to the city of Lima to buy a quantity and variety of clothing items.  To enhance her economic stability, she hopes in the future to establish her business in the galleries of the city of San Francisco, where she could offer better service.

This is Jessica's 4th loan through MFP.  She is very content knowing that she can count on your help to continue growing. In her communal bank Jessica is a very jovial member who lights a spark that overcomes boredom.

The 3,000 new sols will be of great utility, since she wants to buy clothing items to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy more items of clothing to sell door-to-door.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for bowls and pans for resale.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis de 45 años de edad, vive con su hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana D. distrito de Ferreñafe que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turística.

Luis se dedica desde hace varios años como carpintero, fabricando y restaurando muebles, negocio que ha colocado en su mismo domicilio, tiene su clientela que por el buen trabajo que realiza ha ido en aumento, lo que le permitirá que con los ingresos que adquiera podrá cubrir todas sus  necesidades diarias de su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de madera para cumplir con los trabajos pendientes que tiene y con el dinero que gane podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar su nivel de vida.  Luis con su trabajo quiere brindarle a su hijo otras opciones de estudio.
texts.en:
Luis is 45 years old and lives with his son in his own home. He receives all basic services. Luis resides in an urban area in the District of Ferreñafe, which is part of Chiclayo Province. This area is known for its businesses involving agriculture, livestock breeding, and tourism.

Luis has worked as a carpenter for several years, making and restoring furniture. He operates his business out of his home. His customer base has increased as a result of the good work he produces. This has allowed him to generate income to cover all of his daily household necessities.

Luis is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN so that he can buy wood in order to complete his outstanding orders. With the money he earns, he will be able to repay the loan and improve his standard of living. Through his work, Luis wants to provide his son with educational options.

loans.use: to buy wood for completing his furniture orders.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Candelaria works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Candelaria is borrowing 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase a fishing net for her fishing/fish vending business.
