Candelaria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Elvusal

texts.ru: Elvusal 21 qod. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Elvusal yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Shushi, seychas projivayet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey mamoy. Elvusal uje 2 qoda kak rabotayet taxistom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyey mashini chtobi pochinit yeyo tak kak on ne mojet rabotat poka yego taxi  ne pochinitsya.
texts.en: Elvusal is 21 years old.  He is single and does not have children.  Elvusal is an IDP (Internally Displace Person), who moved from Shushi and now lives in the Baku region with his mother.  He has been working as a taxi driver for two years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to buy auto parts for his car in order to repair it because he cannot continue working until his car is fixed.

loans.use: to buy auto parts

loans.name: Volonte De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe VOLONTE DE DIEU est formé de trois personnes qui habitent la même localité. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Josita Olga, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Josita Olga est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Barthelemy. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble. Josita Olga et son mari subviennent ensemble aux différents besoins du ménage. Josita Olga n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a près de trois ans que Josita Olga mène comme activité la vente de charbon de bois à son domicile. Josita Olga s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Josita Olga désire obtenir un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe VOLONTE DE DIEU.
texts.en:
The group VOLONTE DE DIEU is comprised of three persons who live in the same district. The group's representative is Josita Olga, who is the one with her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time this group has requested financial support from ALIDé with the goal of boosting their business. 

Josita Olga is 41 years old and married to a driver by the name of Barthelemy. They have five children, all in school. Three of the children are their own. The family lives together. Josita Olga and her husband jointly cover the various household expenses. 

Josita Olga did not attend school. For three years, she has been running a business selling charcoal out of her home. Her supplies come from a city in Benin. With the goal of increasing her stock of products and responding better to the demands of their customers, she and the other members of the group VOLONTE DE DIEU would like to obtain a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia, de 32 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Alexander de 34 años y lo que más desea es aprovechar las oportunidades que tiene para mantener a su familia. Desde joven empezó a ganarse la vida trabajando en distintos oficios, pero cuando se casó, sería su pareja quien la ayudase a obtener un negocios estables. Es así que se dedica a vender ropa en un local, situado en el mercado central de su ciudad. En dicho lugar atiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía, quienes la visitan continuamente, debido a los novedosos modelos de ropa que trae de ña ciudad de Lima. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre las prendas que mejor le quedan. Tiene 07 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el día. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda más grande, donde pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este será su décimo crédito con MFP y se siente muy contenta de saber que obtendrá un apoyo mas de ustedes, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa, de preferencia ropa de verano, ya que el lugar donde viven es muy caluroso.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 32, is a cheerful, hardworking woman who lives in her own house with her partner Alexander, 34.  What she wants most is to exploit the opportunities she has to support her family. From a young age, Cecilia began to make a living working in various trades, but when she married, her partner was the one who would help her obtain a stable business. 

Thus, Cecilia is selling clothes in a place located in the central market of their city. She serves her customers with kindness and courtesy, who continually visit her because of the innovative models of clothes that she brings from the city of Lima. What Cecilia likes most about her job is advising her clients on the best-fit garments. She has been doing this activity for 7 years and believes that the hardest part is having to stand all day. Over time, she wants to install a larger store, where she can provide better service to her customers. 

This will be Cecilia's tenth loan with MFP and she feels very happy to know that she will get more support from you.   Thus she will feel secure to buy the requested items and is willing to return your contributions in a timely manner. With the requested two thousand nuevos soles, Cecilia will buy more clothes, preferably summer clothes, as the place where they live is very hot.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: 03.12.96 Thiệu Dương  Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Sáng operates a food stall selling fruit and is requesting a loan to purchase fruit for resale. She is 48 and married with three children. Sáng is the group leader of the 96 Thiệu D. solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Sáng lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province and has one dependent. In 2010, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Since joining, she has successfully repaid six loans.

Sáng has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship she faces is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Sáng hopes for her children to find a good job, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Rahimakhon

texts.ru: Рахимахон вдова. На воспитании имеет четверых детей. Воспитывать в одиночку очень трудно. Для содержания семьи после смерти мужа она стала заниматься торговлей детской одежды. Научилась как управлять бизнесом и получать хорошую прибыль. Она хочет получить займ для расширения и увеличения ассортимента зимней одежды. Она надеется получить займ и увеличить оборот своего капитала.
texts.en: Rahimakhon is a widow.  She has four children to raise.  Raising children as a single mother is very difficult.  To support the family after her husband's death she started selling children's clothing.  She learned how to run a business and earn a good profit.  She would like to get a loan in order to expand and increase her range of winter clothing.  She hopes to get a loan and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing for sale

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Uranchimeg, 46, works as a technician in the maintenance department of Mongolian National Broadcasting Television. She has been doing her job for 25 years and is an elder officer. She lives with her family in the suburban district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

She married and moved to a new apartment with her family, and they are still using their initial furniture. The furniture has became very old and damaged. Therefore, she decided to buy new furniture for her home. She needs over MNT 2.000.000 to buy the furniture. The loan she is taking will be used to purchase some new furniture to renovate her home.

loans.use: to purchase some new furniture to renovate her home

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a mother of five children, two of whom are minors and still in school. She is herself is 50 and has 25 years in active farming. She currently produces carrots, potatoes, and cabbages. 

Margaret has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank to mitigate the great losses in farming due to inadequate rainfall. She is optimistic the water supply will earn her enough income to educate her last two children. 

She sees recurrent crop failure occasioned by inadequate rainfall as her major challenge.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa de 36 años de edad convive con Roberto de 39 años, que fruto de este amor tienen 3 hijos. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Sivia. Justa es una noble y bondadosa mujer, que emprendió un nuevo negocio,
que es el tener un tienda de abarrotes, pues antes se dedicaba a las labores agrícolas, ahora es su esposo quien se encarga del campo. Ella siempre fue consecuente en su trabajo, nunca espero que le iba resultar tan rentable, pero su perseverancia ha hecho que continue con su labor. Además el ofrecer productos a precios cómodo, y la buena atención han hecho que mantenga a su clientela. Ahora confía que mas adelante tendrá su tienda mucho más ordenada y con variedad de productos al gusto del cliente. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en realizar el pago de sus cuotas con puntualidad. Con los 2,200 nuevos soles, comprará más productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Justa is 36 years old and lives with Roberto, 39. The couple has three children. They live in their own house located in the Sivia district. Justa is an honest and kind woman, who has undertaken a new business: running a grocery store. Before this, she worked in agriculture, but now her husband works in the fields. 

She has always been consistent in her work. Though she never thought that it would turn out to be very profitable, her perseverance made her continue. Not only does she offer products at affordable prices, but she also provides good customer service which has made her keep her clientele. She now trusts that eventually she will have her store much more organized and with a variety of products that her customers will appreciate. This will be her second loan with MFP, and she commits to making the payments punctually. With the 2,200 nuevos soles, she will purchase more products to stock her store.

loans.use: to purchase more products to stock her store.

loans.name: Tojimurod

texts.ru: Тоджимурод умный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. Он занимается откормом скота и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он содержит скот за счет кормов произведенных от выращивания сельхозпродуктов. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 1500 Сомони для покупки 4 голов овец. На полученную прибыль хочет купить стройматериалы для постройки сарая. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: Tojimurod is a smart and hardworking man. He is married and a responsible father of four children. Tojimurod raises livestock and farms. He feeds his animals with the crops that he grows on his own land. Tojimurod would like to take out a loan of 1500 somoni to purchase four more sheep. He is planning to use the profits from this loan to purchase building materials for a barn. Tojimurod hopes for your help and is grateful to everyone in advance.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Jose Porfirio

texts.es:
Jose Porfirio tiene 47 años de edad, es productor de cafe en pequeña escala, es casado, tiene seis hijos, y junto a su familia reside en el municipio de Patuca en el departamento de Olancho. 

Jose se dedica desde hace 15 años a este negocio y lo aprendió de familia. Todos los dias desde muy temprano por las mañanas él se ocupa de las actividades de la finca y en varias temporadas contrata a personal para que lo ayude. No tiene un horario especifico para laborar porque eso depende de las actividades que deba realizar.    

El prestamo que Jose esta solicitando lo necesita para el pago de mano de obra y para transportar al mercado local su produccion. Con el apoyo de este prestamo obtendrá algunas ganancias y asi podrá seguir llevando el sustento a su familia. 

Su meta es llegar a ser un gran productor y tener su propio medio de transporte para vender su produccion. Este es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Jose Porfirio is 47 years old.  He is a small scale coffee producer.  He is married, has 6 children, and lives with his family in the municipality of Patuca in Olancho state. 

Jose has worked in this trade for 15 years and learned it from his family.  Every morning he gets up very early to take care of activities in the field, and during different seasons he contracts people to help him.  He does not have a fixed work schedule because the work he does depends on what needs to be done.

Jose is requesting this loan to pay for labor and transportation to take his crop to market.  This loan will help him earn money to continue supporting his family.  

His goal is to become a large producer and to have his own vehicle to be able to sell his crops.  This is his first loan cycle with FAMA and he expects to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for labor and transportation.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona nació en el departamento de Puno pèro actualmente radica en el poblado de Rumichaca baja. Este pueblo se localiza en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco, Perú. 

Petrona tiene 53 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene ocho hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida típica en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad de Urubamba, ella tiene 28 años preparando diferentes platos típicos como por ejemplo pollo frito, trucha frita, tallarín con pollo, rocoto relleno, caldo de cabeza, adobo, chuleta frita, papa a la huancaína, habas hucho, chiriuchu y otras más, ella empieza su trabajo desde muy temprano pero sale a vender a partir de las 8 de la mañana y hasta la una de la tarde o hasta que se acabe el ultimo plato de comida, ella también tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio.  Ya son varios años que se dedica  a los negocios y le va muy bien. Petrona en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para poder abastecer su tienda de abarrotes y también para comprar insumos para preparar más platos de comida. 

Petrona es integrante del grupo “Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja” lo conforman 19 socios que viven en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Petrona was born in Puno department, but currently she resides in the settlement of Rumichaca Baja. This village is located in the district of Urubamba, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department, Peru. Petrona is 53, married, and has eight children.

She sells traditional food in one of the most popular markets in the city of Urubamba. She has been preparing various traditional dishes for 28 years, such as fried chicken, fried trout, chicken with noodles, stuffed peppers, sheep's head soup, adobo (spicy pork), fried chops, huancaína potatoes, huacho lima beans, chiriuchu (a dish made from corn tortilla, chicken, toasted corn, pork sausage, cheese and baked guinea pig), and others. 

She starts work very early, and goes out to sell from eight in the morning to one in the afternoon or until the last plate of food is finished. She also has a small grocery store in her home. She has been working in her businesses for several years now, and it's going very well.   

On this occasion, Petrona needs the loan to buy more merchandise for stocking her grocery store, and also to buy ingredients for making her food dishes. 

Petrona is a member of the "Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja" communal bank, made up of 19 members who live in the settlement of Rumichaca Baja, where they carry on their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 40 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Marissa has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as spices, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

In the future Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana está solicitando su crédito para pagar la finalización de sus estudios de su carrera de Psicología, actualmente trabaja como animadora de una radio estación. Su sueño es coronar su carrera universitaria que con esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado llegar hasta el término de sus materias previas al curso de titulación. Quiere ser Psicóloga porque podrá ayudar a las demás personas a mejorar su conducta y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is requesting a loan to pay for finishing her psychology degree. Currently she works as a presenter at a radio station. Her dream is to finish her university degree with the effort and dedication she had to finish her previous degree courses. She wants to be a psychologist because she can help other people to improve their behavior and quality of life.

loans.use: pay for her university degree.

loans.name: Pashke

texts.en: Pashke's son was scheduled for an immediate surgery and she did not have money saved for it; so, she asked relatives and acquaintances for money to pay for the surgery. Now, she's got to pay that money back and this is the reason why she needs your financial help. Her family's main source on income comes from the sales of fodder and little retirement pension of her father-in-law who lives with them.

loans.use: to pay an old debt that occurred from the surgery of her son

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
This business is a member of Queen Esther Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Lucy W. is a client of WEEC and a member of Queen Esther Women Group. She is a widow who has been self independent for some years. She lives in Ole Roimen where her business is located. She is a mother and a grandmother to several off springs.

Lucy is a successful business woman with rental houses which bring for her a substantial amount of income. Apart from this she is a farmer who rears goat and also cultivates food crops.

With various loans that have been advanced to her by the group and WEEC, she has been able to build more rooms for rental. These rooms do not have electricity and this reduces the amount of money that is charged.

loans.use: Lucy intends to install electricity in her rental houses. She views this as one of the ways to increase her income, as tenants will be paying much more than before.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: RELOCATE TO BIGGER PREMISES AND ADD STOCK

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is 41. Diep’s husband is 42. They have 5 children aged 15, 13, 13, 7, and 1. The eldest daughter stopped going to school to work as a labourer in Ho Chi Minh City. The three middle children are students.

Diep and her husband have to work hard growing sugarcane, and raising pigs and fish to support their children. Their income is only $6 per person/month. Because they must support their children, they don’t have enough capital to invest in growing the sugarcane trees. They need a loan of $75 from the Kiva programme to invest in their sugarcane field. They are going to repay monthly.

loans.use: To invest in growing sugar-cane.

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema B. of 28 Wife of Mr. Khonkon Miah of 36, is a member of Titas Mohila Somity since 2002 in Gazipur area. She has a girl of 7 years old. Her husband is the only earning member in her family and his income is very small to run the family. She decides to be an earning member for the family and receives training on livestock organized jointly by AF and Government Livestock Department. 

She takes a loan from AF and purchases 2 cows for rearing at home. She herself takes general care of cows and provides medical treatment when needed. She gets 5 liters of milk daily and sells them @ US $ 0.44 per liter. So, her daily income is US$ 2.2. She intends to buy another cow of high breed at a cost of US $ 600.

loans.use: To purchase cow.

loans.name: Jailia

texts.es: La Sra. A. es propietaria de un establecimiento donde vende electrodomésticos, goza de muy buen aceptación por parte de sus clientes ya que tiene variedad de marcas y de muy buena calidad (Sony, Samsung, LG, etc.). En la actualidad quiere el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de electrodomésticos y para pagar a sus proveedores que le están ofreciendo descuentos por pronto pago, lo cual le permitirá un mayor margen de ganancia y podrá mejorar el nivel de vida de sus familiares.

loans.use: El crédito lo ivertirá en la compra de electrodomésticos.

loans.name: María Rayda

texts.es:
Maria and her husband Jesus have been craftmen ever since they were very young. Now, they have become parents of two sons and they have seen their art become a major source of income. Despite great limitations - they do not have an appropriate shop to work from - this family has not lessen their efforts and dedication. Naturally, they would like to have a better home where their children's rearing could be improved in short term. This challenge has lead to the possibility to obtain better machinery and bigger quantities of yarn that would be used to increase production output. These goods, then, would be sold in Lima and also fulfill export demand. They are aware that their dedication and hard work will eventually pay off and they will be able to purchase their home and also a place where they can work comfortably. To begin seeking their dream, they need US$500.00, that will be used to purchase additional material and tools. Let's enable this family to continue to handcraft their art and fulfill their children's dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Maria y su esposo Jesús se han dedicado a la labor artesana desde muy pequeños y ahora que son pareja y padres de 2 niños han visto en este arte una gran fuente de ingresos económicos para su hogar. Pese a tener grandes limitaciones porque no cuentan con un taller ni una casa propia no ha disminuido la fuerza y entereza de esta familia , sin duda tienen la esperanza de poder adquirir una morada que favorezca el crecimiento de sus hijos en corto tiempo. Frente a este panorama ven la posibilidad de comprar más maquinarias y lanas que les ayudarán a agilizar su producción y comercialización semanalmente en la ciudad de Lima, además de incrementar sus pedidos de exportación. Así mismo saben que el esfuerzo que le dedican a su labor con el tiempo hará que puedan tener una casa propia y un lugar donde puedan laborar tranquilamente y para empezar a trabajar por su sueño de un futuro mejor requieren la suma de 500 dólares para adquirir materia prima y herramientas de trabajo. Hagamos que esta familia siga fabricando y anidando los sueños de sus hijos en su labor diaria.

loans.use: Purchase material and tools for a small artisan shop.

loans.name: Vaoesea

texts.en: Vaoesea T. is 34 years old, married with two kids. She applied for this loan in order to buy the ingredients needed to make her ice cakes (popsicles in a bag). She sells them at the village during the entire week, mostly at the local school where sales are the quickest. She can earn 84 Tala ($34 USD) per day. She hopes to use her next loan to buy a bigger freezer for her business in order to sell more.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her ice cakes business

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.es:
Alejandra is 42 years old and has 5 children. Victoria is 39 years old with 4 children, and Elena is 38 and has 2 children. They are all members of the communal bank "Llamkasun", a word which means "Let's work" in their local language of Quechua.

Alejandra has been selling vegetables from a stall at the Nery Garcia Market for 15 years. In addition to the vegetables, she also grows grain, potatoes and other crops on the small bit of land she has in HuamanguilL.. Victoria sells clothing, grocery items and fruits, as well as cereals, cheese and small animals. And Elena sells clothing in the local fairs, and buys cereal, potatoes and small animals at the fair to later sell in the market.

They are requesting a loan to invest in their respective businesses, to buy potatoes, carrots and other vegetables, fish, clothing, etc, and they are all very grateful to the communal bank because they have learned a lot about running their businesses. They are now saving to increase their business capital and make repairs on their homes.

Alejandra tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, Victoria tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, mientras que Elena tiene 38 años y 2 hijos. Alejandra, Victoria y Elena pertenecen al Banco Comunal “Llamkasun” palabra quechua que significa “trabajemos”, hace 1, 6, 6 años respectivamente. Alejandra venD. verduras en un puesto del Mercado Nery Garcia hace 15 años, además D. L. venta D. verduras elL. también siembra trigo, papa, entre otros productos, en sus chacras D. HuamanguilL.. Por otro lado Victoria es feriante y venD. ropa, abarrotes, frutas y D. las ferias trae cereales, leña, queso, animales menores, para luego venderlo en las tiendas y repartiendo en casas. Asimismo Elena venD. ropa en las ferias y también realiza trueque, actividad ancestral que consiste en hacer un cambio D. productos diferentes, y D. las ferias trae cereales, papa, arveja, animales, para luego venderlo en el mercado. Ellas necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 1200 soles y 1000 soles, que serán invertidos en L. compra D. papa, arveja, oca, haba, zanahoria, apio, cebolL., pescado, pollo, frutas, camotes, panamito, pantalones, mandiles, chompas y animales. Alejandra, Victoria y Elena están muy agradecidas con su Banco Comunal porque aprendieron L. responsabilidad y L. puntualidad, además pudieron ahorrar y con sus ahorros compraron su carro, e implementaron más sus negocios. Ahora están ahorrando para L. construcción D. su casa, para aumentar el capital D. su negocio y las diferentes necesidades D. su hogar. Sus sueños son educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, tener un negocio más granD., tener una casa D. material noble, mejorar su casa y que sean felices en su hogar.

loans.use: ALEJANDRA, VICTORIA AND ELENA WILL USE THE LOAN TO INVEST IN THEIR RESPECTIVE BUSINESSES SELLING FRUIT, GROCERY ITEMS AND CLOTHING.

loans.name: Kossi Jacques

texts.fr:
Born in 1979 in Havé Doumé in the Zio prefecture, Mister D. Kossi Jacques is married and has four (04) children. He provides the necessities for his family thanks to the country work projects and to his taxi bike. Working for a third person who does nothing but exploit him, he has decided to obtain his own bike that would allow for him to have financial stability for the family needs. His spouse is a student hairdresser who brings in too little money to contribute effectively to the family expenses. He requests a loan of $1000 to buy his own bike and work for himself. This project will allow for him to increase his income in order to improve the living conditions of the family.

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1979 à Havé Doumé dans la préfecture du Zio, Monsieur D. Kossi Jacques est marié et a en charges quatre (04) enfants. Il subvient aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux travaux champêtres et au taxi moto. Travaillant pour une tierce personne qui ne fait que l’exploiter, il décide d’acquérir sa propre moto qui lui permettra d’avoir une stabilité financière pour les besoins de la famille. Son épouse coiffeuse de formation tire très peu de profit pour contribuer effectivement aux charges familiales.

Il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter sa propre moto et travailler en son propre compte. Ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour une amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To buy a taxi bike

loans.name: Elizabeth's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 22 years old, started selling clothes a year ago. Everyday, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $45 from her sales.

In the past, Elizabeth has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses in vegetables and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Cira Cecilia

texts.es:
Cira, 61, finished high school. She has four children but only one still lives with her. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. In the room in her house that was converted to a shop 17 years ago, she sells everyday items such as colas, cookies, toiletries, clearning products, etc. When she began, she had very few products but, over time, she's increased the range of products she sells.

Cira belongs to the Santa Lucia community lending group from which she received her first loan of S/.300. With the first loan, she bought a variety of products such as cooking oil, eggs, pasta, toilet paper, etc. With this loan of S/.200, to be repaid in four months, she will buy a dozen boxes of detergent, 10 cases of colas, soap and snacks. Her greatest wish is to improve her small shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Cira Cecilia Sánchez Vda. D. Asmat tiene 61 años D. edad, estudio secundaria completa. Tiene cuatro hijos pero solo uno aun depenD. D. ella. Vive en el distrito D. Moche provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. En la bodega que acondicionó en su domicilio hace aproximadamente 17 años venD. productos D. primera necesidad, gaseosas, golosinas , mercería y productos D. limpieza. Cuando empezó tenia muy pocos productos, con el tiempo ha ido incrementando y teniendo mayor variedad.

Ella pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Santa Lucia” lugar donD. obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este monto compró una variedad D. productos como aceite, huevos, fideos, papel higiénico y fideos. Con el préstamo D. S/. 200.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprara una docena D. detergente, 10 cajas D. gaseosas, jabón y golosinas. Su mayor sueño es implementar mas su bodega.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Roger Mauricio

texts.es:
Roger Mauricio is requesting a loan to invest in renovations to his home located in the 5th zone of Nueva Guinea, he needs to remodel his home to have a little comfort, he is a employee of APROSAPAN, he is the father of a 10 year old boy who is a 6th grade student. Roger is a young professional who earned his degree in forest management. In administration he does his job with a lot of responsibility and honesty he is an example for all young Nicaraguans that love their country, nowadays he has obtained a scholarship to study. Roger is a young man who is characterized as a fighter and enterprising, a part from being a salaried person he was from scarce economic resources as a young boy and he has always been an independent man with a good spirit.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Roger Mauricio está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en mejoras de su vivienda ubicada en la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea, necesita remodelar el dormitorio que él habita y así tener un poco de comodidad, es trabajador de APROSAPAN como responsable de proyecto, es padre de un niño de 10 años estudia 6to grado de educación primaria. Roger es un joven profesional que se recibió en las carrera de Ing. Agroforestal y Lic. En informática Administrativa desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad y honestidad es un ejemplo para todos los jóvenes Nicaragüense que amamos nuestro país, actualmente consiguió una beca para estudiar Lic. En Derecho. Roger es un joven que se caracteriza por ser luchador y emprendedor a pesar de ser una persona asalariada y de escasos recursos económicos desde muy joven ha sido un hombre independiente de su mamá pero posee un alto espíritu de superación personal.

loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase meat to produce fried food for a small business.

loans.name: Savrinisso

texts.ru:
Savrnisso K. lives in the Gissar region. She is divorced and has one child. She lives with her parents. Her parents are retired and Savrnisso is the only breadwinner in the family. She has a souvenir store where she sells flowers and souvenirs. She has been in this business for ten years. Her business runs pretty well but she would like to have more money for its expansion. Therefore she decided to request a loan which she plans to repay in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Курбонова Саврниссо жительница Гиссарского района. Разведена и имеет одного ребенка. Живут с ее родителями. Они пенсионеры, поэтому она является единственным кормильцем семьи. Имеет подарочный магазин, где продает цветы и разные сувениры. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Прибыль неплохая, но для развития бизнеса нужны деньги. Поэтому она решила получить кредит со сроком в 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to increase sales

loans.name: Hointossoudé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Hointossoudé A. was born in 1957 in Tokpli-glimé. Married and the mother of five children, she lives with her entire family in the village of Logodomé. Extremely conscientious, she specializes in rearing and selling goats. The problems she faces are financial, since she does not have enough money to build an enclosure for the goats or buy more goats, which means her income is very low. She is requesting a loan to buy some goats and build an enclosure. Achieving this goal will enable her to increase her income.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Hointossoudé est née en 1957 à Tokpli-glimé. Mariée et mère de cinq enfants, elle vit avec toute sa famille dans le village de Logodomé. Très dévouée, elle est spécialisée dans l’élevage et la vente de chèvres. Les difficultés qu’elle rencontre sont d’ordre financier, car elle manque d’argent pour construire un enclos pour les chèvres et pour en acheter d’autres ; ce qui rend son rendement très faible. Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter des chèvres et construire un enclos. La réalisation de ce projet va lui permettre d’améliorer son revenu.

loans.use: To buy some goats

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David started the business because he has always like sales and besides that, he realized that they were products that were in demand and, for that reason, were easy to sell. They provide good earnings and excellent bonuses. He started in February of 2001 thanks to a neighbor who invited him to sell naturalist products and he began by offering them to aquaintences and neighbors and later in fairs. Those same clients would recommend him to other people and in that way he developed a large client base and increased his earnings.

David needs a loan for US$500, which he plans to repay in five months, to buy products that will allow him to fill his clients’ orders and thereby increase his earnings and commissions.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

David inició el negocio porqué siempre le han gustado las ventas, además de que se dio cuenta que eran productos que tienen mucha demanda y por lo tanto son fáciles de vender, y proporcionan buenas ganancias y excelentes premios. Comenzóen Febrero de 2001 gracias a un vecino que lo invitó a vender productos naturistas, los cuales empezó ofreciendo con sus conocidos y vecinos, después en ferias, los mismos clientes lo fueron recomendando con otras personas y así pudo lograr una buena cartera de clientes e incrementar sus ganancias.

El necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar productos que le permitan surtir los pedidos de sus clientes y de esta forma incrementar sus ganancias y sus comisiones.

loans.use: Purchase products to sell

loans.name: Nhen

texts.en:
Nhen K., 51, is married and lives with her three children in Siem Reap, Cambodia. Since 2005, she has been selling porridge from her home to earn a living and is able to make US$2.50 of profit each day. She is aided by her child who works as a chef and maintenance worker. Her husband, Chab Sat, is a construction worker and make US$3 per day. Mrs. Nhen is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a motor-taxi for extra profit. (Chab is pictured because his wife was not available)

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a motor-taxi for extra profit.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina tiene 41 años, es soltera no tuvo hijos y vive en la casa de su familia.  Es una mujer luchadora, día a día batalla con las redes de pescar en busca de un mejor porvenir, desde las 5 de la mañana se va a orillas del lago Titicaca para iniciar la pesca,  terminando hasta entrada la tarde.  Le gusta su trabajo, el cual ha venido desarrollándolo desde hace ya 21 años, ganando cierta experiencia en cuanto a la pesca se refiere, la única dificultad que a veces tiene, es no contar con la fuerza necesaria para sacar a todos los peces del agua.  Martina está muy motivada, trabaja arduamente para asegurar su futuro y estabilidad económica. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de materiales; como redes, remos, etc., para poder mejorar la pesca y mejorar la venta de su mercadería. En el futuro, le gustaría tener otro tipo de negocio que estabilice su economía.
texts.en:
Martina is 41 years old, is single and has no children and lives in the house with her family. She is a fighting woman; day after day she battles with the fishing nets in search of a better future, from 5 in the morning she goes to the shores of Lake Titicaca to begin fishing, ending in the afternoon. She likes her work, which has been developing since she was 21 years old, gaining some experience as far as fishing is concerned. The only difficulty is that sometimes, you do not have the necessary strength to remove all the fish from the water . Martina is very motivated, working hard to secure her future and economic stability. With the money requested she will buy larger quantities of materials such as nets, paddles, and so on in order to improve fisheries and increase the sale of her merchandise. In the future, she would like to have another kind of business that stabilizes her economy.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials and necessary tools for fishing

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
Né le 1er décembre 1973, Monsieur H. Yaovi est marié et père de 3 enfants tous scolarisés. Elever de volaille dont le rendement devient faible ses derniers temps dû à la grippe aviaire qui a détruit la grande partie de sa volaille. Dans le souci de changer d’activité, il sollicite un crédit en vue de s’acheter une moto neuve et en faire un taxi moto qui est un secteur florissant de nos jours.
Ce crédit débloqué lui permettra d’avoir un métier un peu plus stable et faire face aux besoins de sa famille et ainsi changer son niveau de vie actuelle. Accompagnons le ainsi à sortir de sa situation de crise qu’il traverse suite à la peste aviaire.
texts.en:
Born on 1 December 1973, Mr. Yaovi H. is married and has 3 children, all in school. He is a poultry farmer whose yield has recently become low due to the avian flu, which has destroyed a large portion of his poultry. In the hope of changing his business, he is asking for a loan in order to buy a new motorcycle and to turn it into a motorcycle taxi, which is a flourishing business sector these days. This loan will allow him to have a more stable profession and meet the needs of his family, and thus change his current standard of living. Let us help him get out of the crisis situation he has been in following the avian flu.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Sabet's Group

texts.en:
Sabet L. is the group leader of five villagers from Sre Khtom in Kampong Chhang Province. He is a farmer who earns a living by cultivating rice on his small piece of land. Aside from being a farmer, he is also a photographer. His wife, Mrs. Ung Vanna, is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand her pig-breeding business.  Mr. Sabet L. then decided to request a loan for his wife to buy more piglets for breeding. He is 37 years old and a father of two children who are attending the local school.

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product. This loan is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor because it allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La señora Pascuala, esta casada con el Señor Juan Morel, tienen tres hijos, ya mayores de edad ,hace diez años que se dedica a la venta de ropas en el mercado de San Lorenzo.
Desea que sus hijos sigan estudiando y que tengan una profesión , sueñas con tener un  local de venta de calzado
texts.en:
Mrs. Pascuala V. is married to Mr. Juan Morel and they have three grown children. For the last ten years she has been selling clothes in the San Lorenzo market. Her wish is that her children will be able to continue studying and have a profession. She dreams of having a place to sell footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of athletic shoes, shirts, and tee shirts.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika de 33 años, vive con sus dos hijos; Araceli de 11 años y Alexis de 5, en su casa propia, donde alista la lencería para llevarla a vender. En Puno, si la gente quiere vestir la lencería más bonita, inevitablemente tiene que ir al puesto de Erika, la vendedora más amistosa de ropa, quien ya tiene 10 años vistiendo a los muchos clientes que tiene. Su negocio es uno de los más rentables, debido a las novedades que constantemente pone a la venta, le alegra el día ver que uno de sus productos es del agrado del cliente y siente que lo más difícil de su negocio, es trasladar su mercadería, ya que no tiene quien la ayude, puesto que sus hijos están estudiando. Siendo este su segundo préstamo con MFP, Erika planea pagar a tiempo sus cuotas como es su costumbre. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería, para ampliar su negocio y satisfacer a una mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Erika is 33 years old and lives with her two children, Araceli who is 11 and Alexis, 5 years old. She has her own house, where she gets ready to take her products to sell. In Puno, if someone wants the nicest undergarments, they inevitably must visit Erika’s stand. She is the friendliest of salespeople, who already has ten years tending to customers. Her business is one of the most profitable because of the novelties she is always offering for sale. It makes her day when one of her products satisfies a customer, and she feels one of the most difficult aspects of her business is transporting her products since she does not have any help as her children are in school. Being her second loan with MFP, Erika plans to make her loan installment payments on time as she has before. With the funds requested, she will purchase more merchandise to expand her business and satisfy a greater number of customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a fashion designer and she also sells tailoring materials. She has been in this business for the past eight years. In her community, she is the only person selling tailoring materials. Hence the demands for her goods are high. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. Mary is 27 years old and married with a child. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Zainiddin

texts.en:
Zainiddin is 39 years old. Together with his wife they are raising their three children. Zainiddin is working hard to get a better lifestyle and rise out of poverty. He has a workshop where he repairs electronic products such as TVs, tape recorders, radios, and the like. Today Zainiddin requests $600 to purchase spare parts and supplies to increase his income and be able to send his elder son to university. He promises to repay the loan within 9 months. Your support will really help him; be an important part of the growth of Zainiddin’s business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; its role in ending Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous cultural figures, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC.  Even today, Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, modern Western culture, and Central Asian traditions. Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  A civil war that began soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged Tajikistan's already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition to potential lenders. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase spare parts to grow his electronics repair business.

loans.name: Dariymaa

texts.en:
Dariymaa B. moved in 2005 with her entire family - including her sister, brother-in-law, nieces and parents - from Uvs province in western Mongolia to the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family sought a better life.

After the move, Dariymaa started a small retail shop selling engines for Korean cars in the Ogoomor market, one of the large outside markets in Ulaanbaatar. In 2006, she bought her first large container to keep her inventory at the market (it is common for retail stall owners here to use cargo containers as makeshift warehouses, and even stores). As her business expanded, she bought her second container in 2008. She purchases engines from wholesalers who import them from Korea and resells them at the Ogoomor market for retail prices. Since the inception of her business, she has gained significant experience in the business.

As the business profit allows, she hopes to one day be able to build a small house on her parents' land. She requests a loan to purchase more engines as the season for a yearly state car inspection approaches.

loans.use: To buy Korean car engines

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Mrs. Gloria L., 64, is married and lives in Pines, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is a single parent with one child. She has experienced difficulty being a single parent, but it's not a hindrance for her to move on. She found ways to survive, and opened a “sari-sari” (general store) with a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) in October 2000. She was able to manage the business successfully; in fact, it covers her daily consumption needs and also her child's allowance. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy additional goods for her sari-sari store. She will be happy if she sees her child finish school.

loans.use: Buy additional goods for "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela tiene 16 años de edad, desde muy temprana edad tuvo que trabajar y dejar de estudiar para poder cubrir sus gastos ya que su padre la abandonó; ahora es artesana y confecciona guantes de lana de alpaca y oveja que son vendidos a una mayorista para su posterior comercialización a Europa.
Gabriela vive con su madre y sus pequeños hermanitos en una casa ubicada en la zona Villa Progreso – Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de materia prima, lana de oveja y alpaca, en mayores cantidades lo cual le ayudará a producir mayor cantidad de su producto.

Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la calificación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 16 years old; she has had to work since she was very young when she quit school in order to cover household expenses when her father abandoned her family. Now she works as an artisan making gloves from alpaca and sheep wool, which are sold in Europe by a wholesaler. Gabriela lives with her mother and young siblings in a house located in the Villa Progreso Zone - Rio Seco in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy raw materials in bulk, such as sheep and alpaca wool, which will allow her to produce a greater quantity of product. This is her first loan with Impro and her achievements to date make her eligible for approval of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and alpaca wool to make gloves.

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es: El señor Javier Antonio C., tiene la edad de 40 años, habita en el barrio San Pedro en la comunidad de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica en una casa particular , para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene dos hijos uno de 14 años que actualmente estudia y el otro de 7 años que estudia su primaria , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su pequeños y apoyarlo siempre es sus estudios, don Javier , desde hace cinco años se dedica en  trabajos agrícolas , el inicio esta actividad con sus propios esfuerzos su esposa lo apoya para poder salir hacia delante con sus hijos , la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo y poder vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Don Javier Antonio C. is 40 years old. He lives in the neighborhood of San Pedro in the community of Ticuantepe, with his wife, who works as a housekeeper to help him out with the family expenses. They have two sons, a 14 year-old student and a 7 year-old who attends elementary school. His family plans are to improve living conditions for his little ones and support them with their studies. Don Javier has been a farmer for five years, he began this activity with his own efforts, supported by his wife, in order to get ahead with his children. The most difficult part is lack of financing. With the loan he will buy fertilizers and farm supplies to improve crops and be able to sell at a good price on the market.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farm supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Suraiya Jamil Khan Group

texts.en:
For the past 15 years Suraiya baji, the wife of J. K., has lived in Lahore, Pakistan a city famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. Her husband is a blacksmith who manufactures iron rods that he sells to his customers. Suraiya baji operates a clothes-sewing business to pay for the utilities and to save for rainy days. She is applying for a loan to buy iron for her husband’s business.

The other members of this group are A. Begum baji, who wants a loan to buy shoes to sell, and Razia baji, who wants a loan to buy garments to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron for making iron rods to sell.

loans.name: Oliana

texts.en:
Oliana S., 36, is married with three children.  She has two years of experience in her vegetable business. She sells to the villagers four days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala.

She has no previous loan with SPBD.  SPBD loans are Oliana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, a wheelbarrow, a rake and chemicals

loans.name: Gulshoda

texts.en:
Gulshoda is a woman with much courage who strives to provide for her four children, including food on the table and an education. She has always worked to provide every member of her home with health and well-being. Every day, she goes to the fields, where she is now growing potatoes, wheat and maize. 

Gulshoda was taught farming techniques by her parents as a child and the nature of her work and her eagerness to get ahead in life motivate her in tending her farm every day. Consequently, her farm products are consistently of better and higher quality. Gulshoda needs your support, with this loan, in investing in high quality seeds and fertilizer and improving her harvest. This is why she requires a loan of $900. Let's support this great effort by a mother who wants the best for her children.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL  SANTA ANA

La Alcancía Comunal Santa Ana  esta representada por su presidenta Rosario O. y lo conforman 10 socios de las cuales uno es hombre.
El negocio de la presidenta es de acuerdo a la necesidad del cliente, ella vende artefactos, calzado, cosméticos, negocio que heredo de sus tías desde hace muchos años.
Daisy B. es la tesorera y se dedica a la venta de comida “salchipapas” solo por las noches ya que durante el día ayuda a su suegra en la venta de comida. Ella tiene 2 hijos por los cuales lucha día a día.
La secretaria Rosa S. tiene una bodega desde hace 5 años que lo obtuvo mediante el apoyo de  sus hermanas y de sus padres, con mucho esfuerzo lo está implementado poco a poco ya que es la única furente de ingreso para ella  y sus pequeño hijo.

La mayoría de las socias se dedica a diversas actividades como venta de ropa, calzado, cosméticos, verduras y comida. El Sr. Ángel León se dedica a hacer taxi es casado con un hijo, y con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprar su auto y lo está terminando de pagar en cuotas mensuales.

Los socios conocedores de la competencia en el rubro comercial y de servicios, son muy optimistas y siempre piensan en la mejora familiar.

El crédito otorgado será para la compra de productos e insumos que les permita mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL SANTA ANA The Santa Ana Community Piggy Bank is represented by its president Rosario O. and made up of 10 members. One of them is a male. The president's role works according to the clients' needs. She sells appliances, shoes, and cosmetics. She inherited the business from her aunts many years ago. Daisy B. is the treasurer. She sells food such as “salchipapas” (sausage with potatoes) at night. During the day she helps her mother-in-law sell food. She has two children for whom she fights day-in day-out. The secretary, Rosa S., has had a warehouse for 5 years. She acquired it with her sisters and parents' support. She works hard everyday and little by little she's making it work since it is the only source of income for her and her small son. Most of the members have their own specialty such as selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics, vegetables, and food. Mr. Angel L. has a taxi. He is married and has a son. With a lot of effort, he purchased his car and is finishing paying for it with monthly payments. The members know the competition in the commercial and service industries. They are very optimistic and always think about ways to improve their families. The loan will be used to buy products and materials to improve their profits.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Zamora, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products and materials

loans.name: Ise

texts.en: Ise sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is 45 years old and married with five children. She has been in the business for long. Ise lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Michael

texts.es:
Michael es chofer asalariado de trufi 88 del sindicato Eduardo Abaroa, grupo  Correcaminos y también trabaja como taxista en las noches con movilidad propia siendo estas actividades su fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su  hija pequeña que depende de el; es casado y su esposa no cuenta con un trabajo, vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la Zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para el mantenimiento de su taxi y así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Michael.
texts.en:
Michael is a salaried driver of Trufi 88 (a trufi is a taxi with a fixed route) for the Eduardo Abaroa union, Roadrunner group. He also works as a taxi driver at night, but not on a fixed route. These activities are his source of income, which covers the support of his small daughter who is dependent upon him. He is married, and his wife does not have a job. They live in a rented house in the Tembladerani region of the city of La Paz. The loan is for maintenance of his taxi. That way he can improve his income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of maintenance of his taxi

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena D. is a 43 year-old rice grower. She has nine children; all are school-aged, except for her eldest who is 25 years old. She has been tilling rice fields and farming rice since 2008. Elena hopes that her business will allow her to provide her family with food, clothing and other basic needs.

She would like to request a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Vnetures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farming supplies. Receiving this will help to improve her harvest, as well as, her income.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Jhonna

texts.en:
Jhonna G. is 33 years old. She has been operating a junk shop business for almost one year. Her weekly net income is PHP 2,000.00. She wants a loan of PHP 4,000.00 from KIVA lenders for her additional capital to buy junk materials and she hopes to become productive in due time, to support her family in their needs. 

She is married to Renato G., a farmer and they are blessed with three children.  Jonathan is 10 years old and a grade 5 student, followed by Renato Jr. who is 8 years old and in grade 3. Their youngest is John Rey who is 5 years of age. They are residing at Baranggay San Francisco, Isabela. Their house is located near the rice farm and fish ponds. She hopes that her loan will be granted as soon as possible. She believes that "Prayer changes everything, just have faith on Him."

loans.use: Additional capital for her Junk shop

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de 41 años muy diligente. Sus deseos de superación la motivan para seguir esforzándose por el bienestar de sus 3 hijas; con quienes vive en compañía de su esposo en su humilde vivienda desde hace 3 años.

Nancy es una mujer de 41 años muy diligente. Sus deseos de superación la motivan para seguir esforzándose por el bienestar de sus 3 hijas; con quienes vive en compañía de su esposo en su humilde vivienda desde hace 3 años.

Este es su noveno préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera seguir trabajando con dedicación y puntualidad en sus pagos, al igual que todas sus compañeras de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita adquirirá un mejor puesto en el mercado, más cerca al ingreso, de tal modo podrá exhibir sus productos y ofertarlos de una mejor manera, ya que en ese punto hay mayor cantidad de personas.
texts.en:
Nancy is 41 years old and very diligent woman. Her desire to excel motivates her to continue striving for the welfare of her three daughters. She and her husband have been living in their humble home for three years.

She is requesting her ninth loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA. Like the other members of her Communal Bank, Nancy hopes to continue working with the same level of dedication and making her payments on time. The money she is requesting will be used to secure a better vending location at the market that is closer to the entrance where more people congregate. This will enable her to showcase her products and offer them in a better way.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire a new vending location

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu C. is sells food at a resturant in the market premises and is requesting a loan to purchase soda and water to sell in the restaurant. Dudu is 22 years old and is widowed. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase soda and water to sell in the restaurant

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina G. de 58 años de edad, reside en Usulután junto a su madre y dos hijos. Ella comercializa helados y paletas en su lugar de residencia. A pesar que es un negocio pequeño, ella ha logrado sacar a delante a su familia a través de este, es por esto que Dina solicítia un préstamo, con el fin de surtir su negocio con mayor cantidad de helados y paletas de diferentes precios y sabores, con el fin de  atraer la atención de una mayor cantidad de clientes. Dina es una mujer trabajadora, la cual busca una vida estable, razón por la cual desea mejorar su negocio y obtener mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Dina Gomez is 58 years old and resides in Usulutan together with her mother and two children. She sells ice cream and popsicles out of her home. Although it is a small business, she has managed to help her family get ahead. Dina is requesting a loan for the purpose of stocking her business with a greater quantity of ice cream and popsicles of different prices and flavors, in hopes of attracting the attention of more clients. She is a very hard-working woman in search of a stable life, for which she desires to improve her business and obtain better sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of ice cream for her business

loans.name: John Njuguna

texts.en:
John is 33 years old and married to Monica. They have one son who is 8 years old and one daughter who is 3 years old. John was introduced to Kadet by a Kadet credit officer through marketing outreach in Kabati (his home town). He has no loan credit history with other MFI's (micro-finance institutions). John has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the past six years and also does farming as another source of income. John plans to purchase a motorcycle with the loan he has applied for. He intends to buy dairy cattle with the extra profit he generates from his transport business and his sales of farm produce.

His hopes and dreams are to start a taxi business in his home town. John comes from a humble background. He was once a gardener, and he saved from his earnings on a monthly basis. He later managed to purchase a motorcycle which he is currently using to offer transport service in order to earn some income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Olaribigbé

texts.fr: O. Olaribigbé est née le 31 Juillet 1960 à Parakou, dans le Nord du Bénin. Mariée à AGBE Michel, un chauffeur, Olaribigbé est mère de sept enfants, dont trois sont à sa charge. La famille réside depuis 13ans à PK10 Enafa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Olaribigbé n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Olaribigbé vend des condiments de sauce et divers autres produits (oeufs, sucres, savons, cube, etc.) à son domicile. Olaribigbé s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Olaribigbé a 10 ans d’expérience dans ce domaine, et est à son cinquième crédit à ALIDé. Olaribigbé manque de moyens financiers en ces périodes, pour renforcer davantage son activité et répondre à la demande de ses clients. C’est la raison pour laquelle Olaribigbé sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
O. Olaribigbé was born on July 31, 1960 in Parakou, in northern Bénin. She is married to Agbe Michel, a driver, and is the mother of seven children, three of whom are still dependents. The family has lived in PK10 Enafa, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji, for 13 years. The couple take care of family expenses together. Olaribigbé never went to school.
To provide for her children, Olaribigbé sells condiment sauces and various other products (eggs, sugar, soap, stock cubes, etc.) outside her home. Olaribigbé stocks up in Dantokpa, at the international market of Bénin. She has 10 years experience in this trade and is on her fifth loan with Alidé. At the moment, Olaribigbé lacks sufficient funds to maintain her business and meet customer demands. That’s why she is requesting her fifth Alidé loan.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tomatoes, spices, onions, eggs and sugar

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth R. is from the village of Tabuan in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old. Bernadeth is married and has four young children. To make a living, Bernadeth sells food in the local community. Bernadeth has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Bernadeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase ingredients to make products to sell. This will be Bernadeth's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores R. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 58 years old. Dolores is widowed and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Dolores owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dolores has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Dolores joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dolores has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI. Dolores is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Dolores from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of their family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther U. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She has been selling groceries for a long time. Esther loves her business because her customers pay in cash when they come to purchase groceries. She does not sell on credit to her customers because she does not want to incur debt into her business. She hopes for a loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. Esther  hopes to own a super market in the future. She is a LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organisation) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.  Esther says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a leader of four members of a group. She is a  married woman with two children , both going to school. She resides in and rents a three-roomed house where she lives with five people. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Rose resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells charcoal in Ndeeba market in one of the Kampala suburbs and works seven days a week. She sells to an average of twenty people a day and sells to all categories of people. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work from suppliers who get the charcoal from villages. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for her business, and feeding the family.

Rose has been in this business for the last seven years and has been with MCDT for over six years. She is servicing her fourteenth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more charcoal.

Rose is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and offloading a full lorry (truck) of charcoal.
Rosde was posing with one of her groupmates and was putting on a red T.shirt with a white head gear

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mervic

texts.en:
Mervic D. is an example of a strong woman who can thrive and make a living for the sake of alleviating poverty in her family’s standard of living. Mervic’s main goal is to build a sustainable business to meet the needs of her children; therefore, she was encouraged to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 1999. The previous loans she received from ASHI were carefully invested in her fishing business. Since then, Mervic's business has been performing well and earning her sufficient income. She is grateful that she has been able to educate her children using the proceeds from her businesses as she continues to expand. Mervic and her husband, Manolito, have also embarked on operating a variety store for supplementary income.

Mervic needs a loan to help boost her business and increase her profits. Now on her fifth loan, she is requesting 25,000 pesos as additional capital for her fishing business, to be used to pay for a new motor boat and pay for one videoke (a video karaoke machine) for more revenue.

Mervic is optimistic that she can achieve her dreams of providing a good life for her children and being able to send them to school until they finish college. She also hopes to expand her business, and if possible she will get a stall in the market where she can sell her fish. She hopes that these dreams will come true and that ASHI will, in fact, give the best direction and opportunity to her family.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To pay for a new motor boat and to buy a videoke machine for more revenue.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: La sra. Marisol tiene su puesto de venta de tucumanas y rellenos en la calle Indaburo de la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz, las tucumanas son empanadas de carne que se acompañan con ají de maní y ensaladas, y los rellenos se hacen de papa aplastada y jigote, también se acompaña con ensaladas. Ella tiene un año y medio en esta actividad, su esposo tiene una movilidad la cual por el momento está en el taller de chapista para su refacción, y por esto está trabajando como chofer asalariado con otra movilidad. Tiene dos niños pequeños que por la mañana se quedan con su cuñada, ya que ambos trabajan, y por la tarde se ocupa de ellos; viven en la casa de su suegros, y son muy trabajadores. El crédito será invertido en la movilidad para pagar el saldo que les falta para recogerla del chapista, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y KIva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Marisal has her food stall selling tucumanas and rellenos on Indaburo street in the central part of the city of La Paz. Tucumanas are meat empanadas that are accompanied by a peanut sauce and salad, and rellenos are made of mashed potato and minced meat, also accompanied by a salad. She has worked in this for a year and a half. Her husband has a vehicle, which is currently in a panel beater shop for refurbishment, so he is working as a salaried driver with another vehicle. She has two young children that her sister-in-law watches during the morning, since they both work. She and her husband care for them in the afternoon. They live in their in-laws home and are hard workers. This loan will be invested in the vehicle to pay their balance and reclaim it from the panel beater. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust given by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in vehicle refurbishment

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Bendiya sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles ayant en moyenne 37 ans, 4 enfants et habitant  toutes, Farabougou, un  village de la Commune Rurale de Téssérèla  (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage, de voisinage et de leurs activités commerciales.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments alimentaires tels l’oignon avec Awa C., les friandises, les céréales, les calebasses etc.
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles décidèrent de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso, et sont  à son  tout 1er  prêt solidaire.
Awa C. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 300kg d’oignon frais. Elle s’approvisionne à N’gassola et à Tissala. Elle revend son oignon frais à domicile et à la foire hebdomadaire de Ségou généralement au comptant. 
Madame Awa compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 17.000FCFA qui servira au remboursement  son prêt, à la contribution pour la prise en charge de certaines dépenses familiales et à la participation aux évènements sociaux (mariages, baptêmes et funérailles).
texts.en:
