The ten members of the group Bendiya are married women mostly in large traditional families.  The members average 37 years of age and four children each, and they all live in Farabougou, a village of the rural community of Téssérèla (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through ties of kinship, marriage, and community, and through their businesses.  This group of women does commerce in condiments, such as onions (with Ms. Awa C.), sweets, grains, calabashes, etc. Wanting to increase their working capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their very first solidarity loan.  Awa C. intends to use her loan for buying 200 kg of fresh onions.  She stocks up in N’gassola and in Tissala.  Generally accepting cash, she resells her fresh onions out of her home and at the weekly fair in Ségou,   Awa plans on making a monthly profit of 17,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay her loan, to take part in covering certain family expenses, and participating in societal events (marriages, baptisms, and funerals.)

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fresh onions

loans.name: C2828 Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Marthe is 34 years old, married with 4 children aged between 3 and 10. Marthe’s husband is a driver and they both work for their family's well-being. Marthe is the leader of the group which is called DUFANYE in the local language. This group contains 3 members: two men and one woman.

Marthe who is the leader has an experience of 3 years in selling various styles of clothing. Her shop is open from 6 in the morning to 5 in the evening. 

Marthe and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing their business through purchasing more products for their shops. This loan will allow them to satisfy the demand of their customers. Marthe hopes to earn more profits which will allow her to save money for the future and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: Elias M. M., tiene la edad de 38 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y 4 hijos de 16,14,12 y 2 años de edad, que son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Elías también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Elías M. M. is 38 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 4 children, ages 16, 14, 12, and 2. His family is his biggest priority. He wants a loan to help his farm, specifically to buy manure and fertilizer to grow coffee. Elías hopes to cultivate his coffee well so that he gets a high quality yield at harvest. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the ease with which it was obtained. Elías has worked in agriculture for many years. He hopes to provide a higher quality of life to his family, with better financial stability, and to continue growing as a farmer and as a person.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To assist in growing coffee.

loans.name: Miralyn

texts.en:
Miralyn R. is a married woman who supports her family by running a general store. She lives in Brgy.3 Siaton, Negros Oriental with her husband and their 3 children, who are 26, 28 and 29 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000.

Miralyn is now borrowing PHP 15,000 to use as additional working capital. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Miralyn aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
Mohira, her husband and their three children live in Shahrituz, Tajikistan. With the prime goal of helping her husband with the family expenses, she started her clothing sales business four years ago. This business is a good match for her because she loves sales and is a proficient saleswoman. Throughout the years, Mohira has kept up her business with much effort and dedication. And through this business, she has been able to provide an education for her three children. In order to keep the business growing, she needs a loan of 3,500 Somoni to purchase seasonal clothing. It is important for Mohira and her family to have your support.  

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for kids for the summer season.

loans.name: Kpandjapou Marie

texts.en: Madame Kpandjapou Marie M. is 46 years old. She is single but takes care of her one child.  She lives in Lome, Togo where she has a bar called Buvette Marie. Marie is a very experienced entrepreneur, having had her bar since 1990. In order to increase her offerings and her profits, Marie has requested a loan of 500,000 CFA to purchase more drinks to sell. Hopefully the loan will allow her more working capital to invest in this well-established business.

loans.use: To purchase drinks for her bar

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man living with his mother and one brother in Lebanon. This young man decided in 2008 to start his own business by providing Internet connections to his town and its surroundings. He has been involved in this type of occupation for the past four years. Despite his young age, he is taking care of his family with his business income. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to take care of household expenses, sick and aging family members, and at the same time run a business. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an Internet network in order to expand his business. This type of business is very common in Lebanon. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in Microfinance. At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: Purchase an Internet network

loans.name: María Agustina

texts.es:
María Agustina es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a dos de sus cuatro hijos en la ciudad de Cajamarca, una ciudad ubicada en la sierra norte del país, bastante cococida por sus atractivos paisajes y legado histórico, es también una de las ciudades con mayor movimiento comercial de la sierra del país, se encuentra ubicada a seis horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

María Agustina cuenta con un restaurante desde hace mas de cinco años, ella prepara diversos platos típicos de la región y los ofrece a los diversos turistas y publico en general que transitan por la zona, la buena sazón con la que prepara los productos han hecho que actualmente cuente con una clientela fija y que su negocio se haya desarollado correctamente. Las ganancias que ella percibe de esta actividad las utiliza ayudando a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

María desea adquirir mas insumos que le permitan preparar mas platos de comida, de modo que pueda ampliar su nivel de ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, para lograr su objetivo ha creído pertinente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyma Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer tranquila y amable, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando en su negocio para poder ayudar a su familia a salir adelante, sus clientes y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una mujer honrada y confiable.
texts.en:
María Agustina, 40, lives with her husband and two of her four children in the city of Cajamarca, a city located in the country’s northern mountains, well-known for its attractive scenery and historic legacy. It is also one of the cities with the most commercial activity in the country’s mountain area. It is located six hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. María Agustina has had a restaurant for over five years. She prepares various meals typical of the region for tourists and the general public that travel through the area. Her tasty preparations have led to her having a steady stream of regular customers and to her business’ developing properly. Profits she earns here help her husband meet family expenses. María wants to acquire more ingredients to prepare still more dishes so that her sales will increase and thus her earnings will increase, too. To reach this goal she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a 1000 new sol loan. María is a level-headed, kind person whose greatest wish is to continue working in her business to help her family get ahead. Her customers and acquaintances hold her in high regard and consider her to be an honest and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Mrs. Chanda Soung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people make up this village bank loan based in Tang Ruessei village in Takeo province. They have selected Mrs. Chanda S., who was born in 1968, as their village bank president. They will each use their portion of the loan in different ways to support their businesses. 

Mrs. Chanda S. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Now she has a problem because her field is infertile. So, to improve production, Mrs. Chanda S. is applying fO. a loan to buy fertilizer. She will use the rest of the loan to hire a plow to plow her field. Her husband, Mr. Reth Nget, is a motorcycle taxi driver. She is the mother of three children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rizaldy

texts.en:
Rizaldy P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 45 years old and single. To make a living, Rizaldy owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rizaldy has been engaged in his business for over 20 years.
Rizaldy joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rizaldy is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business and financially support immediate members of his family.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Peter Kintalel

texts.en:
Peter is 27 years old. He buys, raises and sells animals at a profit, especially during peak seasons. He has been doing this type of business in Naivasha town for the past five years. Naivasha is locally well-known as a place for meat roasting {Nyama Choma} and many people go to Naivasha on vacation and weekends to eat roasted meat. So, Peter's business of animal raising is marketable in this place.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He  plans to use the money to buy 23 young sheep, which he will raise and sell later, at a profit, during peak season.

loans.use: To buy 23 young sheep which he will raise and later sell, at a profit.

loans.name: Amévi

texts.fr: amévi s'est lancée en 2005 dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques, elle exerce son activité dans sa boutique qu'elle a appelé" LA CITE DES BELLES FILLES". elle n'a jamais obtenu du crédit de WAGES. actuellement pour faire face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers produits esthétiques 2 cartons de mèches, 4 cartons de crèmes "FIT Fé", 2 cartons de déodorants de diverses marques et divers autres produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Amévi started to sell cosmetic products in 2005. She has a shop called “La cité des belles filles” (city of beautiful girls). She never contracted a loan from WAGES until now.

Her stocks are currently depleted and she is seeking a loan from WAGES to buy various beauty products, two boxes of hair extensions, four boxes of “FIT Fé" lotions, two boxes of deodorants from selected brands, and various other cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Pardahol

texts.ru: Умарова Пардахол проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 40 лет. Не замужем. Образование среднее. Более 4 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Арендует торговую точку, где продает курагу и фисташки. Этот бизнес приносит доход. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Она хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Pardahol U. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 40 years old, single.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in retail sales at a market for over 4 years.  Pardahol leases a retail stall, where she sells dried apricots and pistachios.  This business yields a profit.  Pardahol is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.  She wants to expand her business.

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Peter Biwott

texts.en:
Peter Biwott L., a 32-year-old gentleman, married and the father of two children aged five and two years, lives in Kapsowar- Eldoret. The family's sole breadwinner, Peter has operated a butchery business for five years, earning a profit of about Kshs 20,000 every month.

Peter, a KADET client for a while now, is requesting his second loan after repaying the earlier one well and on time. He is planning to use the amount to buy two cows for his business and hopes to make a profit which he will use to boost his business.

Peter's future plan is to open other branches in order to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy two  cows .

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a taxi driver from Khan Younis city in Gaza Strip. Ibrahim bought a taxi car 5 years ago and has been using it since then. Ibrahim gave the owner of the car a down payment from his savings and started paying the rest of the cost on a monthly basis from his work returns.

Now that Ibrahim has only one payment left, he came to FATEN and took a loan to pay it and fully own the car. The car is two families' source of income as Ibrahim and his son Muhammad (who appears in the picture here because Ibrahim is a conservative man and doesn't want to be in the picture) share use of the car.  The son is married and has his own family.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To pay the last payment on a taxi car

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella B. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 53 years old. Bella is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Bella owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Bella has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Bella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Bella is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Bella from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Fe Y Vida Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fe y Vida está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Brenda F. Medrano, coordinadora del grupo, quien se dedica al comercio de comida y gorros desde hace 4 años. Ella tiene un hijo de 11 años por el cual labora arduamente y desea tener algún día un tramo. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Juana P. de 48 años quien se dedica al comercio de nacatamales, sopas, frescos, helados, rifas y cosméticos Avon y zermat etc. y María Margarita P. comercializa ropa usada desde hace un año.
texts.en:
The Fe y Vida (Faith & Life) Group is composed of three hard working, dedicated, enterprising women.  One of them is Brenda F. Medrano, group coordinator.  She has sold food and caps for four years.  She has an 11 year old son for whom she works hard.  She hopes some day to have her own sales stand.

The other group members are: Juana P., 48, who sells nacatamales, soups, blended fruit drinks, ice cream, lottery tickets, Avon and Zermat brand cosmetics, etc. and María Margarita P. who has sold used clothes for the last year.

loans.use: For basic grains.

loans.name: Mohamed Bonaya

texts.en: Mohamed Bonaya K. is 50 years old, married, and has four children. Mohamed has been a rental house owner and a water vendor for the last six years. This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to renovate the water pump. The anticipated profits have been directed to the expansion of his business. His hope for the future is to add more water pipes.

loans.use: To renovate the water pump

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame Z. sells bread and porridge by moving from one area to another at Elmina. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Maame has been selling porridge for seven years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more maize and other ingredients to prepare the porridge for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

In the pan, she has some baked bread. The cups balanced on the pan are used to serve her customers.

loans.use: buy more maize and other ingredients

loans.name: Rafaela Vanessa

texts.es: Rafaela Vanessa tiene 51 años, su actividad es la venta de leña ella se levanta muy temprano, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre llegan a buscar este producto que es muy necesario. La mayoría de personas le llegan a dejar este producto que a diario ofrece. Se siente muy contenta pues este el primer crédito que realiza y se siente satisfecha de poder contar con esta ayuda para su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de mayor cantidad de leña. El deseo de seguir siempre con su negocio y  pagar todas sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Rafaela Vanessa, 51, sells firewood.  She rises very early because her customers come by always seeking this product which is very necessary.  Most of the people come by for this product which she sells daily.

She feels happy because this is the first loan she’s taken out and she feels satisfied that she can count on this help for her business.

The loan she’s asking for will be used to buy larger amounts of firewood.  Her wish is to stay in business always and make all of her payments.

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Shamshad Khusi Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad has lived in a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, called Kot Radha Kishen, for the past 12 years. Kot Radha Kishen is known for its dairy industry. Shamshad lives in a two-roomed brick house located in Rawal Jhangerh.
Her husband has a Punjabi food business. He sells Dahi Bhaley, which is a famous Punjabi dish made up of yogurt, potatoes and spices. He sells it from a four-wheeled cart which he takes around different streets in the city. Shamshad herself is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and carry out her household responsibilities. She is the mother of four sons. She is unable to provide them with an education due to financial constraints. Her elder son has a barber shop and the others stay at home.
Shamshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy ingredients such as spices, potatoes and yogurt etc. to make larger quantites of Dahi Bhaley, which will help him sell more and make more income. He has been operating his business for ten years and Shamshad is hopeful that an investment will generate more profits and expand his business further. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady holding the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Shamshad.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for Punjabi food (Dahi Bhaley) business

loans.name: Saniya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Saniya sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans et 5 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de leurs activités de petit commerce dans le marché Château de Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente de pâtes alimentaires, de bananes,   de pagnes wax et bazins. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce et de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 6ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Ba Kadia Samaké, qui est la présidente du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une tonne (1000kg) de banane en gros avec les maraîchers de Koutiala au grand marché de Ségou. La revente se fait en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché Château à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Ba  Kadia  Samaké espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer au quotidien. 
Elle a pour objectif à l’image des autres femmes du groupe d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women in the Saniya group are married living mostly in monogomous families. On average they are 48 years old with 5 children each. They all live in the Darsalam neighborhood of Ségou (4th Administrative District of Mali) and met through family connections and through trading at the Château Market in Ségou. 

The members of the group buy and sell pasta, bananas, wax "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and damask cloth. With the goal of increasing their working capital and to pay cash for their supplies, they decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their sixth group loan cycle.

Mrs. Ba Kadia Samaké, president of the group, plans to use her loan to buy a tonne (1,000 kg) of bananas wholesale from the Koutiala growers at the  Ségou Market. She then sells the bananas at retail, for cash and on credit, at home and at the Château  Market, to customers who are both men and women. With this loan, Mrs. Ba Kadia Samaké hopes to make an average monthly  profit of 25,000 CFA francs which will be used to re-invest in the business and to pay for small daily household expenses. Along with the other women in the group, her goal is to increase her level of activity thanks to this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: To buy bananas

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MOSOQ RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Livia; la socia tiene 56 años D. edad, casada y tiene 5 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. ropa americana ella viaja hasta Bolivia para comprar su mercadería para luego distribuirlo a sus amistades, familiares y vecinos, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual trabaja conjuntamente con uno D. sus hijos, la socia está feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota
texts.en:
Livia is a member of the "MOSOQ RUNA” community bank which is located in Cusco district, province and department.

Livia is 56 years old, married, and has 5 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling American clothes.  She travels to Bolivia in order to buy her merchandise and then distributes it to her friends, family members and neighbors.  Livia has been in this business for years and works together with one of her children.  She is happy since the business enables her to get her family ahead in life.

Livia is requesting this loan so that she can buy more merchandise for her business.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new carpet-weaving frame and other important materials

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida F. is 52 years old, married, and has two working children and one child who attends high school. She is a resident of Phase 5-A, Bulihan, Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. 

At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her youngest child to college, a dream for most Filipino parents like Adelaida, as she herself is a high school graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Adelaida has had a tricycle operation (a motorcycle with a passenger cab) for six years now. She hires a driver and remits to her 150 PHP for a day. 

She also manages her own tailoring business while overseeing operations of her ready-to-wear clothing business and a variety store. She mainly sells curtains, bedsheets, blankets, and other items for the home. She also provides clothing such as uniforms and does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 every week from her tailoring business and variety store.

To help her continue operations of her businesses, she is requesting a loan for PHP 23,000. She will be using the loan to pay for the repair of her tricycle and to buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns. She also plans to use the loan to buy additional grocery items as replenishment for her variety store. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her businesses. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for repair of her tricycle and additional items for her tailoring business and store.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Consolacion works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish sales  business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her banana farm and general store.  Consolacion is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her dried fish business.

Consolacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es: Herlinda, de 38 años, es una mujer alegre y emprendedora. Hace 22 años que vive con Walter, quien es su pareja. Ambos tienen 2 hermosos hijos,  Kener y Randi; a los que educan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Alto Yapaz (selva peruana). Sus dos hijos son su motivación para esmerarse en el trabajo cada día, por eso desde hace 5 años se dedica a cultivar café, y plátano, paralelamente es negociante de frutas oriundas de la selva peruana, las cuales compra de sus vecinos y conocidos, los encajona y los traslada hacia los mercados de “Huancayo” y “Lima” para comercializarlos 2 veces por semana. Por otro lado su cónyuge brinda el servicio de transporte público, cubriendo la ruta “Santa Ana”  hasta  “Alto Yapaz”  y viceversa. Pero los días que descansa, ayuda a Herlinda en la agricultura y en el negocio. A ella, le gusta disfrutar de la tranquilidad del campo cuando labora, sin embargo le parece difícil trasladar sus productos hasta los mercados de abastos, por eso los acopia sus cosechas en su tienda. Aunque este oficio, no la desalienta le parece sacrificado y muy rentable porque gracias a las utilidades, puede brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida, a su familia, por eso en el futuro, piensa continuar plantando café en sus chacras pero sobre todo incrementar y surtir los productos de su establecimiento. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los progresistas”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde asegura que continuará laborando de manera activa en su banco comunal, pues el gusta compartir con los integrantes. Herlinda, comenzará la cosecha de café, por ello con el crédito invertirá en el pago de los peones que contratará para que le ayuden en la recolección del grano. Asimismo invertirá en implementar su tienda de comestibles en su casa.
texts.en: Herlinda is 38 years old and is happy and hardworking. She has been living with her partner Walter for 22 years. They both have two beautiful children, Kener and Randi who they educate in their own home which is located in the town of Alto Yapaz (in the Peruvian jungle). Her two children are her motivation to work hard every day which is why she has been growing coffee and bananas for five years. She also sells fruits that are native to the Peruvian jungle which she buys from her neighbors and acquaintances. Twice a week she boxes them and takes them to the markets in Huancayo and Lima to sell. Her husband works in public transportation. He covers the route from Santa Ana to Alto Yapaz and vice versa. On the days that he's off he helps Herlinda in the farming and in her business. She enjoys the tranquility of the country but she finds it difficult to take her products to the food markets which is why she stores her harvests in her store. Although this work does not discourage her it is very profitable because thanks to her profits she can give her family an adequate quality of life. This is why, in the future, she plans on continuing to grow coffee in her fields but especially to increase and supply products to her establishment. She belongs to the community bank "Los Progresistas" (The Progressives) and this is the third loan with field partner MFP and she is sure that she will continue to work actively in the community bank since she likes to socialize with the other members. Herlinda will start the coffee harvest so she will invest the loan in paying the laboreres who she will contract to help her to collect the grain. She will also invest in implementing her grocery store at home.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help her pick coffee.

loans.name: Ana Hilma

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta D. dulces, calcomanias y ropa, inicio este negocio con el apoyo D. su esposo, trabaja en lo propio, no tiene un horario fijo y lleva muchos años D. dedicarse al negocio, su familia está conformada por su esposo y un hijo.
Ella está solicitando préstamo para la compra D. prendas D. vestir como blusas, camisas, pantalones,tambien Juegos para niños y calcomanias, la compra le permitirá incrementar el inventario, teniendo todo lo necesario para vender a los clientes.
Su aspiración es ser una comerciante en granD., crecer en el mercado, conociendo a más clientes y en su hogar espera tener todo lo necesario para una vida digna junto a ellos.
texts.en:
Ana sells candy, decals and clothes. She started the business with help from her husband.  She works on her own without a fixed schedule.  She’s been in business for many years.   Her family consists of her husband and son.

She is asking for a loan to buy articles of clothing like: blouses, shirts, pants, children’s outfits and decals.  The purchase will allow her to increase her inventory having everything she needs to sell to her customers.

Her hope is to be a large merchant, to grow in the marketplace, know more customers and at home, she hopes to have everything necessary for a proper life with her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy clothes and decals.

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim, age 32, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has four children. 

She is engaged in a business of selling vegetables and yams, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who sells palm fruits, earning an income of $5 per day. 

Sarim is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase two cows to help plow the rice field. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy two cows to help plow the rice field.

loans.name: Mega

texts.en:
Mega lives in Uganda. She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school. Mega lives in a home that she owns. She doesn't have access to electricity nor to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include electricity and food.   

Mega has a business of selling things like sugar, salt, soap and bread. She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days out of every week. Mega sells her products at the market by means of retail. She also generates additional income through selling firewood.

Mega has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO that she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and pans of bread.    

The main business challenges for Mega include defaulters and transportation.  

Her business goal is to own a delivery van to ease in transport and also to sell wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and pans of bread.

loans.name: Ekua Grace

texts.en: Ekua sells jewelry by moving from one area to another at Kokoado near Elmina. She is a single parent taking care of one child. She has been in this business for 8 years. She sees to the upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more jewelry to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the child's education.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen is 48 years old and has five children who are in school.

Helen has a fishing business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

Helen has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is separated from her husband and is the mother of one grown child. Carmen is 57 years old. To live, she has spent 31 years of her life sewing different styles of dress. She accepts orders and makes her own designs, too.  One good thing about it - Carmen owns the sewing machine and is not merely working for other tailoring shops.  She makes approximately PHP 3,800 a month.

This year Carmen joined GDMPC. On her first loan application, she has requested PHP 5,000. This will be used to purchase sewing materials, such as threads, fabrics, etc.  Carmen hopes to receive more orders and create gorgeous and salable designs, using the additional sewing supplies, to increase her monthly sales.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials such as thread, textiles, etc.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther’s group is comprised of four hard working women. Esther is 21 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Esther has a tailoring business, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials for making clothes to sell.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Esther hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. In the future, Esther hopes to expand her business.  Esther is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making clothes to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 58 years old and married.  To earn a living, he rears pigs.  He also does dairy farming to supplement his income.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business hence improving his standard of living.
  
David hopes to grow his business further so that he can generate more income.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more pigs.

loans.use: To buy more pigs.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
To make her living, Mary Rose has engaged in the sale of lipstick, lotions and perfumes for 15 years. She also sells cooked snack foods like banana-que and barbe-que. Mary Rose is 43 years of age and blessed with three children.

With the profits earned from her business, Mary Rose was able to send two of her children to school and is proud to share that they are now professionals.

Mary Rose is industrious. She continues to manage her business and hopes to improve her income and allow her third child to finish his college courses.

Mary Rose needs additional capital of P10,000 to buy eggs, bananas, flour and sugar for the ingredients of her cooked snack foods.

loans.use: to buy eggs, bananas, flour and sugar for the ingredients of her cooked snack foods.

loans.name: Estebana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Estebana, de 48 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, ella es comerciante se dedica a vender atoles (una bebida hecha de maíz y leche) y también se dedica al servicio de Lavandería, su nivel académico es básico solo llego hasta el tercer grado de la primaria. Empezó en este negocio por herencia familiar ya que su madre se dedicaba a vender atoles en la comunidades aledañas a la ciudad de León y esto e sirvió de experiencia es así como se gana la vida honradamente, sale a vender de manera ambulante todos los días y por las tardes  se dedica a lavar ropa ajena.
Ella realizo el préstamo para comprar materia prima como maíz, leche, azúcar, canela para elaborar sus atoles. Con esta inversión podrá adquirir mas materia prima para trabajar y vender más su producto. Ella desea ampliar su negocio, darle una mejor presentación a su producto  para hacerlo mas atractivo y poder venderlo  por mayor cantidad en el mercado municipal.
texts.en:
48-year-old Estebana lives in the city of León.  She is a single mother and has two children.  She is a saleswoman who sells 'atole' (a drink made from corn and milk).  She also provides a laundry service.  Her academic level is basic as she only studied up to the third grade of elementary school.

Estebana started out in this business as it was a family inheritance.  Her mother used to sell 'atole' in the communities surrounding the city of León and this provided her with experience.  Estebana earns an honest living in this business, going out to sell her products every day as an itinerant vendor.  In the afternoons, she washes other people's clothes.

Estebana took out this loan to buy raw materials such as corn, milk, sugar and cinnamon for making her 'atole'.  As a result of this investment, she will be able to acquire more raw materials with which to work and will sell more drinks.  She would like to expand her business and better present her product, to make it more attractive.  She would like to sell in larger quantities in the town market.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as corn, milk, sugar and cinnamon for making her 'atole' drinks

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 26 years old, married and has 2 children who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Divina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Divina requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing.

Divina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Divina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 25-year-old young man.  He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary.  He also has a home products sales store.  Naser wants to purchase more home products to have a better collection for sale, such as cups and dishes for different uses, dinning sets, etc. but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan for $2,000 from FATEN.  When Naser gets the loan, he will be able to purchase new collections of home products and have the ability to compete well with others, so his sales will increase and his income will improve.  This will provide Naser with better living conditions. 

Naser is photographed in his store.

loans.use: buy home products to resell

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel de treinta y uno años de edad vive con sus hijos. Ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, leche entre otros, su negocio es muy conocido en la zona pues es el más surtido de mercadería, las personas siempre encuentran lo que necesitan con artículos de calidad, a un buen precio y con una atención excelente; María es una mujer muy activa siempre se encuentra enfocada en su trabajo le gusta mantenerse al frente de la competencia para ella los que siempre miran para adelante con positivismo y entrega son los grandes triunfadores, es así con ese pensamiento positivo como se ha decidido a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos como granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, pan, bebidas, jabones etc. María Isabel tiene fe que con su esfuerzo lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Isabel, 31, lives with her children.  She has a store where she sells basic staples like rice, beans and milk, among others.  Her store is very well known in the zone because it’s the best stocked and people always find what they need with quality products at good prices with excellent service.  

María is a very active woman who is always focused on work; she likes to stay ahead of the competition.   She believes that those who always look ahead with a positive attitude and dedication are the great successes.  It’s with this positive attitude that she decided to ask Integral for a loan to buy basic grains, instant products, snacks, bread, beverages, soap, etc.  María Isabel trusts that she’ll manage a better quality of life for her family with her effort.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Areen

texts.en:
Areen is a 29-year-old mother of three daughters and one son. She is married to Ayman who works as a driver.

Areen has been making fake flowers and plants for the last four years and sells them as decorations whether to companies or private houses. She also makes baskets and decorates trays for special events.

Now she has applied for a loan to buy more materials that are needed to make the items she sells so she can make more profit and open a special store to sell different types of decoration pieces. 

Because Areen is a conservative person, she asked her husband Ayman to be in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making fake flowers and decorating baskets.

loans.name: Secundario De Jesus

texts.es: El Señor Secundario tiene 70 años,  el recibí una pensión del seguro social y con mucho sacrificio ha logrado obtener sus cosas. Solicita el crédito para la compra cemento, bloques, arena, entre otros. Sueña con mejorar cada día su vivienda y proporcionarle las mejoras correspondientes. Siempre ha sido un hombre trabajador y que le ha enseñado a sus dos hijos a trabajar de manera independiente es así que él se siente muy satisfecho en haberle enseñado lo necesario y actualmente ellos puedan mantenerse.
texts.en: Secundario is 70 years old; he receives a social security pension and with much sacrifice has managed to obtain his things.  He’s asking for a loan to buy cement, concrete blocks and sand, among others.  He dreams with improving his dwelling every day and to give it the corresponding improvements.  He’s always been a hardworking man who taught his children to work independently and he feels very satisfied to have taught them what was necessary so that they can support themselves now.

loans.use: to buy cement, concrete blocks and sand, among others.

loans.name: Lavonga Farmers Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Lavonga Farmers Group in Western Kenya! Phaustine is the facilitator of the group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Phaustine takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Phaustine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Phaustine will ensure food security for her family and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Lavonga Farmers group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mercy Magaly

texts.es:
La Señora Mercy es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, esta parroquia tiene una belleza que se mezcla entre la verde naturaleza y lo labrado de sus campos, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.
 
La Señora Mercy tiene 19 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una niña de un año. Su esposo es empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su suegra con quien comparte los gastos de su hogar.
 
Ella pasa en casa cuidando de su hija y también se dedica a la cría de cerdos, pollos, cuyes y ganado a los cuales los vende en su comunidad.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su suegra, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos, pollos y cuyes para crecer en esta actividad.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Mercy is a member of the communal bank, Nuevo Amanecer, and lives in the Parish of Zhidmad in Cuenca.  This Parish is known for its natural beauty and its farms in the fields, where people tend to maintain the culture and the tradition of their parents.  

Señora Mercy is 19 years old, married, and has a one-year old baby girl.  Her husband is privately employed.  They do not own their own home and as such live in Mercy's mother-in-law's house with whom they share the household costs.

Mercy spends her time taking care of her daughter at home and also raises pigs, chickens, guinea pigs, and cattle, which she then sells in her community.  

This is the first credit that she is applying for with this communal bank.  She plans to invest her credit in the purchase of pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs in order to increase her sales.  Her ultimate objective is to have her own home.

loans.use: purchase pigs, chicken, and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña Katupyry se llama el grupo formado en la ciudad de Itá, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y tienen la esperanza de que por medio de la fundación paraguaya y sumado al trabajo de cada una puedan salir adelante y ayudarse.
Una de las miembros es la señora Maria, quien se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de joyas. Ella comenta que tiene buena clientela ya que siempre recibe muchos pedidos y eso la ayuda a tener los medios necesarios para poder mantener a su familia. Una de sus metas es tener un negocio grande donde pueda vender sus joyas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pulseras, cadenas, anillos y demás tipos de joyas con las cuales podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Kuña Katupyry” is the name of the group formed in the city of Itá.  They are very hardworking women who hope through Fundación Parguaya and through the work each one of them does to be able to get ahead and help each other.

One of the members is María who sells all types of jewelry.  She comments that she has a good clientele because she always gets many orders and this helps her to have the necessary means to support her family.  One of her goals is to have a large store where she can sell her jewelry.

She asks for the loan to buy bracelets, chains, rings and other types of jewelry to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married woman who has one child. She is 28 years old, residing at Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. 

Elma used her last loan to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Elma's business is now in progress. She is requesting a new loan to purchase additional products to sell. She hopes to expand/improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz Adelina

texts.es:
Beatriz Adelina tiene 40 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y los hijos de 14, 7 y 4 años de edad en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely grande, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.
Beatriz Adelina se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en ventanas.

 Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, abonos, fertilizantes, líquido para plagas. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá seguir trabajando en la agricultura y tener mejor estado financiero.

Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas cómo la langosta, horosco y la cinta roja. El sueño es comprarse terrenos y seguir trabajando.
En el tiempo libre le gusta enseñar a los niños las tareas para la escuela y el colegio.
texts.en:
Beatriz Adelina is 40 years old, and she is married with three children. She lives with her husband and her children aged 14, 7 and 4, in Ventanas, province of Los Ríos.

She is a member of VRC NUEVO HORIZONTE, located in Cachely Grande which belongs to Ventanas Canton. The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

Beatriz Adelina makes a living growing corn. She both buys and sells her agricultural products in Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies, manure, fertilizers and pesticides.  With the support of the loan she will be able to continue farming and have a better financial situation.

She faces challenges like pest infestations like locust, "horosco" and "cinta roja" (red stripe). Her dream is to buy land and continue working.

In her free time she likes to teach her children their school assignments and homework.

loans.use: to buy supplies, manure, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Ndosho Group

texts.fr: La cliente Vumilia, membre du groupe de crédit Ndosho, Femme  dynamique, entrepreneur, âgée de 40 ans. Elle fait les transactions frontalières de vente de tabac (en l’état brut) de la RDC vers le pays voisin (Rwanda). Son mari est sans emploi. Il y a  15 ans qu’elle  fait le petit commerce frontalier. Elle bénéficie régulièrement des crédits  de Hekima pour renforcer ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  9eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  d’acheter 2 colis de tabac soit 500 kg.  En dépit de tout, cette affaire de tabac est chèrement soumise aux taxes. En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et acheter une parcelle dans le futur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
Vumilia, age 40, is a member of the group Femme Dynamique (Dynamic Woman). She is an entrepreneur who has been engaged in border trading of raw tobacco from the DRC to Rwanda for 15 years. Her husband is currently unemployed. She often seeks financial assistance from Hekima to strengthen her activities. Her profits help to boost her savings, and to pay for food and for her children’s tuition. 

With her business showing growth throughout the last cycle, she has applied for her 9th loan and opted to seek a larger amount than usual. She will use this new loan to purchase two packs of tobacco totaling 500 kg. However, this tobacco trade is subject to heavy taxes. 

She wants to see her children grow up, and hopes someday to buy a plot of land. She wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping low-income women to become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to purchase two packs of tobacco totaling 500 kg for resale.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto es un joven de 27 años de edad, es profesor le gusta enseñar a las personas y niños actualmente  vive en la casa de algunos parientes, donde recibe algunos malos tratos que no le gustan, también trabaja como moto taxista por las tardes, después de dictar clases en la mañana, tiene una motocicleta el cual le permite generar ingresos económicos para su sobrevivencia donde prácticamente trabaja para poder tener ingresos todo el resto del tiempo, hasta en lluvia, y a veces en las noches, según su necesidad. El joven solicita el crédito para la compra de una motocicleta nueva para poder tener más ingresos contratando un chofer y así podrá buscarse otro lugar donde vivir, más cómodamente, además el cuanta que tiene una hija pequeña a la cual no ha podido conocerla pero quiere asegurarse un espacio donde pueda darle un lugar seguro y cómodo así como también mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Roberto, 27, is a teacher who likes to teach people and, currently, children.  He lives in some relatives' house where he doesn't like that he has received some bad treatment.

He also works as a motorcycle taxi driver in the afternoon after teaching class in the morning.  He has a motorcycle that allows him to generate income to survive.  He works practically all the rest of the time so he can have an income, even in the rain and sometimes at night as necessary.

The young man is requesting the loan to buy a new motorcycle to be able to have more income by hiring a driver.  This way he'll be able to look for another place to live more comfortably.

He also says he has a small daughter whom he hasn't been able to get to know, but for whom he wants to give a secure and comfortable space as well as a bigger income.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Safietou

texts.fr: Safiétou née en 1980 habite au sud du Sénégal mariée,mère de 3 enfants qui sont tous dans l'école arabe. Safiétou capitalise une expérience de 3 ans,elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000f pour acheter des produits tel que le miel et l'huile de palme pendant la période de récolte dans les villages environnant en grande quantité pour venir revendre dans sa localité et à Dakar dans la capital du Sénégal.Elle a comme ambition aider son mari a avoir une maison dans sa localité,devenir une grande commerçante et aller vendre son miel dans les pays arabe comme Maroc,Egypte.

loans.use: ACHAT HUILE DE PALME ET MIEL

loans.name: Mayram

texts.en: Mayram was born in 1961 year. She is widowed and has a child. Mayram has been busy with growing crops and potatoes more than 15 years. She has additional income from animal husbandry. She feeds cows. Mayram is very hardworking woman and manages with business alone. Mayram is going to make new sowing of potatoes but she has not money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Roman

texts.en: Roman is 36 years old. He is married and has 2 children. His wife Natalia and Roman have been working for 5 years in a grocery. Roman wants to buy fruits and vegetables to sell them at worktable from open air market.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell at worktable on open air market

loans.name: Batoul

texts.en: Batoul is a 23 years old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two aged school children. Her husband is the main income source in the family, he is a sergeant in the Lebanese army since 2006. As for her she doesn’t work she is dedicated to her house and family. Today, she is in need to borrow a loan from kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay school fees for her children. She is very happy that she will be able to ensure a respectable education for them. She said that this loan will help her to be more support in her family.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
This business is located in Poum Kmey, Dangkar District, Dangkar Commune, outside of Phnom Penh City

Keo S. is married and has 5 children. She lives with her husband in Phnom Penh nearby suburbs and they run their business together at home, with the help of one of their sons and one additional employee. The four of them manage to produce two big music instruments every month, out of the yellow wood provided by the partner who markets their production. Each piece is bought for $60 by the shopkeeper, so that this activity generates a monthly income of $120.

With a loan of $1500, Keo S. will acquire a wood carving machine, worth $250, and a motor, worth about $100, to increase the volume and the quality of her production. She will also purchase her own stock of yellow wood, $50 per piece, and other materials required in her activity. This will allow her to substantially increase the income of her family, as these music instruments are usually sold $200 in Phnom Penh markets. We want to expand this business, S. said, because we love doing it. S. has chosen a 12 months loan term and CREDIT loan officer will visit her monthly for repayment collection.

loans.use: Buying a wood carving machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gladys would like to buy shares from the stock exchange market.

loans.name: Vartiter

texts.en:
Vartiter has a small indoor kiosk where she offers a nice selection of kitchen ware, dishes and utensils. Originally, Vartiter trained to be a journalist. She has a degree from the prestigious Shevchenko University in Kiev, which is one of the best schools in Ukraine. Like many trained Ukrainian professionals, however, Vartiter now works as a market vendor due to a lack of good paying professional jobs.

After working for a time as a leather goods specialist, Vartiter started her current business, which she has now operated for several years. Nadiya Ukraine has previously assisted her with four different loans. She has requested an additional loan of $1000 for two purposes. She needs to purchase additional inventory for her current business, and she would also like to use some money to help open a second sales kiosk where she could begin selling clothing items. She is hoping that by expanding her overall business enterprise and moving into a new area of retail she will be able to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

Вартітер – власниця невеликого кіоску, вона торгує кухонним приладдям, посудом та обладнанням. Вона отримала освіту журналіста. Вчилася в престижному вузі ім. Тараса Шевченка в Києві, а цей вуз вважається одним з найкращих в Україні. Однак, як і багато інших спеціалістів, через брак робочих місць Вартітер зараз працює на ринку продавцем. Певний час вона торгувала шкіряними виробами, потім вирішила почати власну справу. Займається цим бізнесом вже декілька років. Від „Надії України” отримала 4 позики, вчасно їх сплативши. Зараз Вартітер просить про наступну позику в 1000 доларів через декілька причин. Вона хоче закупити додатковий інвентар, щоб розширити асортимент в своєму кіоску, а також використати іншу частину коштів для того, щоб відкрити другу торгову точку з продажу одягу. Вартітер сподівається, що завдяки розширенню власного бізнесу вона зможе підвищити власні прибутки та покращити рівень життя своєї родини.

loans.use: Increase inventory and open new location

loans.name: Melina

texts.es:
Melina has a mechanic's shop where she works with her husband, they do not have any employees and they make all types of repairs on motorized vehicules. Their shop and home are located in the zone Copacabana in the city La Paz. This is the fourth loan that they have applied for. Their history with our organization classifies them as a "Client 2," which means that they have regularly met their re-payment obligations. The three previous loans they applied for were all payed back in their entirety. The loan they now apply for will be used to purchase tools ( jacks, presses, and a soldering tool etc.) Their previous loans and their work make them ideal candidates for another loan, as they already have work experience and enough income to cover the re-payments.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Melina tiene un taller de mecánica donde trabaja con su esposo, no tiene empleados y realizan todo tipo de arreglos de vehículos motorizados. Su taller y domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la Cuarta vez que solicita un crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución lo califica como cliente 2, es decir con cumplimiento regular en el pago de su obligación. Los tres préstamos anteriores fueron pagados en su totalidad. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de herramientas (Gatas, prensas y arco de soldar etc.) Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna O. is 52 years old. She is widowed with 6 children. She has been in the business of selling plastic rubber, maize and drinks for six months. Additionally, she has a machine for grading tomatoes and maize, which she uses in her business. People living in her community like buying from her. She needs the above loan to buy another machine for grading and goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provision, food stuffs & machines for grading

loans.name: Nohemi De Los Angele

texts.es:
Nohemi has had her business for over thirty years. She started it when she was very young and counted on the support of her husband who, in the 1980s, worked for ENABAS, a state agency in charge of gathering and distributing basic grains.

Her business started aa a humble one, with a few bags of products, because her start-up capital was limited. Then her husband stopped working for ENABAS and started to work in the store with her to inrease sales and supplies. Through their hard work, they were able to start another grocery stand near their first one in order to make up for low sales due to the economic crisis that was affecting their country. Thanks to her hard work, Mrs. O. is now able to put their three children through professional school.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Esta señora tiene más de 30 años de tener su negocio, ella inicia desde muy joven y contó con el apoyo de su esposo quien en los años 80´s trabajaba para ENABAS, órgano del estado que se encargaba del acopio y distribución de la producción de granos básicos.

El negocio empieza de forma humilde, con unos cuantos sacos de algunos productos, debido al capital inicial reducido. Luego su esposo deja de laborar allí y se integra al negocio para apoyarle en la venta y abastecimiento de Mercadería. Producto del esfuerzo de ambos señores, ellos logran poner otro pequeño puesto de abarrotes junto al puesto inicial como una forma de compensar las bajas ventas producto de la crisis económica que sufre la población del país. Gracias a su esfuerzo, la señora O. está formando profesionalmente a sus tres hijos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jumaboi

texts.en: Jumaboi Jalabnoev is an experienced cattleman as he has been in this business for over 12 years. He has his own farm where he has 6 bulls and two cows. Additionally he has agrarian property where he handles wheat. Every season he gives his harvest to the collective farm and uses the hay from the fields for his livestock. Currently he is requesting a loan for purchasing fertilizer to improve the harvest.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer to grow more wheat for hay

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.es:
Juvenal is 48-years-old. His family consists of 6 people: Juvenal, his wife, and their four children, who are 15, 12, 11, and 9. He works at the Empresa Venado, where he is a welder. He also does tailoring work in his home on weekends and holidays. In both activities, he has broad experience of 8 years, and he is a hard-working and entreprising person. The competition in both activities is average since the labor market offers people that offer these types of services to private institutions. On the other hand, Juvenal's finished product is what sets him apart. With this request, he will acquire a motorcycle to be able to move around more quickly. This will cost between $700-800. His previous credit record is very good.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Juvenal tiene 48 años de edad, su familia se encuentra compuesta por seis personas él, su esposa y sus cuatro hijos que son de 15, 12, 11 y 9 años respectivamente. Juvenal es empleado dependiente de la Empresa Venado, ocupa el cargo de soldador, por otra parte y de forma particular realiza trabajos de sastrería en su domicilio los fines de semana y días feriados. En ambas actividades tiene una amplia experiencia de 8 años, es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora. La competencia en ambas actividades es media ya que el mercado laboral ofrece personas que ofrecen este tipo de servicios a las instituciones privadas, por otra parte en el rubro de la sastrería la calidad de acabado final es lo que le distingue. Con la presente solicitud adquirirá una motocicleta para poder trasladarse con mayor rapidez, el costo de la misma fluctua entre los $us. 700.- a $us. 800.-. Sus antecedentes crediticios son muy buenos.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Manowoha

texts.fr:
47 years old, Mrs. Manowoha K. is married and has seven (07) children. With her business selling maize, she is able to contribute towards the household expenses. Currently, she has gained a great deal of experience, which allows her to profit well from her business. Thanks to her excellent management skills, she has been able to repay all her previous loans without incident.

She is asking for a loan of $350 to increase her storage capacity, in order to sell her products in times of need. The realization of this dream will be very beneficial to her, and she will also succeed in satisfying her clientele and better meeting the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 47 ans, Madame K. Manowoha est une femme mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants. Avec son commerce de vente de maïs, elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du ménage. Aujourd’hui, elle a acquis une grande expérience qui lui permet de bien profiter de son activité. Grâce à son sens élevé de gestion, elle a pu rembourser tous ses crédits antérieurs sans incident.

Elle sollicite un financement de $350 pour augmenter sa capacité de stockage afin de vendre ses produits en temps de pénurie. La réalisation de ce rêve lui sera très bénéfique, aussi elle réussira à bien satisfaire sa clientèle et mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock maize

loans.name: Magamaga Central C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Safia N.. She is currently in the business of selling chapati and is requesting a loan to add to her business by buying more baking flour and eggs. Safia is 40 years old and is married. She has 7 children ranging from age 9 to 26 and her children go to school. Each week, Safia makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. Safia has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Safia is joined in her small group by Hajirah Aliwebwa. Hajirah Aliwebwa has a business in used clothing sales and wants to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To expand chapati business

loans.name: Kumriddin

texts.ru:
Kumriddin Minochovich S., 45, is a resident of Yavan district. He is married and has six children. He has a secondary school education and does not have a job. His family's only source of income is their private livestock business in the village. Kumriddin has a small cowshed, where he raises calves to sell. He buys young animals at the Yavan markets, fattens them over 40-45 days, and then sells the fattened animals back at the same markets. Now, the season for buying and selling animals has begun and Kumriddin needs to increase his turnover. To do this, he needs extra money, so he has applied to MLF HUMO for a loan. The additional money will not only help Kumriddin increase turnover; it will also give his family badly needed income and help them improve their lives. Kumriddin plans to repay the loan over ten months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Самадов Кумриддин Миночович житель Яванского района. Возраст 45 лет , женат и имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее, нигде не работает . Единственным источником дохода его семьи является занятие частным предпринимательством в сфере животноводства, что актуально в сельской местности. Имеет небольшой коровник, в нем он разводит бычков для продажи. Покупает молодых животных на рынке Явана , откармливает их около 40-45 дней , после того как они подрастут , клиент их продает там же , на тех же рынках. Сейчас начался сезон торговли животными , поэтому клиенту нужно как –то увеличить товарооборот. Для этого ему необходимы дополнительные деньги, а для этого он обратился к нам и хочет получить кредит. Дополнительные средства помогут ему не только увеличить товарооборот , но и получить доход в котором он так нуждается. Это поможет его семье немного улучшить свою жизнь. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Mary M.. She is married and has two children, ages 5 and 10.

In 2006, Mary established her soft drink and clothing business. Mary requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks and to expand her range of clothing. She thanks you for your support.

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, but I’m sure they’re working on it!). The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing; a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase clothing and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Águeda

texts.es:
From the time she gave her daughters the gift of life, Mrs. Agueda made an effort to succeed with her business of selling hats that she makes herself with a lot of diligence and with the help of her younger daughters whom are her reason for being. Agueda is a native of the province of Melgar, but for the last 6 years she has been in the city of Juliaca, she left her native town with a lot of expectations of prospering and offering a better quality of life to her young children whom are her motivation to keep on going, thanks to her enthusiasm and good will that she demonstrates in her activities, the diligent mother is succeeding in meeting her goal of a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde que les otorgó el don de la vida a sus hijas doña Águeda se esfuerza y persevera aún más en su negocio de venta de golosinas y gorras que ella misma con mucha diligencia confecciona con apoyo de sus menores hijas quienes se convirtieron en su razón de ser. Águeda es natural de la provincia de Melgar, pero hace 6 años radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, salió de su pueblo natal con muchas expectativas de prosperar y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus menores hijas quienes son el motor que la impulsa a seguir adelante, gracias al entusiasmo y buena voluntad que pone en sus actividades esta diligente madre está logrando concretar su anhelo de mejorar su condición de vida.

loans.use: To increase her capital to make a better quantity of hats.

loans.name: Faeziddin

texts.ru:
